loans.name: Saturnino

texts.es: Saturnino de 46 años de edad se dedica al cultivo de maiz y frijol desde hace varios años, cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la almacena en los graneros que muestra la fotografía para luego salir a comercializarla en los alrededores de la zona,  de esta forma es como se gana la vida y puede llevar el pan de cada día a su hogar. La actividad del cultivo la realiza año con año. Es un hombre muy trabajador, honrado y responsable, no se cansa de trabajar y de dar lo mejor a su familia, vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijos. Ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un crédito para comprar los principales insumos agrícolas: abonos, venenos para plagas, semillas, etc. Espera tener resultados favorables ya que no cuenta con otra fuente de ingresos. Confía en Dios que logrará obtener una cosecha abundante la cual le permitirá seguir llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar.
texts.en:
Saturnino is 46 and has been farming corn and beans for many years. When his harvest is ready he stores it in the silos shown in the picture in order to then market it around the area. This is how he earns a living and brings home the daily bread. He performs the farming activities year after year. 
He is a hard working man, honest and responsible and does not tire of working and giving his all for his family. He lives in his own home with his wife and two children. He has decided to request a loan to purchase the basic agricultural supplies: fertilizer, pesticides, seeds, etc. He hopes to have favorable results since he has no other source of income. He trusts in God that he will be able to obtain an abundant harvest which will allow him to keep providing the daily bread for his home.

loans.use: purchase fertilizers, pesticides, seeds, etc.

loans.name: Amadiyatoun Group

texts.fr:
Amadiyatou est un regroupement de femmes de Koutiala qui vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 41 ans, sont mariées et au moins 6 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels, de produits cosmétiques, habillements, légumes,  fruits et divers. Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur troisième prêt de groupe. 
Korotoumou  est un membre du groupe assise au milieu, vendeuse des fruits et légumes. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter au fur et à mesure des fruits et légumes. Elle se procure de ces articles à Koutiala. Elle les vend en détail au comptant à la maison et au marché  à une clientèle diverse. 
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe Amadiyatou comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 115000  chacune au  cours de ce cycle Mme Korotoumou  compte réaliser  130 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnelles et augmenter son fonds de commerce. 
Elles souhaitent voir renforcer ce partenariat avec  Soro Yiriwaso pour que les stocks ne soient pas rares.
texts.en:
Amadiyatou is a group of women of Koutiala who live in large traditional families with their husbands, children, and other relatives. The women average 41 years of age, are married, and have at least six children. This group of women does commerce in a variety of goods, such as cosmetics, clothing, fruit & vegetables, and more. 

To expand their businesses, the group members decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program. They are now on their third group loan. 

Korotoumou is group member sitting in the middle in the photo. She is vendor of fruit & vegetables. She intends to use her loan to purchase fruit & vegetables as needed. She procures these goods in Koutiala. Her sales are made retail to a diverse customer base paying with cash at her house and at the market. 

While the other Amadiyatou group members plan on making an average profit of 115,000 francs CFA each over the course of the cycle, Ms. Korotoumou plans on making 130,000 francs.

In addition to paying back the loans, the women use part of the revenues to cope with personal expenses and to increase their business capital. They would like to see this Soro Yiriwaso partnership bolstered, so as to avoid inventory shortages.

loans.use: to purchase fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Rokia

texts.fr:
Née à Koutiala,  Madame  Rokia  est âgée de 36 ans, mariée et mère de 6 enfants. Elle vit dans une famille polygame  avec sa coépouse, son mari et leurs enfants à Koutiala (Région de Sikasso). 
Rokia n’a pas eu la chance d’étudier, ce qui justifie son intérêt pour les activités génératrices de revenus à savoir l’achat et vente de pagnes wax, chaussures, Perles  et autres depuis plusieurs ans.  Elle est très bien sollicitée par ses clients.  
Pour augmenter la taille de son activité et satisfaire sa clientèle, elle a décidé de rejoindre  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il  y a cinq ans. Elle a pris des prêts solidaires (prêt de groupe) tous remboursés correctement et est à son 6ème  prêt individuel.  
Avec ce nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter des stocks de marchandises constitués des rouleaux de pagnes wax, des douzaines de chaussures et Perles. Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako et Koutiala. Elle effectue sa vente dans la ville de Koutiala à une clientèle mixte en détail, au comptant et à crédit.  
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 75.000FCFA, qu’elle utilisera pour le remboursement de ses échéances, participer aux dépenses quotidiennes de sa famille et poursuivre son activité avec le reste.
texts.en:
Born in Koutiala, Ms. Rokia is 36 years old, married, and the mother of six. She lives in a polygamous family with her co-wives, husband, and their children in Koutiala (Région de Sikasso). Rokia did not have the chance to go to school, thus justifying her interest in revenue-generating businesses, that is, the buying and selling of Wax ’pagnes’ (the colorful cloth of western Africa), shoes, beads, and other goods for several years. She is much in demand by her customers. 

To expand her business and to satisfy her customers, she decided to join the the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso five years ago. She has take out solidarity loans (group loans), all paid back correctly, and is now on her sixth individual loan. 

With this new loan, she intends to purchase stocks of merchandise, including of rolls of Wax ‘pagne’ cloth, dozens of shoes, and beads. She gets her supplies in Bamako and Koutiala. Accepting cash or credit, she makes her sales retail to a mixed customer base in Koutiala City.

She plans on making a monthly profit of 75,000 francs CFA to make her payments, help cover day-to-day family expenses, and pursue her work with the rest of it.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of merchandise

loans.name: Belemnaaba Group

texts.fr:
Mme TALATO  représente le groupe BELMNABA. Elle se porte bien. Mariée, elle est mère de 04 enfants. Le plus âgé a 27ans et le moins âgé a 24ans. 04 vont  à l’école.
Mme vend des légumes et aussi des céréales depuis 10ans. Elle s’approvisionne aux marchés environnants. 
Elle veut s’acheter 20 sacs de choux, 20 sacs d’oignons  et 05 sacs de mil.
Avec ses bénéfices, elle veut réinvestir dans son activité et aider à la scolarisation des enfants. Mme ambitionne  ouvrir un grand magasin de stockage.
texts.en: Ms. TALATO represents the group BELMNABA. She is doing fine. She is a married mother of four children, of whom the oldest is 27 years old, and the youngest is 24. Four attend school. Ms. TALATO has been selling vegetables and also grains for ten years. She gets her supplies at surrounding markets. She wants to purchase 20 sacks of cabbage, 20 sacks of onions, and 5 sacks of millet. With the profits, she wants to reinvest in her business and help cover her children’s schooling costs. Her ambition is to open a large warehouse.

loans.use: to purchase 20 sacks of cabbage, 20 sacks of onions, and 5 sacks of millet

loans.name: Oscar Ovidio

texts.es: Oscar de 47 años de edad desde hace 18  años se dedica a cultivar la tierra.  Con mucha dedicación cultiva maíz y frijol, adicional a eso también se dedica a la crianza de ganado, lo cual le permite llevar el  pan de cada día a su hogar. Se caracteriza por ser un hombre trabajador, honrado y responsable. Habita junto a su  grupo familiar el cual está conformado por su esposa y sus dos hijos. Junto a su esposa trabajan muy duro para sacar adelante a su familia y darles mejores condiciones a las que ellos han tenido. Gracias a los conocimientos en la agricultura es como logra llevar el sustento a su hogar. Con muchos deseos de superación se acerco a esta institución para solicitar crédito ya que la temporada para la siembra comenzó y es necesario iniciar la siembra lo antes posible. Esta es la razón por la cual solicita el crédito ya que necesita invertir en la compra de los insumos agrícolas necesarios como: semillas, abonos, insecticidas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía para realizar la siembra. Confía en Dios y en su trabajo que de esta forma logrará  tener una cosecha abundante la cual le permitirá tener  a una mejor calidad de vida para él y su familia.
texts.en:
Oscar is 47 years old, and for the last 18 years he has worked as a farmer.  With a great deal of dedication, he grows corn and beans.  Additionally, he raises livestock.  These things enable him to put food on the table every day for his family.  He is a honorable, responsible and hardworking man.

He lives with his wife and two children.  He and his wife work very hard in order to provide a better life for their family and give them a better standard of living than what they themselves have had.  Thanks to their knowledge of agriculture, they are able to support their family.

Being highly motivated to get ahead, he approached this institution to seek a loan, since the planting season has started, and it is necessary to initiate planting as soon as possible.

This is his reason for seeking this loan.  It is necessary to invest in supplies such as seeds, fertilizer, insecticides and other items.  It is also necessary to make improvements to his land, which is shown in the photograph.  He trusts in God and is work that in this way he will be able to achieve an abundant harvest, which will lead to a better quality of life for himself and his family.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer, insecticides and other items, and to improve his land.

loans.name: Maritza De Jesus

texts.es: Maritza de 40 años de edad posee un chalet ubicado en la escuela que se encuentra cerca de su lugar de residencia, vende variedad de golosinas, refrescos, jugos, agua, fruta, etc. con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logar solventar los gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, tiene tres hijos pero dos de ellos son independientes pero le ayudan económicamente, vive solo con su hijo menor en casa propia, Maritza esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas mercadería por mayor para poder surtir su chalet y atender mejor a los alumnos quienes son los que le compran y asi seguir con su trabajo para tener junto con su hijo una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maritza is 40 years old and has a little shop located in the school near her home.  She sells a variety of cookies, sodas, juices, water, fruit and other items.  With what she makes from her sales, she is able to meet her household expenses.  She has three children, but two of them are now independent and they help support her financially.  She lives with her youngest son in her own home.

She is seeking a loan in order to purchase more merchandise at wholesale to supply her shop and to better serve the students who purchase her goods.  This will enable her to continue with her work and to provide her and her son with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise at wholesale, such as cookies, sodas, juices, water, fruit and other items.

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.es: Benjamín mayor de edad casado con cinco hijos todos menores de edad y bajo su responsabilidad, originario de uno de los municipios de Chinandega ubicado en el occidente del país, zona que se caracteriza por ser productivamente comercial, turística, por sus hermosas playas y fiestas patronales, Benjamín es un microempresario quien se dedica a la comercialización de mariscos como: camarón, langosta,jaibas, curvinas, pescados de exportación y blanco,  entre otros, el cual acopia en playas de esta localidad, sus compras las realiza al por mayor a pescadores artesanales de la zona y los entrega al por mayor a una empresa privado y a comerciantes de otro país y del occidente de Nicaragua, tiene clientes fijos y eventuales, uno de sus sueños es poder ver crecer mas su negocio y que sus hijos sean todos unos profesionales, El objetivo de este nuevo financiamiento es para capital de trabajo e invertir en la compra de camarón y de esa manera aprovechar esta temporada. Benjamín agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de vida digno.
texts.en:
Benjamín is married with five young children that are under his care. He is originally from the town of Chinandega, located in the western part of country, an area characterized for being a commercially productive, tourist destination because of its beautiful beaches and local festivities.

 Benjamín is a micro entrepreneur who works selling seafood like shrimp, lobster, crab, sea bass, white fish, and exported fish, among others, which he gathers on the beaches of this town. He makes his purchases in bulk from artisan fishers in the area, and delivers them wholesale to a private company and to traders from other countries and from western Nicaragua. He has consistent and occasional customers. 

One of Benjamín's dreams is to be able to expand his business and that his sons will grow up to be professionals. The goal of the new loan is to provide working capital and to invest in the purchase of shrimp, so that he can take advantage of this season. Benjamín is grateful to Kiva's lenders who offer people with scarce resources in poor countries such as Nicaragua a better means of living.

loans.use: invertir en capital de trabajo en la compra de mariscos

loans.name: Norma Aracely

texts.es: Norma de 32 años de edad se dedica a la agricultura, a la siembra de maíz y frijol. Se ha dedicado a esta actividad durante varios años y es así como se gana el pan de cada día. Es una mujer muy  trabajadora, responsable y muy conocida en la zona por su enorme corazón y amabilidad para con los demás,  vive en casa propia con sus hijos, el esposo residen en estados unidos y le ayuda en los gastos de la casa. Debido a que ya es temporada de siembra tomo la decisión de comenzar a prepararse. Es por esa razón que ha decidido solicitar este nuevo crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en la compra de semillas, abonos, insecticidas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía que es donde desea cultivar.  Lo que más desea es que su cosecha sea abundante y mejor que las anteriores, ya que esta es la forma en que ella consigue el sustento para su familia.  Confía en Dios que con su ayuda, su dedicación y empeño en el  trabajo lograra el sueño de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Norma  is 32 and makes a living in agriculture, planting corn and bean. She has dedicated herself to this activity for several years and it is how she earns her daily bread. She is a hard working woman, responsible and well known in the area for her enormous heart and kindness to others. She lives in her own home with her children, her husband lives in the United States and helps her with the expenses of the home. Due to it already being planting season, she has decided to begin to prepare herself. This is the reason she has decided to request this new loan from INTEGRAL to invest in the purchase of seeds, fertilizers, insecticides, etc. and to improve the land which is shown in the photograph which is where she wants to farm. 
Her biggest wish is that her harvest be abundant and better than previous ones since this is how she supports her family. She trusts in God that with his help, her dedication and her commitment in the work she will be able to accomplish her dream of improving the quality of life for her family.

loans.use: purchase seeds, fertilizers, insecticides, etc. and improve the land

loans.name: Luz Maria

texts.es:
La socia Luz Maria se dedica al negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azucar, leche y galletas, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar arroz, azucar, leche y galletas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Member Luz Maria has a grocery store from which she sells basic goods such as rice, sugar, milk, and biscuits, and works from 8 a.m. until 7 p.m. She has had this business for five years and it has been going very well.

Her dream is to expand her grocery store business and she is asking for the loan to buy rice, sugar, milk, and biscuits. She is very happy to receive this loan and commits to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk and biscuits.

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
La socia Celia se dedica al negocio de transporte y también al negocio de venta de madera, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene varios años en est negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de madera. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar madera.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Celia works in the business of transportation and also sells wood. She works from 8:00 am to 7:00 pm. She has been working these jobs for numerous years and her businesses do well. Her dream is to grow the business of selling wood. She is asking for a loan to buy wood.

Celia is happy about the loan and she promises to pay all of the loan payments on time.

loans.use: to buy wood to resell.

loans.name: Mutre Afuera (Tosagua) Group

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito Mutre Afuera, este grupo formado por 10 mujeres y 1 hombre que decidieron tiempo atrás unirse y acceder a los beneficios que les brinda la institución para mejorar sus negocios y su calidad de vida, ellos se dedica a diversas actividades como  la agricultura, la cría de animales y comercio en general.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la señora María, tiene 40 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene 3  hijos, de 19, 13 y 5 años, los dos menores estudian en colegio y escuela. El marido es comerciante.
Doña María es una mujer que le gusta trabajar para ayudarle a su marido a salir adelante, ella hace varios años construyo un  galpón en el cual cría pollos, compra los pollos cuando están pequeñitos en un centro agrícola de la ciudad, los alimenta por el tiempo adecuado y luego cuando están listos  los entrega a comerciantes que llegan hasta su casa para llevarlos a vender en los mercados de la localidad, ella también les vende a los vecinos del lugar y entrega a ciertas tiendas de la zona. 
Este crédito es para comprar alimento y medicinas para pollos. Lleva 3 años  en el Grupo De Crédito  y le gusta porque los créditos le ayudan mucho para la compra de los alimentos. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
La foto pequeña es de dos socias que no pudieron estar presentes cuando se tomo la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
In the city of Tosagua the"Mutre Afuera" communal bank meets every fortnight. The group has 10 women and one man who decided to get together and access the benefits that the institution can offer them to improve their businesses and their quality of living. They work in different activities such as farming, raising animals and business in general.

One of the members of the group is María. She is 40 years old is in a common-law relationship from which she has 3 children aged 5, 13 and 19. The two youngest study in Secondary and Primary schools. Her husband is a businessman.

María is a woman who likes to work to help her husband get ahead. So several years ago she built a shed to raise chickens. She buys chickens when they are small at an agricultural center in the city and feeds them and when they are big enough she sells them to neighbors and some stores in her area.

This loan is to buy feed and medicine for the chickens. María has been a member of the group for 3 years and she likes it as the loans help a lot buying feed. Her dream is to give the best to her children. The inserted photo is of two members who could not be present when the photo was taken.

loans.use: to buy feed and medicine for chickens.

loans.name: Maira Isabel

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Libertad # 2  de la ciudad de  Portoviejo capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen las socias del Grupo De Crédito Cristo Resucitado.
En este lugar vive la señora Maira, tiene 30 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre  y de esta relación tiene dos hijos, uno de 8 años y un bebé de 11 meses de nacido, el mayor estudia en escuela. Su marido es chofer.
Doña Maira con la intención de ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto ayudarle a su marido con los gastos del hogar y la mantención de sus pequeños se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes cuando necesitan de alguna prenda. Trabaja todos los días y a cualquier hora que este desocupada, ella deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil cada quince días o al mes de acuerdo a lo que necesite. Tiene 3 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde el inicio  y le gusta porque con uno de los créditos empezó su negocio. Sus sueños es darles lo mejor a  sus hijos.
texts.en:
In the neighborhood of Libertad #2 of the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí, known for many years as the city of "los reales tamarindos," the members of the Risen Christ Credit Group ["Grupo de Crédito Cristo Resucitado"] meet. This is where Maira lives. She is 30 years old, and she and her partner have two children, an eight year old son, and a baby who is 11 months old. Maira's son goes to school, and her partner is a driver. 

Maira works selling all types of clothes. She does this in order to make her own earnings, so that she can help partner with the household expenses and take care of their two little ones. She makes sales door-to-door and also in her home, where clients come when they need clothes. Maira works everyday, and whenever she's not working, she gives her customers credit and charges them every fifteen days. She goes to Guayaquil to buy her merchandise every 15 days or monthly, depending on her needs. 

Maira has been doing this business for three years, and it's going very well. This loan will be used to buy more merchandise including pants, blouses, shirts, and children's clothes. Maira has been in the credit group since the beginning, and she likes it because she started her business with one of the loans. Her dreams is to provide the best for her children.

loans.use: buy pants, blouses, shirts, and children's clothes.

loans.name: Reina Maria

texts.es: Reina de 32 años de edad vive en casa de su padre con sus dos hijos, ella se dedica a la venta y elaboración de antojitos como: tostadas de tajaditas de papas, yuca, platanitos, hamburguesas, hotdog,  su negocio lo tiene ubicado en un lugar muy transitado cerca de su lugar de residencia, por esa razón posee mucha clientela,  Reina esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de materia prima como: yuca, papa, plátanos, aceite, pan, carne, salchichas, etc. todo por mayor para la elaboración de estos alimentos y así obtener mejores ganancias para darle a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Reina is 32 years old and she lives in her father’s house with her two children. She prepares and sells snacks such as potato, yucca, and plantain chips, hamburgers, and hot dogs.  Her business is located in a very busy area near her place of residence, which is why she has a lot of customers. 

Reina is requesting a loan for the purchase of supplies such as yucca, potatoes, plantains, oil, bread, meat, sausages, etc., all at wholesale, in order to make these foods.  In this way she will obtain better earnings in order to give her children a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase yucca, potatoes, plantains, oil, bread, meat, and sausages at wholesale.

loans.name: Grupo La Fe Group

texts.es:
La asociación comunal  Grupo la fe está conformado por nueve mujeres integrantes, madres responsables con diez hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Son originarios de Malpaisillo, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de norte de la región, se caracteriza por ser trabajadores, responsables, con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudieron cursar una carrera y se vieron obligados a trabajara desde temprana edad para ayudar con los gastos del hogar.
Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante la coordinadora es  Julia y  tiene por actividad económica una pulpería es una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestibles en cantidades pequeñas como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leche, pan, huevos, frijoles, detergente, hielo, tiste, frutas, jugos, gaseosas. Ella dedica a su negocio unas doce horas diarias ofreciendo su producto. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo, y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de productos comestibles `para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Grupo la Fe  agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The communal bank Grupo la Fe is made up of nine women. They are responsible mothers with ten children under their care, originally from Malpaisillo, a place that is located in the north of the region. They are known to be hardworking, responsible women, with goals of self improvement. Unfortunately due to the lack of financial resources they could not pursue their studies and were forced to work from an early age in order to help with the household expenses.

The coordinator is Julia, and thanks to her efforts and her desire to get ahead she has as her economic activity a grocery store. It is a small store that sells food items in small quantities such as rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, detergents, ice, tiste (a corn and cocoa beverage), fruit, juice, and soft drinks. She works about 12 hours a day selling her wares. She is asking for this loan to invest in working capital to supply her business buying and selling food products so that in the not too distant future she can obtain better income. 

Grupo la Fe is grateful to the Kiva lenders that help people with scarce resources in poor countries such as Nicaragua to have a means of decent work.

loans.use: to have working capital in order to buy food products such as rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, detergents, ice, tiste beverages, fruit, juice, and soft drinks

loans.name: Noemi Abarca

texts.es:
La socia Noemi Abarca se dedica al negocio de venta de medicinas naturales,la socia tiene una tienda donde vende medicinas,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 4:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y el va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de medicinas naturales.La socia solicita el credito para comprar medicinas naturales.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Noemi Abarca sells natural medicines. She has a store where she sells medicine. Noemi Abarca works from 8:00am to 4:00pm. She has ran her store for numerous years and the business does well. Her dream is to grow her business of selling natural medicines. She is asking for this loan to buy natural medicines.

Noemi Abarca is happy about the loan and promises to pay all of the loan payments on time.

loans.use: to buy natural medicines for resale.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
La socia Norma se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de articulos de loseria,la socia vende azucareras,ollas y platos,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de articulos de loseria.La socia solicita el credito para comprar azucareras,platos y ollas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Norma continues selling ceramic articles such as sugar bowls, pots, and plates. This member works from 8 a.m. until 6 p.m. and has been engaging in this business for a number of years. It has been going very well for her.

Her dream is to expand her sales of ceramic articles and is asking for the loan so she can buy sugar bowls, plates, and pots. She is happy to receive the loan and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy sugar bowls, plates, and pots.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy stock of tailoring materials

loans.name: Maria Antonia

texts.es: Maria de  47 años de edad vive junto a su familia en casa propia, ella se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol, tiene varios años de trabajar en la agricultura y eso le  ha regalado mucha experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas, cuando su cosecha y esta lista la almacena en los graneros que muestra la fotografía para luego salir a comercializarlos, ya tiene mucha clientela que la prefieren por la calidad, los buenos precios y sobre todo por el buen servicio; ella necesita invertir por eso le solicita un crédito que le permita comprar semillas, insecticida, fertilizantes, abonos, herbicida, etc. la clienta tiene buenas referencias por parte de sus conocidos, y es muy responsable, asegura que podrá cancelar la deuda en el periodo establecido y a la vez confía que llevara a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
Maria is 47 years old, and she lives with her family in her own house. She works farming corn and beans, and she has worked in agriculture for many years. This has given her a lot of experience, which allows her to have better harvests. When her harvest is ready, she stores it in the silo shown in the photograph to be able to later go out to sell it. She has many clients that prefer to buy from her because of the quality, good prices, and above all her good service.

She needs to invest, so she is requesting a loan that allows her to purchase seeds, insecticides, fertilizers, manure, herbicide, etc. She has good references from her acquaintances, and she is very responsible. She assures that she will be able to pay off the debt in the established period, and trusts that she will bring economic security to her home.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, insecticides, fertilizers, manure, and herbicides.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah is 55 years old from Nyandarua South and is married. They are supporting four children who are all in school.

Hannah is a farmer and has been in it for the past 20 years. She has applied for her second loan from VisionFund Kenya to enable her buy fertilizer and seedlings to use in her farm.

She hopes to farm more so as to boost her income in the near future.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertlizer

loans.name: Mary Joy

texts.en:
Mary Joy is 41 years old and married.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Mary Joy is borrowing PHP 29500 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of feed to sell.

Mary Joy has been pig fattening for 20 years and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of feed to sell

loans.name: Nhung

texts.en:
Nhung is a 54-year-old married woman with one son and three daughters. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Nhung has been running a food stall for nearly five years. She sells noodles for people in the local community. She intends to take a loan to buy a greater quantity and variety of food to meet her customers' demands. 

She hopes that through the loan she can earn more money with her current business and save additional amounts for reinvestment.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity and variety of food to meet her customers' demands

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell nipa roofing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 13000 through NWTF to purchase additional nipa roofing to sell for her buy and sell nipa roofing business.

Merlinda has been in this business for 3 years. Merlinda earns more income from fish vending.

Merlinda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional nipa roofing to sell

loans.name: Mirasol

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Mirasol works hard to support her family.

She has a nipa roofing business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from buy and sell crabs.  Mirasol is borrowing PHP 13000 through NWTF to purchase additional materials like nipa leaves, bamboo, etc for her nipa roofing business.

Mirasol has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like nipa leaves, bamboo, etc

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en: Phuong, a 32-year-old married woman, lives in Ho Chi Minh City. She has one son. She and her husband run a business that sells construction materials to people in the local community. Phuong requests a loan to purchase more new products, such as patterned tile and cement to stock her store. This will enable her to offer a better range of products to her customers. She hopes her business will run smoothly and she can earn additional income to reinvest in her shop and save for emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase more new products, such as patterned tile and cement to stock her store

loans.name: Nuevo Nance Amarillo 5 Group

texts.es:
Edilberto es un agricultor de 35 años de edad  del Departamento de Ahuachapan, el junto a su padre y un hermano forman el grupo solidario conocido como NUEVO NANCE AMARILLO 5, todos se dedican a la agricultura principalmente al cultivo de granos basicos tales como maiz y maicillo.
Edilberto esta acompañado, sus estudios los realizo hasta un sexto grado de primaria, puesto que sus padres son de recursos economicos muy limitados y no pudieron seguir apoyandolo en el estudio, el tuvo que trabajar desde muy joven para ayudar a su familia,tiene tres hijos entre las edades de 7 y 12 años, dos de ellos estan en la escuela actualmente, la tercera no estudia debido a problemas de aprendizaje.
Edilberto tiene 23 años de experiencia en el cultivo de granos basicos, es atravez de la produccion de estos y la venta de gran parte de dicha produccion que obtiene los recursos necesarios para proporcionar la alimentacion basica a su grupo familiar.
Edilberto solicita el credito para la compra de insumos Agricolas para la produccion de los granos basicos con los cuales espera obtener buenos resultados economicos para seguir dando a su familia la alimentacion y mantener tambien a sus hijos en la escuela, pues su sueño es verlos realizados como profesionales para que tengan mejores oportunidades para desempeñarse en otras actividades y con ello  que mejoren su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Edilberto, 35, is a farmer from the department of Ahuachapan. With his father and brother they form the credit solidarity group known as Nuevo Nance Amarillo 5. All of them work in agriculture, mainly the cultivation of basic grains like maize and sorghum.

Edilberto has a common law wife. He had to finish his studies after the sixth grade because his parents had very limited economic resources and they could not continue supporting him through school. Edilberto had to start working at a very young age to help out his family. Now, he has three children between the ages of 7 and 12. Two of them are in school and  the third does not study due to learning problems. 

Edilberto is requesting this loan to buy agricultural supplies for the cultivation of basic grains, which he hopes will produce good economic results in order to continue supporting his family and keep his children in school. His dream is to see his children become professionals so that they can have better opportunities of working in other industries and with that opportunity, improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en: Phuong is a 67-year-old man. He has two children. He lives with his family in Ho Chi Minh City. He and his wife have been running a business selling clothing for ten years. Phuong would like to take loan to buy a greater quantity and variety of clothes to sell. He hopes this will enable him to better meet the needs of his existing customers and attract additional customers. He also hopes that through the loan his business will generate a higher income and will help him to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity and variety of clothes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy salon hair products and cosmetics.

loans.name: Jose Eliseo

texts.es: Jose de 42  años de edad, habita en casa propia junto con su esposa y sus dos hijos, Jose posee un taller de carpintería en el cual fabrica y vende variedad de hermosos y finos muebles. Tiene 5 años de dedicarse al negocio y gracias a Dios y a su dedicación ha logrado mantenerlo en marcha. Muchas personas lo prefieren ya que él ofrece calidad y buenos precios en sus muebles. Últimamente los clientes han aumentado y cada día la demanda es mayor. Su sueño es poder ver florecer su negocio y sabe que para eso tiene que invertir un poco más en la producción de tal forma que logre cubrir toda la demanda. Para esto ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en su negocio en la compra de madera, clavos, pega, barniz, junco y de más artículos que logren atraer a más clientes de tal forma que pueda logra su objetivo de mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Jose, age 42, lives in his own house with his wife and their two children.  Jose has a carpentry shop where he makes and sells a variety of beautiful and fine furniture.  He has had the business for five years.  Thanks to God and to his dedication, he has managed to keep it running.

Many people prefer him because he offers quality and good prices for his furniture.  Lately, his customers have increased, and the demand is greater each day.

His dream is to be able to see his business flourish.  He knows that in order for this to happen he has to invest a little more in the production.  He needs to do this in such a way as to manage to cover all of the demand.

That is why he has made the decision to request this loan from Integral.  He will use the loan to invest in his business by purchasing wood, nails, glue, varnish, reeds, and other items that attract more customers.  That way he will be able to achieve his objective of improving his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy wood, nails, glue, varnish, and reeds, etc.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
El socio Julio Cesar se sigue dedicando al negocio de servicio de taxi, el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m,el socio ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño del socio es tener un carro nuevo. El socio solicita el crédito para comprar llantas para su carro.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member, Julio Cesar, continues  making a living from his taxi  service business. He works from 8 a.m. until 10 p.m.  He has had the business for several years and it is going very well. 

The  member’s dream is to own a new car. He is requesting this loan in order to purchase tires for his car.  He is happy about the loan and is committed to making all of his payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase tires for his car.

loans.name: Ana Cristina

texts.es:
Ana de 31 años de edad, estudio hasta 9º grado, es acompañada, su esposo es empleado, trabaja de seguridad. Tiene 3 hijos de los cuales 2 están estudiando.

Ana vende pan, tiene 3 años de dedicarse a vender pan, lo aprendió de su cuñada, ya que ella tiene un horno en el cual hacen pan, el negocio lo tiene en su casa y vende el pan en la comunidad. 

El préstamo que está solicitando, es para comprar harina, levadura, huevos, azúcar, manteca, etc. para seguir produciendo más pan, esto mejorara su vida ya que tendrá más ingresos. Ella sueña con que su negocio crezca y que tenga más ingresos por medio de la panadería.
texts.en:
Ana is 31 years old, and she has studied up to the 9th grade. She is accompanied by her common-law spouse who works in security, and she has three children, two of whom are attending school.

Ana has been selling bread for three years. She learned from her sister-in-law, as she has an oven in which they bake the bread. She has the business in her house and she sells the bread in the community.

The loan that she is requesting is for the purchase of flour, yeast, eggs, sugar, butter, etc. in order to continue producing more bread. This will improve her life, as she will have more earnings. She dreams of growing her business and of having more earnings through baking.

loans.use: to purchase flour, yeast, eggs, sugar, butter, etc.

loans.name: Hanin Hana'a Group

texts.en:
This group is called Hanin Hana'a. It consists of four women who live in Sana'a, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 150,000 YER from AMB. 
 
Fatima is the leader of the group. She is a 39-year-old married woman with 6 children. Her oldest child is 25 years old and the youngest one is 9 years old. She is an uneducated woman and works as a housewife. Her husband is an immigrant in Saudi Arabia. Fatima has a small water tank on the roof of her house and it isn't large enough to cover all the uses of the house. She consumes the water in a large amount for all the work of the house. Fatima purchases two water tanks trucks of water monthly, but the capacity of her water tank is a small. For this reason, Fatima applied for a loan of 40,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase another water tank to keep a larger amount of water in the house.

Fatima looks forward to building a second floor of her house and renting it in order to earn a good amount of money.

loans.use: to purchase another water tank to hold more water in the house.

loans.name: Rosa Lidia

texts.es:
Rosa de 58 años de edad, estudio hasta 6° grado,  el esposo administra una finca de café, solo un hijo vive con ella, aunque tiene tres,  pero ellos ya tienen sus propios hogares el que vive con ella estudia y de ahí nadie más vive con ellos. 
Rosa tiene ocho años de tener un molino,  antes iba a las fincas a cortar café pero ese trabajo era muy pesado, por lo que compro el molino, ella trabaja en el molino en la casa,  nadie le ayuda en el trabajo lo hace sola, su hijo le ayuda nada más los sábados y domingos.
 Ella necesita el crédito para comprar un motor de diésel,  piensa que con el crédito le ayudara mucho pues podrá trabajar los días que no haya energía eléctrica, ella piensa en cultivar cacao para mejorar un poco más los ingresos.
 Su sueño es darle estudios universitarios a su hijo,  para que sea un profesional  y también ella quiere comprar más terrenos para dejarle donde pueda vivir y trabajar para él y sus otros dos hijos.
texts.en:
Rosa is 48 year old, and she studied through the 6th grade. Her husband administers a coffee farm, and although she has three children, only one son lives with her. Her children have their own homes, and her son that lives with her studies, and no one else lives with them.

Rosa has had a grinder for 8 years. Before, she went to the farms to cut coffee, but that work was very difficult, which is why she purchased the grinder. She works with the grinder in her house, no one helps her with her work; she does it by herself. Her son only helps her on Saturdays and Sundays.

She needs the loan to purchase a diesel motor. She thinks that the loan will help her a lot and she will be able to work during days when there is no electricity. She is also thinking of farming cacao to improve her income a bit more. Her dream is to be give her son a university education so that he can be a professional worker. She also wants to buy more land to give her son and her other two children a place where they can live and work.

loans.use: to purchase a diesel motor.

loans.name: Esmeralda Elizabeth

texts.es: Esmeralda de 32 años de edad vive con su esposo quien es agricultor y su hijo. Ella posee una tienda donde vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, frijoles, leche entre otros, últimamente se ha hecho de mucha clientela, pues siempre tiene lo que las personas necesitan con productos de excelente calidad a precios realmente accesibles y con un servicio inigualable; Esmeralda es una mujer emprendedora con muchas ganas de salir adelante, quiere sentirse ganadora y para lograr el éxito sus mayores secretos son la constancia y la dedicación, esta dispuesta a hacer crecer su negocio es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, producto instantáneo, embutidos, golosinas, bebidas etc. ella tiene la confianza que con su dedicación podrá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Esmeralda is 32 years old, and she lives with her husband who is a farmer, and with her son. She has a store where she sells basic goods such as rice, beans, and milk among others. Lately, she has had many clients because she always has what people need on hand, with high quality products at truly accessible prices, and with unbeatable service.

Esmeralda is an entrepreneur who wants to get ahead and feel successful. Her best-kept secrets are her consistency and dedication. She wants to expand her business, which is why she is requesting a loan through INTEGRAL to purchase basic grains, instant products, cold cuts, candies, drinks, etc. She is confident that with her dedication, she will be able to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase basic grains, instant products, cold cuts, candies, and drinks.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta de 24 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hijo, ella se dedica a la compra y venta de frutas y verduras tiene 5 años con el negocio y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, el lugar donde comercia es muy estratégico para la actividad y además muy concurrido de personas, ya tiene mucha clientela que la prefieren porque su producto es fresco, a buen precio, de calidad y con un excelente servicio; Ella es una mujer emprendedora, dedicada a su labor con muchas ganas de salir adelante, siempre está buscando alternativas que le permitan alcanzar el éxito, la clienta le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar frutas y verduras por mayor, esta agradecida con el apoyo y asegura que podrá saldar la deuda, a la vez confía que le dará a su hijo una vida mejor.
texts.en:
The client, age 24, lives in her own house with her son.  She buys and sells fruit and vegetables.  She has had the business for five years, and this has gifted her with a lot of sales experience that allows her to get the best earnings.  The place where she sells is very strategic to her activity.  It is also very busy.  She has a lot of customers who prefer her because her product is fresh, good quality, sold for a good price, and with excellent service.

She is an enterprising woman who is devoted to her work and has a great desire to get ahead.  She is always looking for alternatives that will allow her to be successful.

The client is requesting a loan from Integral that will allow her to buy fruit and vegetables wholesale.  She is grateful for the support, and she confirms that she will be able to repay the debt.  She is also confident that she will give her son a better life.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables wholesale.

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es: Pablo continua con su actividad económica es la agricultura, la ganadería y la venta de lácteas, él es una persona responsable por ese motivo le invitaron a participar en el banco comunal “Tres Cruces de Oro” y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar alimentos como concentrados, pasto y forraje, él agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en: Pablo continues working as a farmer, raising cattle, and selling dairy products.  He is a responsible person and, for this reason, was invited to be a part of the "Tres Cruces de Oro" communal bank.  On this occasion, Pablo needs a loan to buy animal feed such as concentrated feed, grains, and fodder.  He is grateful for, and values, the loan and promises to to be very responsible in meeting his monthly payments.

loans.use: to buy feed such as concentrated feed, grain, and fodder.

loans.name: Mirna Xiomara

texts.es:
Mirna de 33 años de edad, estudio hasta 5º grado de educación, es madre soltera, tiene 2 hijos de 9 y 4 años de edad, de los cuales uno esta estudiando, de ella dependen dos personas. Ella se dedica a vender antojitos, frutas y verduras. Tiene 5 años de dedicarse a este negocio, ella recorre todo el cantón vendiendo estos productos. 

Con el préstamo, comprara frutas, verduras, aceite, maíz, sal, carne, etc. Para elaborar más antojitos para comercializarlos. Ella sueña con que su negocio crezca y que sus hijos estudien y que tengan una mejor condición de vida.
texts.en:
Mirna, 33 years old, attended school until the fifth grade. She is a single mother of two children, aged 9 and 4 years old. One attends school. Mirna is responsible for supporting both children. She makes a living selling snacks, fruit and vegetables, a business she has had for five years. She goes throughout the canton selling these products. 

With the loan, she will purchase fruit, vegetables, cooking oil, corn, salt, meat, etc. in order to make more snacks to sell. She dreams that her business will grow and that her children will study and have better living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fruit, vegetables, cooking oil, corn, salt, meat, etc.

loans.name: María Concepción

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Libertad # 2  de la ciudad de  Portoviejo capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen las socias del Grupo De Crédito Cristo Resucitado.
En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 54 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene 6 hijos mayores de edad e independientes. Su esposo es comerciante.
Doña María es una mujer muy trabajadora que le gusta así salir adelante, ella tiene una  pequeña granja en el cual criar pollos, compra estos animalitos cuando están pequeños, los tiene por dos a tres meses y cuando están listos para la venta los entrega a comerciantes que los venden en sus negocios en diversos mercados de la ciudad, ella también le da parte del crédito a su marido ya que el tiene una carreta en la cual vende jugos de coco en varios lugares.  Así ellos salen adelante ya ella lleva realizando esta actividad por más de 5 años y su marido casi toda la vida.
Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar alimentos y medicinas para los pollos, pollos y cocos para el negocio de su marido. Es fundadora del grupo  y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan los créditos. Sus sueños son tener buena salud ella y su familia.
texts.en:
The members of the Cristo Resucitado [Risen Christ] communal bank meet in the Libertad #2 neighborhood in the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí, which has been known for many years as the city of the royal tamarinds.

This is where María, age 54, lives.  She is married, and they have six children who are grown and independent.  Her husband is a merchant.

María is a very hard-working woman who likes to get ahead.  She has a small farm where she raises chickens.  She buys these animals when they are small.  She keeps them for two or three months, and when they are ready for sale she delivers them to the merchants who sell them in their business in diverse city markets.

She will also give part of the loan to her husband.  He has a cart from which he sells coconut juices at various places.  That is how they get ahead.  She has been doing this business activity for over five years.  Her husband has been engaged in his business for almost his whole life.

She will use this loan to buy feed and medicine for the chickens, chickens, and coconuts for her husband’s business.  She is the founder of her group.  She likes it because of the help from the loans.  Her dreams are for her and her family to be in good health.

loans.use: to buy feed and medicine for the chickens, chickens, and coconuts.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es: La señora Teodora tiene 43 años, tiene dos hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de pañales desechables al por mayor en distintas zonas  de la ciudad de La Paz y el Alto, ella entrega también según pedido, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la señora Teodora,  va a usar este préstamo para compra de pañales al por mayor, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es incrementar su mercadería, la señora Teodora enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia y va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir comprando  mercadería y así de esta manera genera más ingresos económicos, se siente feliz ya agradecida por la oportunidad que le brindan para crecer en su actividad, mejorara sus ingresos y por ende su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Teodora, 43 years old, has 2 children and works selling disposable diapers in bulk in different areas of the cities of La Paz and El Alto and she does deliveries. This loan is her first with this institution. Teodora will use this loan to buy diapers in bulk. Her reason for asking for this loan is to increase her merchandise. Teodora confronts challenges in her business such as the competition and will use the profits to continue buying merchandise and in this way create more income. She is happy and thankful for the opportunity that this brings to increase her business, improve her income and thereby her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy disposable diapers in bulk as merchandise

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan is 45 years old and married with seven children. She and her husband have been working hand-in-hand in order to sustain their family's basic commodities. Four of her children attend school; one is married, one is searching for a job and the other one is a helper. According to Susan, she used to offer her candies and re-pack peanuts to store near her village and other nearby municipalities to earn a living. Now, she would like to buy more candies and raw peanuts but she does not have enough income to do so. She is seeking financial assistance of PHP 19,000. She knows that she could be able to improve her sales, repair her house and educate her children someday through continuous access of financial services from the lenders.

loans.use: to purchase candies and raw peanuts to sell

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is a married woman. She has 5 children. She describes herself to be focused.

Judith operates a retail business where she sells sugar, bread, flour and other items. Her business is located in a good area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate capital. Judith will use the 10,000 KES loan to buy stocks of sugar, bread and other items. Judith hopes that in the future, she will educate her children. This is her second loan with SMEP  DTM. Her previous loan of 20,000 KES was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy stocks of sugar, bread and other items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies for her coffee crops for this season

loans.name: Ninfa

texts.en:
Ninfa is 55 years old and married with nine children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a nipa roofing business in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more stock of nipa roofing to sell.

Ninfa has borrowed and paid 5 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the nipa roofing business for 35 years and also earns an income from fish vending.

Ninfa aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of nipa roofing to sell

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose lives in the rich highlands of Litein with her five-year-old daughter. She has been doing farming for the past four years with her primary source of income being milk and a small retail business. Farming puts food on her table, but her biggest challenge is the lack of sufficient funds to handle her farming projects.

Rose chose to take your loan because it will help her purchase some poultry. This will help to boost her income and enable her to pay for her daughter’s school fees.

loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Amigas De Lucciola (Santa Ana) Group

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Santa Ana conocida por sus bellos paisajes y por sus hermosos balnearios de agua dulce que son muy visitados por muchos turistas, cada 15 días se reúnen las socias del Grupo De Crédito Amigas De Lucciola.
Este es un grupo de personas que decidieron unirse tiempo atrás y formar este Grupo De Crédito que les ha servido  de mucho ya que con los créditos ellos han podido mejorar sus pequeños negocios, se dedican a diversas actividades tales como comercio en general,   servicios entre otras actividades.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la señora  Ana, tiene 66 años de edad, es madre soltera de 6   hijos pero uno falleció, los 5  son mayores de edad y dos de ellos aun viven con ella.
Doña Ana es una muy buena ama de casa que para ganar sus propios recursos y así salir adelante se dedica a la cría de pollos y chanchos, en su casa tiene una pequeña granja que por temporada tiene hasta 100 pollos y varios chanchos, ella los alimenta por dos a tres meses y cuando están listos los entrega a comerciantes que llegan hasta su casa para venderlos en los mercados de la ciudad y la provincia. Esto lo viene realizando desde hace varios años.
Este crédito es para comprar alimento y medicinas para pollos y chanchos. Este es su primer ciclo en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le ayudan mucho para salir adelante. Sus sueños son seguir adelante en su vida.
La foto pequeña es de una socia que no pudo estar presente cuando se tomo la foto.
texts.en:
Every fifteen days, the members of the “Grupo De Crédito Amigas De Lucciola” [Friends of Lucciola Loan Group] meet in Santa Ana, a city known for its beautiful landscapes and freshwater spas that are frequently visited by the tourists.  

This is a group of people that decided to join together a while ago and form this communal bank, which has served them well because the loans have enabled them to improve their small businesses.  They are engaged in diverse activities such as general business, services, and others.
One of the members of this group is Ana.  She is 66 years old, and a mother of six children, but one died.  The other five are adults, and two of them still live with her.

Ana is a very good housewife, and to earn her own income and thus, get ahead, she is engaged in raising chickens and pigs.  She has a small farm in her home, and has up to 100 chickens and several pigs through the season.  She feeds them for two or three months, and when they are ready, she delivers them to the merchants that come to her house.  Then the animals are sold at the markets in the city and the province.  She has been in this business for several years.

This loan is for the purchase of feed and medicine for the chickens and pigs.  This is her first loan cycle with the group, and she enjoys it because the loans help her to get ahead.  Her dream is to keep moving forward in her life.

The small photo is of a member that couldn’t be present when the group photo was taken.

loans.use: to purchase feed and medicine for the chickens and pigs

loans.name: Juan Dionicio

texts.es: El socio es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia con el esfuerzo de su trabajo entonces su actividad económica es la agricultura y siembra diferentes productos como por ejemplo papa, cebada, trigo y otros más, él es una persona responsable por ese motivo le invitaron a participar en el banco comunal “Colque Orcco” y en esta oportunidad  requiere el préstamo para fumigar los campos de cultivos, él agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en: The borrower is a hard-working entrepreneur who provides for his family through much effort.  He works in agriculture and grows different crops such as potatoes, barley, wheat and others.  He is a responsible person  and was therefore invited to join the communal bank "Colque Orcco".  On this occasion, he is requesting a loan to fumigate his crops.  He is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To fumigate his crops.

loans.name: Li Lamni Group

texts.es:
Ebelda: Es una señora emprendedora y amistosa, coordinadora del Grupo Solidario Li-Lamni (que en lengua miskita significa Agua Calma); está integrado por tres mujeres, que se organizaron con el propósito  de buscar alternativas de financiamiento mediante crédito en Pana Pana, para poder mejorar sus negocios e ingresos, que les permitan mejorar las condiciones de vida de sus familias, para poder cubrir necesidades básicas de alimentación, educación y vivienda.

Esta amable señora, es casada, tiene 2 hijos, en edad escolar. Desde hace aproximadamente 8 años se dedica a la venta de ropa usada, bastimento (Yuca, malanga, plátano, banano, cuadrado, quequisque) y pescados. Estableciéndose en el parque del Municipio de Waspam. Solicita su primer financiamiento para comprar una paca de ropa en Managua y venderla a precios accesibles, bastimentos y pescados en la comunidad de Bismona. Su sueño es tener un local en el mercado y que su negocio crezca. 

Erlinda: Es originaria de Waspam, tiene 40 años. Desde hace aproximadamente 5 años se dedica a la venta de bastimento y elaboración de pan. Solicita su primer financiamiento para comprar yuca, malanga, plátano, banano, cuadrado, quequisque y coco, y comprar insumos para elaborar pan de coco: harina, levadura, soda, aceite y huevo, los productos los vende de manera ambulante en la ciudad de Waspam. Su sueño es ampliar su pequeño negocio, tener una pulpería en el mercado de Waspam.

Clarinda: Es originaria de Waspam, tiene 36 años Desde hace 1 año se dedica a la venta de bastimento. Solicita financiamiento para comprar yuca, malanga, plátano, banano, cuadrado, quequisque y coco. Su sueño es ampliar su negocio, vender ropa usada.
texts.en:
Ebelda is an enterprising and friendly woman who is the coordinator of the solidarity group called “Li-Lamni” (which means “Calm Water” in the Miskito language). This group includes three women who joined together in order to seek financing alternatives, such as a loan from Pana Pana, so that they can improve their businesses and their incomes. As a result, they would be able to improve the living conditions for their families and provide for their basic needs such as food, education, and shelter.

Ebelda is a friendly woman who is married and has two school-age children. For approximately eight years, she has been selling used clothing, fish, and provisions (cassava, malanga root, plantains, bananas, miniature bananas, and “quequisque” tubers). Her business is set up in a park in the city of Waspam. She is requesting her first loan in order to buy a bale of used clothes in Managua that she can sell at affordable prices. Ebelda will also buy provisions and fish in the community of Bismona. Her dream is to have a space at the market where she can grow her business.

Erlinda, age 40, is originally from Waspam. She has been selling provisions and making bread for approximately five years. She is requesting her first loan in order to buy cassava, malanga root, plantains, bananas, miniature bananas, “quequisque” (a tuber similar to taro root), and coconuts. Erlinda will also buy ingredients for making coconut bread such as flour, yeast, baking soda, oil, and eggs. She sells her products as a street vendor in the city of Waspam. Her dream is to expand her small business and open a grocery store at the market in Waspam.

Clarinda is originally from Waspam. She is 36 years old and has been selling provisions for one year. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy cassava, malanga root, plantains, bananas, miniature bananas, “quiquisque”, and coconuts. Her dream is to expand her business and to begin selling used clothes.

loans.use: to buy a bale of used clothes

loans.name: Francois

texts.en: Francois is a 30 year old Cameroonian who is married with three children. His oldest child is eight in primary school while the youngest is one year old. He has been in this business for over a year now, which makes him experienced. His business is likely to succeed because it is located in an urban area with many potential customers. This loan will be used to increase his turnover by sixty percent and an increase of profit from forty thousand FCFA to sisty five thousand CFA and his standard of living will also be improved.

loans.use: to buy building material store for resale

loans.name: Amelia

texts.es:
Amelia de 48 años de edad, estudió hasta 3° grado porque su familia era de escasos recursos económicos y no podia mandarla mas a la escuela. sin embargo, ella era muy oficiosa en su casa, le ayudaba a su mamá con los quehaceres se levantaba muy temprano para hacer el desayuno a su padre y luego ir a dejar almuerzo a la milpa y es asi como Amelia aprendio los oficios domesticos hasta que cumplio la mayoria de edad y se caso con el que ahora es el padre de sus seis hijos, el esposo se dedica a trabajar con estructuras metalicas y en la epoca de invierno dedica su tiempo a la agricultura cosechando el elote, maiz, frijoles y maicillo frutos que almacenan para los gastos de la casa. 

Dos de los hijos estan en el extranjero, quienes envian remesas para ayudar a la familia, Amelia invertira el dinero a sus negocios que son la crianza de pollos, gallinas y tambien para comprar los ingredientes con los que hace los ricos tamales que por las tardes sale a vender por encargos, en la venta de tamales le colaboran dos hijas y lo demas del prestamo lo invertira en la siembra de los granos como : abono, hierbicida, etc, y tambien para pagarle a las personas que le trabajan en la siembra.
El sueño de Amelia es tener una galera para sus pollos y gallinas y que su venta de tamales sea mas grande para asi obtener mas ingresos y poder darles una estabilidad mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Amelia, 48 years old, studied up to 3rd grade because her family had limited resources and couldn't send her to school any more. However, she was very helpful in the home. She helped her mother with the chores, waking very early to make breakfast for her father then going to leave the lunch in the cornfield. In this way, Amelia learned the domestic tasks until she became an adult and married the one who is now the father of her six children.  Her husband does metalwork and during the winter he works in agriculture harvesting the sweet corn, maize, beans and sorghum which they store for the household expenses.
 
Two of the children are abroad, and send remittances to help the family. Amelia invests the money in her businesses which are raising chickens and hens, and also buys the ingredients to make the delicious tamales that she sells to order. Two daughters work with her in selling tamales. The rest of the loan will be invested in sewing seeds such as: fertilizer, herbicide, etc., and also to pay the people who work sewing the seeds 

Amelia's dream is to have a shed for her chickens and hens and that her tamale sales will be larger and in that way to increase her income and give her children more stability.

loans.use: to buy chickens, hens, and also to buy ingredients to make the delicious tamales that she sells to order, fertilizer, herbicide, etc., and also to pay the people who work sewing the seeds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a cooler and products to stock her store

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.en:
Gabriel is a 35-year-old married man. He describes himself to be focused. 

He operates a retail business where he sells timber. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are of all types. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. 

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of timber. His business goal is to be successful within five years.

loans.use: buy more stock of timber

loans.name: Alpha

texts.en:
Alpha wishes for continuous operation and growth of the business. She operates a jewelry business in the market. Alpha is making rings, earrings and bracelets made out of silver and gold. According to her, she has more customers because it has been proven that her goods are quality and not fake. 

Alpha is requesting a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy materials for making jewelry. She will keep her good service to her customers and will encourage more people to buy her goods. 

Alpha will prioritize to sustain her family’s basic needs from the profit she will earn. She will manage the business well as part of achieving her wish.

loans.use: to buy materials for making jewelry.

loans.name: Mary Lourdes

texts.en:
Mary Lourdes is a hardworking woman from Balanlinao. She is 43 years old and has been working hard to manage her fish-vending business. 

To help expand her business, she has requested a loan to buy more fish, which wlll help her generate greater profits and supplement her business needs. She hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a small fishing boat.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a direct-selling personal products business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing through NWTF to purchase additional personal products like soap, shampoo, lotion, etc., to sell for her direct-selling personal products business.

Rosemarie has been in this business for five years. She earns more income from a general store and selling vegetables.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional personal products like soap, shampoo, lotion, etc., to sell

loans.name: Segundina

texts.en:
Segundina is 62 years old and married with five children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like soft drinks, coffee, milk, etc. to sell.

Segundina has borrowed and paid 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 30 years and earns additional income from farming rice.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like soft drinks, coffee, and milk to sell

loans.name: Ana Lucia

texts.es:
Ana Lucia tiene 52 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo e hijos en el distrito de Zaña, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de alimentos y golosinas en el kiosko de colegio de su distrito, tiene una familia unida que se esfuerza en la labor que realiza, ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 500 nuevo soles para la mejora de infraestructura y artefactos para equipar negocio y de esta manera seguir brindando un mejor servicio para sus clientes.
texts.en:
Ana Lucia is 52 years old. She lives with her husband and children in the district of Zaña, a community that works in agriculture, commerce, and cattle. It is located in the province of Chiclayo, which belongs to the region of Lambayeque, on the north coast of Peru.

She sells food and sweets in the kiosk at the high school in her district. She has a close family that works hard at what they do. She has requested a loan for 2,500.00 PEN (Peruvian nuevos soles) to improve the infrastructure and machines to equip her business. In this way she will be able to provide better service to her customers.

loans.use: to buy paint and a toaster for her food stall

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario is 57 years old and married with seven children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like noodles, sardines, coffee, etc. to sell.

Rosario has borrowed and paid 13 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 40 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like noodles, sardines, coffee, etc., to sell

loans.name: José Elias

texts.es:
José de 42 años de edad, esta acompañado, tiene 6 hijos de 18, 20, 16, 12, 7 y 22 años de edad, de los cuales 3 de ellos aun se encuentran estudiando y 3 que trabajan la agricultura junto con su padre. José no pudo estudiar debido a la pobreza en que vivian sus padres. 

José se dedica a la agricultura y en la crianza de animales desde hace 25 años, trabajo que lo aprendio de sus padres, para llegar a su trabajo de agricultura camina 2 kilometros, trabaja en horario 7:00 AM a 4:00 PM.  la esposa trabaja en el verano vendiendo tamales y por el invierno se dedica a la agricultura junto con su esposo.

El préstamo que esta solicitando en CREDICAMPO, es para comprar semilla de maíz, abono, herbicidas, pesticidas, fertilizantes y pago de mano de obra.  Así podra mejorar sus cultivos tambien mejorara sus ingresos y poder darles una mejor calidad de vida a su grupo familiar.

José sueña en construir una vivienda mejor y poder darles estudios a sus hijos hasta que tengan una carrera academica.
texts.en:
José, 42 years old, is in a relationship and has 6 children, 18, 20, 16, 12, 7 and 22 years old, 3 of whom are students and 3 of whom work farming with their father. José couldn't study due to the poverty his parents lived in.

José has worked in farming and raising animals for the last 25 years, work that he learned from his parents. To get to his farm work, he walks 2 kilometers, he works from 7:00 AM to 4:00 PM. His partner works in the summer selling tamales and in the winter she farms with him.  

The loan that he is asking CREDICAMPO for is to buy corn seeds, natural fertilizer, pesticides, chemical fertilizer and to pay labor costs. In this way, he will be able to improve his crops and also to increase his income and provide a better quality of life for his family.

José dreams of building a better house and being able to provide his children with education until they have an academic degree.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds, natural fertilizer, herbicide, pesticide, chemical fertilizer and pay labor costs

loans.name: Anh

texts.en:
Anh, 49, is a married woman living with her family in Ho Chi Minh City with her two children and husband. 

She and her husband support their family by running a business selling electrical equipment. Anh is now requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a larger stock of electrical equipment to sell from her shop. 

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: a larger stock of electrical equipment to sell from her shop

loans.name: Laura Lorena

texts.es:
Ella es Laura Lorena, una chica que termino los estudios hasta el grado 11, tuvo un hijo, el cual es la motivación y la persona aparte de la familia más importante para ella.
Ella decidió estudiar Primera Infancia, porque desde pequeña tuvo empatía con los niños, le encanta verlos reír Y jugar con ellos, es más, ella dice que de los niños los adultos aprenden todos los días. 
Ella es de bajos recursos económicos, pero no es un impedimento para seguir cumpliendo los sueños, en este momento los padres son la ayuda económica principal, puesto que les toca colaborar con el hijo y el estudio, por medio de una amiga se enteró de la ayuda que ofrece Kiva para pagar el estudio y ella se interesó bastante.
texts.en:
This is Laura Lorena, a girl who has completed her education up to grade 11. She had a child, who is her motivation and the person most important to her apart from her family.

She is studying Early Childhood Education because since she was very young, she empathized with children. She loves to see them laugh and to play with them. Also, she says adults learn from children every day.

She has limited economic resources, but this this is not an impediment to continuing to fulfill her dreams. At this time, her parents are her primary economic support, since they help with her child and her studies. She learned from a friend about the help that Kiva offers in order to pay for her studies and she was very interested.

loans.use: to pay a semester of tuition

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy spare parts and fuel

loans.name: Serah

texts.en:
Serah is 29 years old. She is married and together they have been blessed with two children. She also supports four adult dependents. She has been selling clothes for the past five years. She would like a loan of KES 20,000 with which she will buy clothes in bulk to sell to clients in her area.

Serah hopes that she will use her profits to support her family in all means. She dreams of becoming a successful woman in the future.

loans.use: to buy clothes in bulk to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase farming inputs to help her coffee crops.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell of nipa roofing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy additional stock of nipa roofing to sell. Teresita has been in this business for three years. She earns more income from buying and selling crabs.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.
