loans.use: to buy additional stock of nipa roofing to sell

loans.name: Allah Kan Ben Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre femmes du groupe Allah kan ben vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 44 ans et 2 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le village de Diakobougou dans la commune de Ségou (4ème Région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté, mariage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le village de Diakobougou. Elles font le petit commerce de condiment, de la restauration et de grains de céréales. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur  12éme cycle du prêt solidaire.
 Madame Sitan  (1ére  de la  gauche vers la droite dans la photo) compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter une quantité suffisante de mil et de riz chez les producteurs et les stockeurs du village pour la satisfaction de la demande  clientèle. La vente se fait au comptant et souvent à crédit à une clientèle mixte dans le marché du village et à la maison.
 Madame Sitan espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de  20.000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé  pour subvenir aux petits besoins de ses enfants et augmenter son fonds de commerce.
texts.en:
The four members of the Allah Kan Ben group are women living in traditional families. On the average, they are 44 years old with two children. They all live in the Diakobougou village in the community of Ségou (the fourth administrative region of Mali). They know each as neighbors or relatives by blood or marriage as well as through the work in the Diakobougou village. They work as vendors selling condiments, cooked dishes and cereal grains. With the goal of bolstering their business capital, the group members have decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their 12th solidarity loan cycle.

Mrs. Sitan (the first one from left to right in the photo) plans to use her loan to buy a sufficient quantity of millet and rice from farmers and wholesalers in the village in order to meet customer demand. She sells for cash and often on credit to a mixed clientele, at the village marketplace and also out of her home. With this loan, Mrs. Sitan hopes to earn an average monthly revenue of 20,000 West African francs, which will be used to cover some minor expenses for her children and strengthen her working capital.

loans.use: to buy millet and rice.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 35 years old. She is married and together with her husband, they have been blessed with three children. She has one adult dependent. Emma's husband assists in the farming business. She has been farming for the past six years.

Emma would like a loan of KES 15,000. She makes a monthly estimated income of KES 9,800. Through this loan, she will buy more livestock, fertilizer and seeds for planting. Her anticipated profits will be used to improve their methods of farming. In the future, she hopes to be successful in life.

loans.use: buy more livestock, fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy footwear, clothes and blankets

loans.name: Zahraa

texts.en:
Zahraa is a 28-year-old married mother of two children who helps her husband with the family’s income to provide their children with the necessary standards of living. One of her children attends a private school and she hopes he graduates with a special major that he can turn into a successful career
.
Zahraa started working as a sales person in her uncle’s veils and clothing shop three years ago. She worked hard to improve her career and income until she took the veils’ sector for her own. She is developing it in a well-managed way.

Zahraa is acquiring a Youth loan from Kiva’s partner Al Majmoua to buy a dining room suite for her house to improve her family’s life style. She hopes to fulfill her dream of establishing her own store in the future.

loans.use: To buy a dining room suite for her house

loans.name: Winrose

texts.en:
Winrose is a married woman. She has one child. She describes herself to be trustworthy. 

She operates a grocery store where she sells vegetables and fruits. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a business-friendly area, and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the lack of enough working capital. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables. 

Her business goal is to be prosperous within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en: Geoffrey is a 29-year-old married man. He describes himself to be focused. He operates a retail business where he sells popcorn. He has been involved in this business for six years. His primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the temporary business premise. He will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more stock of popcorn. His business goal is to excel within five years. He will use the anticipated profits to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of popcorn

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a 60-year-old married mother of nine children. She established a clothes-selling shop 16 years ago and is developing it properly. In addition to clothes, Fatima also sells basic housewares and gifts that her villagers might need. 

Fatima supports her husband in covering their family needs. Their combined incomes are considered barely enough to provide the big family with all the necessary needs. That’s why she has been borrowing from Kiva’s partner Al Majmoua continuously to increase her business capital to make sure she can fulfill her family's and customers’ needs.

Fatima is acquiring another loan from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua. Her current loan will be invested in increasing her business merchandise with a special summer collection (clothes and special beach needs) that will attract her customers' attention and improve her sales.

She is working hard to diversify her products and develop her business in a well-managed way.

loans.use: to buy more summer clothes and special beach needs to sell

loans.name: Benkola Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre femmes du groupe Benkola vivent toutes dans des familles nucléaires. Elles ont en moyenne 35 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier de Médine l’un des quartiers de Ségou (4ème Région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté, mariage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le quartier de Médine. Elles font le petit commerce de fruits et légumes et de produits cosmétiques. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur  1ér cycle du prêt solidaire.
 Madame Djeneba  (1ére  femme debout de la  gauche vers la droite dans la photo) est une grande vendeuse de fruits et légumes dans le quartier Médine et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter une grande quantité suffisante de fruits et légumes avec les maraîchers de Ségou  pour satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle. La vente se fait au comptant et souvent à crédit à une clientèle mixte dans le marché et à la maison.
 Madame Djeneba espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 21 000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé  pour aider son mari et augmenter son fonds de commerce.
texts.en:
The four women of the group Benkola all live in nuclear families, and they average 35 years of age and three children each, all living in the Médine district in Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women know one another through ties of community, kinship, marriage, and their revenue-generating businesses in the Médine district. They have small-scale businesses involving fruit & vegetables and cosmetic products. 

With the goal of increasing their business capital, the group members decided to collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their first solidarity loan cycle. 

Ms. Djeneba (the first woman standing at the left in the photo) is a major vendor of fruit & vegetables in and around the Medine district. She intends to use her loan to purchase a large enough quantity of fruit & vegetables from market gardeners. Accepting cash or credit, she make her sales to a mixed customer base at the market and at her house. 

With this loan, Ms. Djeneba is hoping to make an average monthly profit of 21,000 francs CFA that will be used for helping out her husband and increasing her capital.

loans.use: to purchase fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Djekafo Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq femmes du groupe Djekafo vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 41 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le village de Diakobougou dans la commune de Ségou (4ème Région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté, mariage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le village de Diakobougou. Elles font le petit commerce, de restauration, de condiment et de grains de céréales. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur  12éme cycle du prêt solidaire.
 Madame Mariam  (3éme  femme de la  gauche vers la droite dans la photo) compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter une quantité suffisante de fonio et de mil  chez les producteurs et les stockeurs du village pour la satisfaction de la demande  clientèle. La vente se fait au comptant et souvent à crédit à une clientèle mixte dans le marché du village et à la maison.
 Madame Mariam espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de  15 000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé  pour les frais de scolarisation de ses enfants et augmenter son fonds de commerce.
texts.en:
The five women of the group Djekafo all live in traditional families, and they average 42 years of age and three children each, all living in the village of Diakobougou, in Commune de Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women know one another through ties of community, kinship, marriage, and their revenue-generating businesses in the village of Diakobougou. They have small-scale businesses involving condiments and grains, and they work in food service. 

With the goal of increasing their business capital, the group members decided to collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their 12th solidarity loan cycle. 

Ms. Mariam (the third woman from the left in the photo) intends to use her loan to purchase a sufficient quantity of fonio and millet from producers and warehouse vendors in the village in order to meet customer demands. Accepting cash and often credit, she make her sales to a mixed customer base at the village market and at her house. 

With this loan, Ms. Mariam is hoping to make an average monthly profit of 15,000 francs CFA that will be used for covering her children’s schooling costs and increasing her capital.

loans.use: to purchase millet and fonio

loans.name: Repher

texts.en:
Repher is a 54-year-old woman with 7 children ranging in age from 20 years old to 35 years old.  She describes herself to be honest.  Repher operates a retail business where she sells tomatoes, onions, and vegetables.  She has been involved in this business for 5 years.  Her primary customers are regular customers.  She describes her biggest business challenge to be changes in season. 

Repher will use the 40,000 KES loan to buy additional stocks of onions and tomatoes.  Her business goal is to be the best within 5 years. She also hopes that in the future, she will raise the living standards of her family.  This is her fifth loan with SMEP DTM.  Previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of onions and tomatoes

loans.name: Djekaguelen Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq femmes du groupe Djekaguelen vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 41 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le village de Diakobougou dans la commune de Ségou (4ème Région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté, mariage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le village de Diakobougou. Elles font le petit commerce de grains et la restauration. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur  2éme cycle du prêt solidaire.
 Madame Aminata (1ére  de la droite vers la gauche dans la photo) est une grande vendeuse de galette à sauce dans le village de Diakobougou et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter une quantité suffisante de mil chez les producteurs et les stockeurs du village pour la satisfaction de la demande  clientèle. La vente se fait au comptant et souvent à crédit à une clientèle mixte dans le marché du village et à la maison.
 Madame Aminata espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de  12 000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé  pour les frais de scolarisation de ses enfants et augmenter son fonds de commerce.
texts.en:
The five women of the group Djekaguelen all live in traditional families, and they average 41 years of age and three children each, all living in the village of Diakobougou, in Commune de Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women know one another through ties of community, kinship, marriage, and their revenue-generating businesses in the village of Diakobougou. They have small-scale businesses involving grains, and they work in food service. 

With the goal of increasing their business capital, the group members decided to collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their second solidarity loan cycle. 

Ms. Aminata (the first woman at the left in the photo) is a major vendor of galettes with sauce in and around the village of Diakobougou. She intends to use her loan to purchase a sufficient quantity of millet from producers and warehouse vendors in the village in order to meet customer demands. Accepting cash and often credit, she make her sales to a mixed customer base at the village market and at her house. 

With this loan, Ms. Aminata is hoping to make an average monthly profit of 12,000 francs CFA that will be used for covering her children’s schooling costs and increasing her capital.

loans.use: to purchase millet

loans.name: Benit Group

texts.fr:
Mme BOUANPOUNDI est responsable du groupe BENIT. Elle se porte bien. Marié, elle est mère 04enfants. Le plus âgé 22ans et le moins âgé 13ans. 04 vont à l’école.
Mme vend  des pagnes, bijoux, chaussures et bazins depuis 04ans. Elle s’approvisionne au Mali et à Lomé. 
Elle veut s’acheter 15 pagnes, 15 bazins et 1/12 de chaussures.
Mme veut utiliser ses bénéfices pour agrandir son commerce. Elle ambitionne ouvrir sa propre boutique.
texts.en:
Bouanpoundi is the representative of the BENIT group.  She is doing well.  She is married and the mother of four children who all go to school.  Her oldest child is 22 years old and her youngest is 13.  

Bouanpoundi has been selling "pagnes" (colorful West-African fabrics) as well as damask fabrics for the past four years.  She stocks up in Mali and in Lomé.

She wants to buy 15 pagnes, 15 pieces of damask fabric and a dozen pair of shoes.  She is planning to use her profits to expand her business.  Her goal is to open her own shop.

loans.use: to buy 15  "pagnes", 15 pieces of damask fabric and a dozen pair of shoes.

loans.name: Serieux Group

texts.fr:
Les huit femmes du groupe Sérieux vivent toutes dans des familles nucléaires. Elles ont en moyenne 34 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier Hamdallaye l’un des quartiers de Ségou (4ème Région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté, mariage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le quartier Hamdallaye. Elles font le petit commerce d’habillements, d’ustensiles et de restauration. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur  2éme cycle du prêt solidaire.
 Madame Djeneba (1ére  femme debout de la gauche vers la droite dans la photo) est une grande vendeuse d’habillement dans le quartier Hamdallaye et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 1 balle de pagnes avec les fournisseurs dans les marchés de Ségou et de Bamako  pour la satisfaction de la demande clientèle. La vente se fait au comptant et souvent à crédit à une clientèle mixte dans le marché, à la maison et en ambulant.
 Madame Djeneba  espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de 19 000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé  pour prendre en charge une partie de la famille et augmenter son fonds de commerce.
texts.en:
The eight women who make up the Sérieux group all live in nuclear families.  On average, they are 34 years old and have three children each.  They all live in the Hamdallaye neighborhood of Ségou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

These women know one another through ties of neighborhood, kinship, marriage and also through their income-generating activities in the Hamdallaye neighborhood.  They are involved in retail businesses and sell clothes, utensils and cooked food.  In order to increase their businesses, the members of the group have decided to join Soro Yiriwaso.  This is their second cycle of solidarity loan.

Djeneba (in the standing row, first from the left in the photo) is an important seller of clothes in Hamdallaye and the surrounding neighborhoods.  In order to meet her customers' demand, she is planning to use her loan to buy one bale of "pagnes" (colorful West African fabrics) from suppliers at the Ségou and Bamako markets.  She sells her merchandise at the market and from home and she also works as an itinerant seller.  Her customers are men and women.  They pay her in cash and also often on credit.

With this loan, Djeneba hopes to make an average monthly profit of 19,000 CFA francs, which will be used to take care of some of her family's expenses and to increase her business.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 30 years and widowed. She, however, is blessed with one infant and one adult dependent. She has been running her hotel business for the last six years. She currently is making a monthly income of KES 23,700. She has successfully repaid all her previous loans and this is her fifth loan term. 

Mary would like a loan of KES 70,000 through which she will improve her hotel by buying stock such as flour as well as renovating her hotel by buying more furniture.

Mary will use her anticipated profits to repay her loan and pay for her child's school fees. In the future, she hopes that she will have a big enterprise.

loans.use: to improve her hotel by adding stock such as flour and renovating by buying furniture

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to help her crops grown

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more beauty products for her beauty salon.

loans.name: El - Shadai Group

texts.en:
Happy, who is in her late twenties, is single and has got a baby boy who is still young. She has been managing three projects which are close to each other. One is a grocery, selling soft drinks, beers, and spirits; second is gas supplier, where she fills and sells empty gas cylinders; lastly, she has a business, known as electronic money transfer (M-pesa and Togo pesa). Happy is in these business since 2007, and now is able to make a good monthly profit. She opens her businesses from 7:30 a.m. to 8:30 p.m. per working day. 

From Tujijenge, Tanzania, this is her first loan request, which she will use to buy gas cylinders and grocery drinks to resell. Happy dreams of expanding her business and becaming rich. She will share this loan with her loan group, El-Shadia, which totals five members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy gas cylinders and grocery drinks to resell.

loans.name: Majdi

texts.en:
Majdi is a 25-year-old single young man from Gaza city. His sister is an employee at a local firm where she gets a low income. This is the only source of income to the family. Majdi is a student at a local university where he studies Business Administration. He would like to take the BA degree and find a job in the future.
 
Majdi took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him buy a new laptop for his studies. By taking this loan, Majdi will be able to do his homework and write the reports easily.
 
Majdi appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies.

loans.name: Rami

texts.en:
Rami is a 29-year-old married man from Gaza city.  For the past three years Rami has been working in his barber shop making a good income.  He gained his experience form his previous job.

Rami took a USD loan from FATEN.  This loan will help him to buy a chair for his barber shop and by taking this loan, Rami will be able to improve his business.  Rami dreams of taking a bigger loan and expanding his salon.  He appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a chair for his barber shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay the university instalments for this semester.

loans.name: Ezzedeen

texts.en:
Ezzedeen is a 21-year-old single young man from Gaza city. His father is an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. This is the only source of income to the family. Ezzedeen is a student at a local university where he studies Business Administration. He would like to take the BA degree and find a job in the future.
 
Ezzedeen took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him buy a new laptop for his studies. By taking this loan, Ezzedeen will be able to do his homework and write the reports easily.
 
Ezzedeen appears in the photo in his university.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies.

loans.name: Basel

texts.en:
Basel is a 19-year-old single man from Dier Al-Balah city, Palestine. His father works in a local firm on a low salary, the only source of income for the family. Basel is a student at a local university where he studies science. He would like to complete his degree and find a job in the future. 
Basel has taken out a loan from FATEN so that he can buy a new laptop for his study. With this purchase, he will be able to study at home and write reports easily.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his university studies.

loans.name: Laeticia

texts.en:
Laeticia is a 31-year-old married woman with one child, aged eight years. She owns a boutique in a trading centre which she started in 2007. She works seven days a week and twelve hours per day. She also owns a second hand shoe business in the city market and she uses the additional income to support her family.

Laeticia started this business so that she could develop herself and earn a living. She usually sells her goods to local people from around Nakatogo Town and surrounding areas.

Laeticia has acquired this loan in order to buy used clothing to sell to her clients in Kalisizo Town and to educate her child. Her dreams are to have enough money of her own so that she no longer borrows from banks. She, however, faces challenges of lacking enough capital to expand the business.

She describes herself as honest and hardworking woman.

loans.use: To buy used clothing to sell

loans.name: Victorina

texts.es:
Victorina es una mujer de 38 años de edad luchadora con un grado de escolaridad de primaria incompleta la cual curso hasta su cuarto año y junto a su esposo y su numerosa familia compuesta por 6  viven en familia y trabajan en el campo en el cultivo y siembra de café. En su casa de habitación también tiene una pequeña pulperia la cual es rentable y de la cual en ocasiones ayuda a su esposo con algunos insumos no en cantidad que se pueden comprar. Ella y su familia se dedican al cultivo de café desde hace mucho tiempo pero también cultivan el frijol y maíz el cual es vendido en su propio negocio y para consumo en el hogar. Fueron sus padres los que le enseñaron como también a comercializar en el mercado local y sus alrededores su producto. El terreno que ella y su esposo cultivan es propio gracias al esfuerzo y sacrificio impuesto por muchos años de trabajo.
Actualmente solicita ayuda para la compra de abono, fertilizantes y foliares para dar una mejor y mayor asistencia a sus cultivos ya que por medio de esto ella podrá aprovechar su cosecha al máximo. Sus metas a corto plazo son de poder aumentar sus cosechas para producir más y generar más ingresos para cubrir los gastos de estudio, alimentación, vestimenta, medicina para el bienestar de sus hijos. Su sueño es seguir apoyando a sus hijos en la parte educativa para que ellos puedan graduarse y estudiar una carrera universitaria de provecho en el futuro.
texts.en:
Victorina is a determined 38 year old woman. She studied until grade 4 and did not finish elementary school. She, her husband, and their large family of 6 live together, and work together in the field planting coffee. Victorina also has a small convenience store in her home which is profitable and helps her husband with the purchase of certain supplies in quantities that cannot be bought otherwise. 

She and her family have earned a living by growing coffee for some time now, but they also grow beans and corn which they sell in the store and consume at home. Victorina's parents also taught her to sell her product in the local market and surrounding areas. Victorina and her husband own the land that they work thanks to their efforts and sacrifices over many years of work. 

Victorina is requesting this loan to buy manure, fertilizer, and foliar sprays to improve her crops and get the best harvest possible. Her short term goals are to increase her harvests and increase her income in order to cover the costs of schooling, food, clothing and medicine for her children's well being. She hopes to continue supporting her children in their studies so that they can study and have a useful university education in the future.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to help with her coffee crops.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be industrious. She operates a farm where she keeps dairy cows that produce milk for sale and grows crops. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her primary customers are farmers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be shortage of rain and diseases. 

She will use the KES 60,000 loan to buy fertilizer and other farm inputs. Her business goal is to be a supplier of milk and maize within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will open a dairy products shop. She will use the anticipated profits to add more dairy cows.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Ramziya

texts.en:
Ramziya is a 44-year-old married mother of four children. She is a Palestinian refugee who established a small clothing shop eight months ago. She assists her husband, who works  as a blacksmith, with their income to improve their family’s living situation. Ramziya used to work in a paper factory where she used to get a good salary, but unfortunately she had to quit in order to take care of her sick mother. Since her family’s needs are increasing, she established her current business next to her mother’s house so she can take care of both her business and mother at the same time. 
Her business and home are located in a Palestinian camp where the access to external customers is difficult and limited which is a big challenge she has to overcome.
For this reason, Ramziya is acquiring a loan from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua to develop special shop displays and to update her business merchandise with newly released spring and summer collections.
Ramziya is an optimistic person who seeks the best in everything. She hopes that in the future she can develop her business and eventually open another branch outside the camp.

loans.use: to develop special shop displays and to update her business merchandise with newly released spring and summer collections.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 46 years old. She is married and together with her husband, they have been blessed with four children. She currently owns a general shop that she has been running for 14 years now. She also has a secondary business where she raises goats, cows and chickens.

She currently makes an estimated monthly income of KES 27,000. She has successfully repaid all her previous loans. She would like a loan of KES 30,000 with which she will buy more stock of flour, soap and sugar for her general store.

In the future, Mary hopes to have an expanded business.

loans.use: to buy stock for her general store like flour, soap, and sugar.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 52 years old, from Nyandarua, and married. He is supporting two children who are aged 19 years and 14 years old. The spouse is a farmer.

David is a farmer and has been doing so for many years. He has applied for his third loan from VisionFund Kenya to enable him to buy seedlings and fertilizers to use in his farm.

David hopes to become the leading horticultural farmer in his area.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase the money transfer and credit card services he provides

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for tuition fees and purchase school supplies.

loans.name: Linet

texts.en: Linet is a 48-year-old widow with eight children. She describes herself to be industrious. She operates a farm where she keeps dairy cows that produce milk to sell. She also grows crops. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a favorable location and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be poor weather conditions. She will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy seeds and fertilizer. Her business goal is to expand within five years. This is her third loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Mary Jane works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling purified drinking water. Mary Jane is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy additional items like rice, eggs, charcoal, shampoo, soap, groceries, etc. to sell in her general store business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Mary Jane has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like rice, eggs, charcoal, shampoo, soap, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is married and has four children. 

She describes herself to be industrious. She operates a farm where she keeps dairy cows which produce milk for sale, and she also grows maize. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a rural area and her primary customers are farmers. Eunice describes her biggest business challenge to be a lack of rain. 

Eunice will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more farm inputs. Her business goal is to be a supplier of farm products within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will open a shop to sell farm products. She will use the anticipated profits to buy more land for farming.

loans.use: buy more farm inputs.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es: Miguel, tiene la edad  de 54 años, está casado y vive con su esposa y una hija. El pretende con el crédito realizar la compra de unos  cerdos y el alimento del mismo. El cuenta con varios cerdos   y lo que pretende es aumentar sus animales. El quiere tener sus animales con el peso ideal para su posterior venta en el mercado de la localidad o lugares aledaños. El quiere generar la mayor cantidad de ganancias para su bienestar  y la de su familia y crecer con el proyecto de engorde  de cerdos. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Miguel is 54 years old, married, and lives with his wife and daughter. He plans to use the loan to buy a few pigs and feed. He has a few pigs already, and would like to increase the amount of animals he has. He aims to have his pigs reach an ideal weight for sale in the local market, or markets in surrounding areas. Miguel would like to increase his income to improve his family's well-being, and to expand his business. 

This is the first loan that Miguel has received from FUDECOSUR. He had never had other loans from national banks, but FUDECOSUR has provided him this loan with greater ease and significantly lower interest rates.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

location.town: El Ceibo, San Vito, Coto Brus

loans.name: Bich

texts.en:
Bich, 44, is married and has one child. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. She and her husband have been running a soft drinks shop for seven years. Bich is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying more variety of soft drinks and coffee to better satisfy her customers.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions and sending her child to school.

loans.use: To buy more soft drinks and coffee

loans.name: Huyen

texts.en:
Huyen is 30 years old and is married with two children. She lives with her family in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is a security guard. Huyen supports her family by selling clothing, which she has been doing for 13 years.

She intends to take a loan to gradually expand her business by buying a variety of different clothing to sell to her customers. 

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a variety of different clothing to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Tiessiri Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre femmes du groupe Tiessiri  vivent toutes dans des familles nucléaires. Elles ont en moyenne 32 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier de  Missira l’un des quartiers de Ségou (4ème Région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté, mariage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le quartier de Missira. Elles font le petit commerce de jus de fruits, de condiment et la restauration. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur  3éme cycle du prêt solidaire.
 Madame Maimouna (1ére femme assise de la gauche vers la droite dans la photo) est une grande vendeuse de jus de fruits dans le quartier de Missira et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter une grande quantité suffisante de poudre de jus de fruits, de sucre et des petits ingrédients  chez les fournisseurs dans le marché pour la satisfaction de la demande clientèle. La vente des jus de fruits préparés se fait au comptant et souvent à crédit à une clientèle mixte dans le marché  à la maison et en ambulant.
 Madame Maimouna espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de 45 000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé  pour prendre en charge une partie de la famille et augmenter son fonds de commerce.
texts.en:
The four women of the Tiessiri group all live in nuclear families. On average, they are 32 years old and have three children. They all live in Segou’s Missira neighborhood (fourth administrative region of The Republic of Mali).

They know one another through neighbors, relatives, marriage, and their revenue-generating activities in the Missira neighborhood. They sell fruit juice, condiments, and restaurant supplies. With the goal of growing their business, the group members decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso. This is their third group loan. 

Madame Maimouna (pictured at left) is an important fruit juice saleswoman in and around the Missira neighborhood. In order to satisfy her clients, she would like to use her loan to buy a large quantity of powdered fruit juice, sugar, and other ingredients from the suppliers in the market. She sells her prepared fruit juices for cash and often for credit to a mixed clientele in the market, out of her home, and on foot. 

Madame Maimouna would like to earn an average monthly profit of 45,000 FCFA. With this loan, she will take care of her family and grow her business.

loans.use: to buy powdered fruit juice and sugar.

loans.name: Jose Palermo

texts.es:
Jose vive en la ciudad de Sayan, al lado de su familia; José es un hombre muy trabajador, el labora como apilador de sacos de arroz en un molino d su ciudad, asimismo ha iniciado un pequeño negocio de compra y venta de sacos de arroz al por mayor, que le permite tener un ingreso extra para poder salir adelante.

Jose esta agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar sacos de arroz por campaña, lo que le permitirá atender el pedido de sus clientes y poder mejorar sus ingresos, así el seguirá trabajando en su negocio y poder esforzarse para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Terminar de construir su vivienda”.
texts.en:
Jose lives in the city of Sayan along with his family. He is a very hard-working man who earns a living by stacking bags of rice in a mill in the city. He has also started a small business to buy and sell bags of rice wholesale, which allows him to earn extra income and make ends meet. 

Jose is very grateful to KIVA lenders, as thanks to their help he will be able to buy bags of rice every season, which will help him fulfill his customers' requests and increase his income. This will allow him to continue running his business and make his dream of finishing the construction of his house a reality.

loans.use: to buy rice wholesale.

loans.name: Thanh

texts.en:
Thanh, 22, is married and has been supporting her family by operating a beauty shop in the local community. She lives with her son and husband in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Thanh has been in her business for two years. She plans to use this loan to buy new hairdressing tools, cosmetics, and materials such as shampoo, dyes, and nail polish. In the future, she would like to expand her business and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy new hairdressing tools, cosmetics, and materials such as shampoo, dyes, and nail polish

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick is a married man. He has five children. He describes himself to be industrious. He operates a farm where he keeps dairy cows that produce milk to sell and he also grows maize. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a rural area and his primary customers are farmers. He will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more cows and farmland. His business goal is to be a supplier of farm products within five years. He will use the anticipated profits to buy more land for farming.

loans.use: to buy more cows and farmland

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 55 years old. She has one child and one adult dependent.  She has been running her hair salon for the last 4 years. She currently makes a estimated monthly income of KES.20,791.

Josephine would like to get a loan of KES.20,000 that she will use to buy beauty products like shampoo, hair oils, hair treatments, and hair conditioners to best serve her clients. In the future, Josephine dreams of having a successful business where she becomes the most preferred hair dresser in her town.

loans.use: to buy beauty products for her hair salon.

loans.name: Trang

texts.en:
Trang, 37, is married and has one daughter. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. She has been running a cafe for seven years. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying more types of soft drinks and coffee to better satisfy her customers.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions and sending her child to school.

loans.use: To buy more variety of soft drinks and coffee

loans.name: Bong

texts.en: Bong is a 55-year-old married woman living in Ho Chi Minh City. She has six children. She and her husband earn a living running a general store, which they have done for 10 years. Bong would like to take loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods such as snack foods and confectionery to stock her general store. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her existing customers and attract additional customers. She also hopes that through the loan, her business will generate a higher income and will help her to improve her family's living conditions and enable her to save money to meet any future difficulties.

loans.use: to buy more basic goods such as snack foods and confectionery to sell

loans.name: Al-Wafa Wa Al-Ikhlas Group

texts.en:
Al-Wafa Wa Al-Ikhlas is a group that consists of four women from Sana'a, Yemen. They are applying for a 140,000 YER loan from AMB.

Hadya is the group's leader. She is a 38-year-old married woman who lives with her husband in their own house. Hadya is an ambitious and active woman and works as a housewife. Many years ago, Hadya and her husband sold a piece of land to build their own house. They completed all of the renovations but because of the construction costs didn't have enough money to furnish it. Therefore, they have very old furniture. Hadya's loan of 40,000 YER from AMB will be used to purchase new furniture. Hadya looks forward to finishing and furnishing the second floor so she can start saving for her children.

loans.use: to purchase new furniture for her house

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es: Jorge, un hombre emprendedor , tiene 54 años de edad, es casado y vive con su esposa y un  hijo actualmente, el solicito un préstamo con el anhelo de  comprar insumos como abonos, y fumigantes, el desea dar asistencia a los cultivos de café, con la finalidad de mantenerlas en buenas condiciones durante su desarrollo, para obtener un producto de buena calidad , la única delimitación que este caballero tiene es la falta de dinero  para continuar creciendo, ya que de esta actividad económica dependen para poder salir adelante, por lo que él hace una solicitud  de  crédito , y es el segundo   préstamo que ha  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no registra otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja……
texts.en: Jorge, an enterprising man, is 54, married and currently living with his wife and a son.  He is requesting a loan with the desire of purchasing supplies like fertilizer and fumigants.  He wants to assist in coffee cultivation, and his goal is to maintain them in good conditions during their development and obtain a high-quality product.  The only thing limiting this gentleman is the lack of money to continue growing, since they depend on this this economic activity to get ahead.  That's why he's requesting a loan, and it is the second loan he's received from FUDECOSUR.  He doesn't register other loans at state banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered him the loan with the most ease and the lowest interest rate.

loans.use: buy supplies

location.town: El Ceibo, San Vito, Coto Brus

loans.name: Tuoi's Group

texts.en:
Tuoi is a 46-year-old married woman. She lives with her two daughters and husband in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns money as a carpenter. For 10 years, Tuoi has been running a business selling pork meat for people in her community.

She is the group leader of a five-member loan group. The members live in Ho Chi Minh City. In the picture, she is sitting in the center wearing a flowered shirt. The other group members are requesting loans to fund income-generating activities.

Tuoi would like a loan to purchase better quality pork meat at a competitive price to sell to her customers. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional customers. 

She also hopes that through her loan she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: to purchase better quality pork meat to sell

loans.name: Damaris

texts.en: Damaris is a 58-year-old married woman. She has four children with ages ranging from 21 to 25 years old. She describes herself as ambitious. She operates a farm where she keeps dairy cows which produce milk to sell. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a developing area and her primary customers are regular. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of finances. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more dairy cows. This will enable her to increase milk production. Her business goal is to be a supplier of milk within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a stable business. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more dairy cows

loans.name: Protea Group

texts.en:
Romana is the mother of two children, one of whom is in school while the other is still a baby. She is married and is in her late 20s. Romana has made her living by running a gengeduka (selling fruits, vegetables, rice, maize flour, sugar, soft drinks, soap, etc.) for five years. She opens her shop from 7 am to 11 pm per working day and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be her tenth loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. With her previous loans, all of which were paid back successfully, she bought more genge stock. Romana received a profit, which she used to pay for her household expenses and school fees. She will use this loan to replenish her business with fruits and vegetables. Romana dreams of managing a big shop.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Protea" which totals three members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to replenish her business with fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Sophia is 51 years old and widowed. However she is blessed with four children. She has been selling clothes for the last 8 years. She would like a loan of KES. 20,000 through which she will buy more clothes for selling to clients in her area.

She has successfully repaid all her previous loans. She currently makes an estimated monthly income of KES. 29,640. Sophia also rears livestock. She hopes that in future she will be able to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for selling

loans.name: Agreement

texts.en: Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 38 year old Agreement from Gokwe. He is married with seven children and five are attending school.  Agreement runs a manufacturing business producing school bags, travelers bags and cellphone pouches/bags. The business has been in operation for 4 years. He says the main challenge he is facing is the lack of finance . Agreement has requested a loan of $500 to buy sewing materials. He says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow him to increase his sales hence disposable income. In the future Agreement plans to have completed building his own shop.

loans.use: to buy sewing materials

loans.name: Abiud

texts.en:
Abiud is a 34-year-old man from the Kakamega region, which is located in the Western part of Kenya. He is a married man with three children who are eight, five and two years old respectively.

Abiud is a carpenter.He has been doing this for the last six years and gets a monthly income of KES. 96,000 through his struggles. He has applied for his third loan with VISIONFUND KENYA, which he will use to purchase materials like timber. He will use the anticipated income to plow back into his business.

Abiud has a dream of developing his business so as to support his family.

loans.use: to purchase more timber

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 41 years old. She has one child who is dependent on her. Her estimated monthly income is KES 18.000. She has been farming maize and beans and raising chicken and cattle for 10 years.

She will use her loan to buy fertilizer and seedlings for planting her land, which will expand her farming business. She would like a loan of KES 10,000. From the profits she makes, she will buy more land to expand her farming.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 25-year-old man who is responsible for the living of two other members of his family. Eight years ago he started his current business that has to do with scrap, that he learned how to run from his father, and developed it in a well managed way.
Currently Ali puts in all required effort to increase his source of income in order to cover all the increasing living demands and he might make some savings for his wedding in the future. 
He finds in Al Majmoua, Kiva’s field partner a ray of hope through acquiring a YOUTH loan that allows him to purchase a good quantity of copper for his store, which will increase his output and expand his business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase a good quantity of copper for his store which will increase his output and expand his business in the future.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 26 years old from Nyandarua and is married. Together with his wife they have one child who is three years old.

David is a farmer and has been farming it for many years. He has applied for his third loan from VisionFund Kenya to enable him buy a heifer.

He hopes to expand his business in the near future.

loans.use: To buy a heifer

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a farmer in Kangundo town where she plants maize, beans and vegetables for selling. She is 48 years of age, married, and has four children. Her husband also provides additional income for the support of the family.

This is Grace's third loan term with VisionFund Kenya and she plans to use the loan amount to buy farm inputs. These include fertilizer and seed for planting in her farm. Grace will use the generated income to buy more farm inputs for use on her farm.

Grace hopes to improve her farming and become one of the best farmers in the area, hence making more income and being able to improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs such as fertilizer and seed.

loans.name: Kevin

texts.en: Kevin is a 26-year-old married man. He has one child. He describes himself to be focused. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using a tuk tuk. He has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located in a vibrant location and his primary customers are of all types. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the lack of capital. He will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy a motorcycle to expand his transport business. He hopes that in the future, he will own a car to use as a taxi. This is his third loan with SMEP DTM. His previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Nelda

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Nelda works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from fish vending and raising pigs.  Nelda is borrowing PHP 11500 through NWTF to buy materials for the maintenance of her fishing boat for her fishing business.

Nelda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy materials for the maintenance of her fishing boat

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en: Hoa, 58, lives in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City with her family, including two daughters. She earns money through her printing business. Hoa would like to get a loan to buy a larger stock of printing material to enable her to increase her production capacity and better meet her customers' needs. She also hopes her business will ensure that her family members, and especially her children, will have a better education and a better future.

loans.use: to buy a larger stock of printing material for her printing business

loans.name: Hanh

texts.en: Hanh is a 38-year-old married woman living in Ho Chi Minh City. She has 2 children. Her husband earns a living working as a truck driver. Hanh supports her family by running a general store, which she has done for six years. Hanh would like to take loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as snack foods and confectionery, to stock her general store. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her existing customers and attract additional customers. She also hopes that through the loan her business will generate a higher income and will help her to improve her family's living conditions and enable her to save money for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as snack foods and confectionary, to stock her general store

loans.name: Razelda

texts.en:
Razelda works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy and sell of rice grains business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell.

Razelda has been in this business for seven years now.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Elena works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Elena is borrowing PHP 14000 through NWTF to purchase a new bundle of fishing net for her fishing business.

Elena has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase a new bundle of fishing net

loans.name: Sheryl

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Sheryl works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from fish vending and nipa roofing. Sheryl is borrowing PHP 14000 through NWTF to purchase of fishing materials like fishing net, gasoline, bamboo, etc for her fishing business.

Sheryl has been sustaining her business activities through her past 7 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase of fishing materials like fishing net, gasoline, bamboo, etc

loans.name: Mai's Group

texts.en:
Mai, 56, is single. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Mai has been running a general store in front of her house for thirty years.  She is the Group Leader of a 8-member loan group that all live in Ho Chi Minh City. In the picture she is the fourth from the left wearing a grey jacket. Each of the other group members are requesting loans to fund income-generating activities.

Mai is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying basic foods and beverages to stock her store and better satisfy her customers. She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy food and beverages to sell from her general store

loans.name: Tuyen

texts.en:
Tuyen is a 51-year-old married woman. She lives with her three children and husband in Ho Chi Minh City. For seven years she has operated a cafe in front of her house. And her husband earns a living selling shrimp feed.

Tuyen would like a loan to purchase a greater range and quantity of beverages and coffee to stock her store. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional customers. 

Tuyen also hopes that through her loan she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: to purchase a greater range and quantity of beverages and coffee to stock her store

loans.name: Ustawi Group

texts.en:
Mwajuma, who is in her late thirties, is married and has three children, two of whom are in school. For two years now Mwajuma makes her family living by running several businesses. She manage a second hand clothes business, charcoal store and makes fresh juices and ice cream. She runs all of these businesses with the assistance of her grown son. Mwajuma runs her business from 08 am to 06 pm per working day and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be her fifth loan request from Kiva partner Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to open her second hand clothes project and bought more sacks of charcoal to sell. She managed to repay the loans successfully. Mwajuma earned extra income which she used to pay school fees, home costs and saved for her future. She dreams of building a house. She will use this loan to buy second hand clothes to resell. 

Mwajuma will share this loan with her loan group" Ustawi" which totals two members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy second hand clothes to resell.

loans.name: Cleophas

texts.en: Cleophas is a 49-year-old married man. He has 5 children. He describes himself to be determined. He operates a retail business where he sells bread. He has been involved in this business for 8 years. His business is located in urban area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be shortage of bread. He will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more stocks of bread. His business goal is to excel within 5 years. He hopes that in the future he will be a better supplier. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stocks of bread

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana is 30 years old. She is married and together with her husband they have been blessed with two children and they also have three adult dependents. Juliana has been running her store which sells candy and biscuits for the last 10 years. Juliana makes an estimated monthly income of 15,000. She has 6 employees who assist her.

Juliana has successfully repaid all her previous loans and would like a loan of KES. 75,000. Through this loan she she will add sweets and biscuits in bulk to sell to clients in her area.

loans.use: to buy sweets and biscuits for resale

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria works hard to support her family. Gloria is married and has a buy and sell fresh fish business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 30000 loan through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

Gloria has been in this business for 4 years now.

In the future Gloria would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Welinda

texts.en:
Welinda is 22 years old and married with one child.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like sugar, rice, shampoo, soap, groceries, etc.

Welinda has borrowed and repaid 5 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 2 years and also earns an income from the direct selling of Avon products.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like sugar, rice, shampoo, soap, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Vladimir

texts.en:
Vladimir is happy to have his second deal with Kiva and greatly thanks for the first one, which he used to pay for his son’s tuition fee for a master's degree. Vladimir lives in Yerevan. He works at the mineral water producing company as a sales manager. He has a daughter and a son.  His son is talented and unique young man. He graduated Yerevan State Conservatoire, faculty of Folk Musical Instruments; he plays perfectly on reed pipes in numerous concerts  and competitions. His son's talent has made him famous and well known not only in their city. Now he studies in the magistracy of Yerevan State University, at the paid division in a newly opened department of Mass Media Research and Education Center, faculty of Directing. He has great plans for the near future and a good perspective to work at TV.
Vladimir this time also relies on Kiva lenders support and asks this loan in order to pay for his son’s tuition fee for a master's degree for second semester.

loans.use: to pay for his son’s tuition fee for a master's degree for the second semester

loans.name: Julay

texts.en:
Julay is 59 years old and a widow with four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc..

Julay has borrowed and repaid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from buy and sell charcoal.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.l

loans.name: Laura Tatiana

texts.es:
Ella es Laura Tatiana estudia en campo alto, Administración hotelera, tiene 18 años, vive en con los padres, la mama Gloria Esperanza es ama de casa y el padre Carlos Arturo, trabaja como soldador.
Hasta el día de hoy le ha gustado lo que está estudiando, antes de estudiar eso pensó en estudiar psicología, pero por cuestiones de economía escogió otra carrera.
Ha aprendido a hacer un desayuno Americano, También pudo conocer todas la instalaciones de un hotel, hasta el momento todo ha sido bueno, espera seguir conociendo más cosas acerca de la hotelera.  
En este momento sería de gran ayuda el convenio de kiva ya que el trabajo del padre no siempre es muy estable y los recursos económicos en la casa son un poco limitados, con el convenio kiva le sería un poco más fácil el pago de las cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Laura Tatiana studies hotel administration at Campo Alto.  she is 18 and lives with her parents.  Her mother, Gloria, is a housewife and her father, Carlos Arturo, is a welder.

Up to now, she has enjoyed what she has been studying.  At one time she thought about studying psychology, but for financial reasons, she chose a different degree.

She has learnt how to make an American breakfast.  She has also been able to learn about all the services a hotel offers; and so far everything has been good.  She hopes to continue learning more about how a hotel works. 
 
At the moment, the Kiva agreement can help her a lot as her father's work is not very stable and the family have got limited financial resources.  She hopes that with the help of the Kiva loans, it will be a little easier to pay off the monthy installments.

loans.use: to pay for a semester's education costs.

loans.name: Shaline

texts.en:
Here is Shaline a 20-year-old young and energetic farmer who began farming at a very early age, but her hard work is very encouraging. She has been into farming for the past 5 years and this is what gives her income to cater for her day to day needs and also to invest in other farming projects. Her primary source of income is milk and tea.
She took a loan to enable her purchase poultry for egg production and also selling poultry meat. This will increase her income and better her living standards.

loans.use: For purchasing poultry.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy  more sheep and feed for his business.

loans.name: Celina

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Celina works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from selling laundry powder and having a bakery. Celina is borrowing PHP 18000 through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell like can goods, eggs, noodles, soap, coffee, etc for her general store business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she requested additional loan to further build her business.

Celina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 28 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell like can goods, eggs, noodles, soap, coffee, etc

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
As a married parent of ten children, Luzviminda works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from making nipa roofing.  Luzviminda is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to buy additional stocks of items to sell like can goods, eggs, milk, coffee, etc for her general store business.

Luzviminda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of items to sell like can goods, eggs, milk, coffee, etc

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene works hard to support her family. Arlene is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to purchase soap, milk, coffee, can goods, etc for her business.

Arlene has been in this business for 7 years now. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she requested an additional loan to further build her business.

In the future Arlene would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase soap, milk, coffee, can goods, etc for her business

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Lolita works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from motorcycle transport.  Lolita is borrowing PHP 16000 through NWTF to buy household goods like can goods, chips, bread, soft drinks, etc for her general store business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she requested additional loan to further build her business.

Lolita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy household goods like can goods, chips, bread, soft drinks, etc

loans.name: Narissa

texts.en:
Narissa is 49 years old and married with four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy and sell charcoal business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy sacks of charcoal to sell for her business.

Narissa has borrowed and repaid 9 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy and sell charcoal business for 4 years and also earns an income from food vending.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she requested additional loan to further build her business.

Narissa aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal to sell for her business

loans.name: Natia

texts.en:
Natia is a 32-year-old married woman from Tbilisi city. She lives with her husband and parents-in-law. Male members of family are private artisans and they monthly generate 300-300 GEL. Natia had studied for professional career and works as a private German teacher. She has a great desire to increase her productivity and start another activity. Natia requested a loan of 600 USD to purchase various kinds of home products and linens at wholesale prices and then resell at an increased price among her neighbors and friends. 
The new business initiative will give her a chance to have financial stability and increased monthly income as she will have her loyal customers and also get orders for specific products. Natia looks forward for your help and will be very appreciative.

loans.use: To start a retail business with various home products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for tuition fees and purchase more education equipment.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his tuition fees and buy education equipment for him.

loans.name: Clarissa

texts.en:
Clarissa works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines. Clarissa has been in this business for three years now. 

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business. Clarissa requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like flour, butter, sugar, etc.

In the future, Clarissa would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like flour, butter, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Radik

texts.en:
Radik lives in Ijevan city in Tavush region. He is 27 years old and he is already married and a father of a very pretty girl. Radik lives with his parents, wife and 2-year-old daughter. His father is taxi driver; both his mother and his wife are unemployed. 

Radik has vocational education. Now, like his father, he provides taxi services. He also provides car repairing services, and at the same time in a nearby village called Kiranc, he runs a farm. In his farm he has two cows and two piglets. The milk and meat that he sells is not a lot, but provides some support for his family's needs. 

By saving little by little during the previous years, Radik managed to repair their flat and also to furnish it. He says he would like to have bigger farm and also to increase his family's income.

He needs this loan in order to buy a bull and also fodder for his bulls and pigs. He is ready to work hard and combine his occupations to provide all his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a bull and also fodder for his bulls and pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new computer.

loans.name: Usalama Group

texts.en:
Abibie is a mother of two grown daughters who are still living at home. She is divorced and makes a living by running a business of mamalishe (a small food vending business). Abibie is also involved with a small business selling cloths on credit to different women. She works from 6am to 3pm each day and is able to make a very small profit each month. 

Abibie is requesting her second loan from Kiva's partner Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to take more orders of fabrics from her customers. She has successfully paid back the entire loan. With the extra income she received, Abibie covered home food expenses and put money back into her business. Abibie will use this loan to buy fabrics to resell. She dreams that one day she will be able to expand her projects and build a house for her family. 

She will share this loan with her loan group" USALAMA" which comprises four members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy fabrics to resell.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is 63 years old, married and works hard to support her family. She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending.  

Cristina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 22 loans from NWTF. She has successfully paid back her previous loans and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business. Cristina is now borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase spare parts for motorcycle maintenance for her motorcycle transport business.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for her motorcycle maintenance.

loans.name: Alvard

texts.en:
Alvard is from Gyumri town where she lives with her mother. She has been involved in a small retail business for five years. Specifically, she receives orders and sells cosmetics. Alvard likes the work she does so she tries to provide high quality services for her customers.

This loan will be a big support for Alvard, and will help her to purchase cosmetics supplies for covering her current orders. Alvard has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans, with soft conditions, to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

Please support this hard working woman to continue her small business and develop it further.

loans.use: to pay for cosmetics supplies for covering orders.

loans.name: Marvin

texts.es: Marvin , un hombre emprendedor , tiene 52 años de edad, es casado y vive con su esposa y tres  hijos  actualmente, el solicito un préstamo con el anhelo de  comprar insumos como abonos, y fumigantes, el desea dar asistencia a los cultivos de papa chiricana , con la finalidad de mantenerlas en buenas condiciones durante su desarrollo, para obtener un producto de buena calidad , la única delimitación que este caballero tiene es la falta de dinero  para continuar creciendo, ya que de esta actividad económica dependen para poder salir adelante, por lo que él hace una solicitud  de  crédito , y es el segundo   préstamo que ha  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no registra otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja……
texts.en: Marvin, an enterprising man, is 52 years old, married and currently lives with his wife and three children. He requested a loan with the desire to purchase supplies such as fertilizers and fumigating sprays. He wishes to support his crops of papa chiricana [a tuber similar to yucca], in order to keep them in good condition during their development, and to obtain a high quality product. The only limitation this gentleman has is a lack of money to continue growing, since he depends on this economic activity to get ahead. For this reason he is requesting a loan. It is the second loan he has received from FUDECOSUR. He does not have other loans in state-owned banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered him a loan with greater facility and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy supplies

location.town: Bello Oriente, Agua Buena, Coto Brus

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 25–year-old single man, and is the sole breadwinner for three members of his family. He has worked in selling and providing maintenance services of motorcycles since he was nine years old, after he had to quit school during his elementary stages, to help his parents in their living expenses.
  
Ahmad is a hard worker, and is well known in his region with his special talents and prices, and is highly recommended to deal with.

Ahmad has been a borrower of Al Majmoua for four consecutive cycles. His previous loans helped him a lot in increasing his business capital through buying special tires and motorcycles, which he needed to keep his business running properly. Today, Ahmad is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, which will be invested in buying motorcycles, which he will sell at special prices.

He hopes to keep on developing his business through increasing his tools and his business merchandise with new released items in the future.

loans.use: buy motorcycles which he will sell at special prices.

loans.name: Amira

texts.en:
Amira is 49-year-old widowed mother with five children. A year ago she started to sell home products from her house, then she decided to shift to selling clothes because she finds herself more efficient in this domain.

This is Amira’s first loan cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower. With this loan she will increase her business merchandise with newly released collections for the summer season that will attract customers attention and increase her income.

In the future she hopes to fulfill her dream through establishing her own separate clothes shop outside her house, where she can increase her capital and display more diversified products.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise with newly released collection for the summer season.

loans.name: Sabali Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre femmes du groupe Sabali vivent toutes dans des familles nucléaires. Elles ont en moyenne 43 ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier de Darsalam l’un des quartiers de Ségou (4ème Région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté, mariage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le quartier de Darsalam. Elles font le petit commerce, de condiments, de fruits et légumes de produits cosmétiques, etc. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur  17éme cycle du prêt solidaire.
 Madame Hawa  (2éme  femme assise de la droite vers la gauche dans la photo) est une grande vendeuse de bananes plantains et condiments de tout genre dans le quartier de Darsalam et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter une quantité suffisante de condiments de tout genre avec les maraîchers et les grossistes de Ségou  pour la satisfaction de la demande clientèle. La vente se fait au comptant et souvent à crédit à une clientèle majoritairement féminine dans le quartier et au marché.
 Madame Hawa  espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de 30 000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé  pour prendre en charge une partie de la famille et augmenter son fonds de commerce.
texts.en:
The four women of the Sabali group all live in nuclear families. They average 43 years of age with five children each. They all live in the Darsalam district of Ségou (the Republic of Mali's fourth administrative region). They got to know each other as neighbors, relatives, through marriage and through their income-generating activities in the Darsalam district. They have small businesses selling condiments, fruit and vegetables, cosmetics, etc. They decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso so that they could expand their businesses, and they are on their 17th group loan.

Hawa (who is sitting second from the right in the photo) is a significant seller of plaintain bananas and all sorts of condiments in the Darsalam district and surrounding areas. She is planning to use her loan to buy a sufficient quantity of all sorts of condiments from market gardeners and wholesalers in Ségou, so that she can satisfy customer demand.
