She sells her products for cash and often on credit, in her district and at the market, to an essentially female customer base.

Hawa hopes to make an average monthly profit of 30,000FCFA  with this loan, and will use the profits to cover some of her family's expenses and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Suzan

texts.en:
Suzan is a 44-year-old single lady, and is the sole breadwinner of two members of her family. Two months ago, she was employed in a beauty salon, specializing in nail care services.

Suzan is a determined person, who works hard to develop her living. For this reason she is working to acquire special talents in her domain, so that one day she might start her own business.

Suzan is committed to covering her family’s increasing needs, but she  is unable to pay for any unexpected costs. For this reason, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua, to pay for her necessary medical surgery to stay in a good health and make sure she can stay capable of covering her family’s living expenses.

loans.use: to pay for her necessary medical surgery to stay in a good health.

loans.name: Sabougnouman Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre femmes du groupe Sabougnouman vivent toutes dans des familles nucléaires. Elles ont en moyenne 27 ans et 2 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier de Darsalam l’un des quartiers de Ségou (4ème Région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté, mariage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le quartier de Darsalam. Elles font le petit commerce, d’habillement et restauration. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur  2éme cycle du prêt solidaire.
 Madame Aminata (1ére  debout de la droite vers la gauche dans la photo) est une grande vendeuse d’habillement dans le quartier de Darsalam et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 2 pièces de Bazin avec les grossistes de Ségou et de Bamako  pour la satisfaction de la demande clientèle. La vente se fait au comptant et souvent à crédit à une clientèle mixte dans le marché, à la maison et en ambulant.
 Madame Aminata  espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de 24 000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé  pour prendre en charge une partie de la famille et augmenter son fonds de commerce.
texts.en:
The four women of the Sabougnouman group all live in nuclear families. They average 27 years of age with two children each. They all live in the Darsalam district of Ségou (the Republic of Mali's fourth administrative region). They got to know each other as neighbors, relatives, through marriage and through their income-generating activities in the Darsalam district. They have small clothing and restauration businesses. The group members decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso with a view to expanding their businesses and are on their second group loan.

Aminata, who is standing on the right of the photo, is a significant seller of clothing in the Darsalam district and its surroundings. With her loan she is planning to buy two pieces of damask fabric from wholesalers in Ségou and Bamako, so that she can satisfy customer demand. She sells her products for cash and often on credit to a mixed customer base, in the market, from home and on a door-to-door basis.

Aminata hopes to make an average monthly profit of 24,000FCFA with this loan, and will use the profits partly to provide for her family and partly to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy damask fabric.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita is 66 years old and is married six children. She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Angelita has been pig fattening for one year and also earns additional income from growing vegetables.

Angelita is now borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling vegetables in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years, and earns additional income from renting a boarding house. 

Rowena has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She has successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business. She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to purchase additional vegetables to sell in her business. 

She dreams to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 23-year-old single man, who has been working as a barber for a long time. Ali had to quit school during his intermediate stages, in order to support his parents in their living.

In 2013, he established his own business, and he is working hard on developing it as much as he can to make sure it will provide a good income.

Today, Ali is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to make necessary maintenance and decoration to his shop to keep it attractive to current and new customers. He is working hard to keep on developing his business to improve his income, and he hopes to move to a bigger shop soon.

loans.use: to make necessary maintenance and decoration to his shop to keep it attractive to current and new customers.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a 30-year-old married man. He describes himself to be focused. He operates a retail business where he sells bread. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. 

Daniel's business is located in a good area and his primary customers are the general public. He describes his biggest business challenge to be a lack of funds. He will use the loan of KES 50,000 to buy more stock of bread. 

His business goal is to expand within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will have improved his family's living conditions. He will use the anticipated profits to add more stock.

loans.use: to buy more stock of bread to sell.

loans.name: Vicky

texts.en:
Vicky is a 31-year-old married woman with two children. 

Vicky describes herself to be focused. She operates a transport business whereby she owns a motorcycle which transports customers from one place to another. Her business is located in an urban area and her primary customers are the general public. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insecurity. 

She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy a new motorcycle. Her business goal is to buy a tuk tuk for business within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful. This is her third loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy a new motorcycle.

loans.name: Mylyn

texts.en:
Mylyn is 31 years old and is married with four children. She works hard to provide for her family. 

She runs a business buying and selling nipa roofing in the Philippines. She has been running the business for five years and also earns an income from buying and selling charcoal.

Mylyn has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of nipa roofing to sell. She has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. 

Mylyn aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of nipa roofing to sell.

loans.name: Ketevani

texts.en:
Ketevani is 53 years old, single, and lives in Rustavi city. She lives with her sister and daughter. 

Ketevani wasn't able to get a higher education, which is why she can't find a stable job, and nowadays works as a cook from which she generates a small income. Her sister works at a private organization and has a fixed salary. However their income is insignificant and the family needs some investment for further development. 

Ketevani received the loan within the framework of a joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The Startup Program gives rural poor people the chance to start or re-start businesses. With the requested money she will purchase stock of textiles and start sewing. She has experience and will take private orders for various clothing, curtains and linens.
 
She is a very enthusiastic and hard working person with a great desire to become financially stable. This credit will be a great support for the family. Ketevani is thankful to Kiva Lenders for giving her a chance to start her own business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of  textiles and start sewing.

loans.name: Myra

texts.en:
As a married mother of two, Myra works hard to support her family. She has a beauty parlor business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. She is borrowing 30,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of beauty products for her business.

Myra successfully paid back her previous loan and now has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Myra has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of beauty products for her buisness

loans.name: Jocinta

texts.en: Jocinta is married with three children and describes herself as determined. She operates a small retail business selling potatoes, which she has been involved in for 10 years. Her business is located in a good area and she has a wide variety of customers. Jocinta describes her biggest business challenge to be a lack of funds. She will use the 50,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) loan to buy more potatoes and her business goal is to expand within five years.

loans.use: to buy more potatoes

loans.name: Tiessiri Group

texts.fr:
Les six femmes du groupe Tiessiri  vivent toutes dans des familles nucléaires. Elles ont en moyenne 41 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier de Darsalam l’un des quartiers de Ségou (4ème Région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté, mariage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le quartier de Darsalam. Elles font le petit commerce, d’huile alimentaires d’habillement, de condiments et de restauration. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur  11éme cycle du prêt solidaire.
 Madame Djenebou   N°2   (1ére  femme  de la droite vers la gauche dans la photo) est une grande vendeuse d’huiles alimentaire dans le quartier de Darsalam et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 20 bidons d’huile chez les grossistes à Ségou. La vente se fait au comptant et souvent à crédit à une clientèle mixte dans le marché de Ségou, à la maison et en ambulant.
 Madame Djenebou  N°2  espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de 70 000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé  pour prendre en charge une partie de la famille et augmenter son fonds de commerce.
texts.en:
The six women of the Tiessiri group all live in nuclear families. They average 41 years of age with four children each. They all live in the Darsalam district of Ségou (the Republic of Mali's fourth administrative region). They got to know each other as neighbors, relatives, through marriage and through their income-generating activities in the Darsalam district. They have small edible oils, clothing, condiments and restauration businesses. The group members decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso with a view to expanding their businesses and are on their 11th group loan.

Djenebou no. 2, who is standing on the far right of the photo, is a significant seller of edible oils in the Darsalam district and its surroundings. With her loan she is planning to buy 20 containers of oil from wholesalers in Ségou. She sells her oil for cash and often on credit to a mixed customer base in Ségou market, from home and on a door-to-door basis.

Djenebou no. 2 hopes to make an average monthly profit of 70,000FCFA with this loan, and will use the profits to provide for part of her family and to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy oil.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les six femmes du groupe Danaya vivent toutes dans des familles nucléaires. Elles ont en moyenne 44 ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier  de Missira l’un des quartiers de Ségou (4ème Région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté, mariage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le quartier de Missira. Elles font le petit commerce d’habillement, de restauration et de condiment. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur  5éme cycle du prêt solidaire.
 Madame Rokia (1ére  femme debout de la droite vers la gauche dans la photo) est une grande vendeuse des pagnes wax dans le quartier de Missira et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 11 pièces de pagnes wax avec les grossistes dans les marchés de Ségou et à Bamako  pour satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle. La vente se fait au comptant et souvent à crédit à une clientèle mixte dans le marché et à la maison et en ambulant.
 Madame Rokia espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de  40.000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé  pour aider son mari et augmenter son fonds de commerce.
texts.en:
The six women of the Danaya group all live in nuclear families. They average 44 years of age with five children each. They all live in the Missira district of Ségou (the Republic of Mali's fourth administrative region). They got to know each other as neighbors, relatives, through marriage and through their income-generating activities in the Missira district. They have small clothing, restauration and condiments businesses. The group members decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso with a view to expanding their businesses and are on their fifth group loan.

Rokia, who is standing on the far right of the photo, is a significant seller of "pagne wax" (brightly colored and highly decorative fabric) in the Missira district and its surroundings. With her loan she is planning to buy 11 pieces of "pagne wax" fabric from wholesalers in Ségou and Bamako, so that she can satisfy customer demand. She sells her products for cash and often on credit to a mixed customer base, in the market, from home and on a door-to-door basis.

Rokia hopes to make an average monthly profit of 40,000FCFA with this loan, and will use the profits to help her husband and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy "pagne wax" fabric.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre femmes du groupe Danaya vivent toutes dans des familles nucléaires. Elles ont en moyenne 42 ans et 2 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier de Missira l’un des quartiers de Ségou (4ème Région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté, mariage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le quartier de Missira. Elles font le petit commerce, de restauration et de grains. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur  2éme cycle du prêt solidaire.
 Madame Sata (2éme  femme debout de la gauche vers la droite dans la photo) est une grande vendeuse de farine sucrée et pâté dans le quartier de Missira et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter une quantité suffisante de farine à Ségou  pour la satisfaction de la demande clientèle. La vente se fait au comptant et souvent à crédit à une clientèle mixte dans le quartier et en ambulant.
 Madame Sata espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de 30 000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé  pour prendre en charge une partie de la famille et augmenter son fonds de commerce.
texts.en:
The four women of the Danaya group all live in nuclear families. They average 42 years of age with two children each. They all live in the Missira district of Ségou (the Republic of Mali's fourth administrative region). They got to know each other as neighbors, relatives, through marriage and through their income-generating activities in the Missira district. They have small restauration and grain-selling businesses. The group members decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso with a view to expanding their businesses and are on their second group loan.

Sata, who is standing second from the left in the photo, is a significant seller of sweet flour and dough in the Missira district and its surroundings. With her loan she is planning to buy a suficient quantity of flour in Ségou to satisfy her customer demand. She sells her products for cash and often on credit to a mixed customer base, in the district and on a door-to-door basis.

Sata hopes to make an average monthly profit of 30,000FCFA with this loan, and will use the profits to provide for part of her family and to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy flour.

loans.name: Fadi

texts.en:
Fadi is a 29-year-old single man from Deir Elbalah. He lives with his family in a very simple house. Two years ago, Fadi started his own business having a farm for raising sheep. It is a good business that earns a good income. Fadi would like to improve his business to increase his income.

Fadi took a USD loan from FATEN to buy more sheep and feed for his business. By taking this loan, Fadi will be able to improve his business and increase productivity. Fadi appears in the photo on his farm.

loans.use: to buy more sheep and animal feed for his business.

loans.name: Obed

texts.en:
Obed is a 27-year-old married man. He operates a business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in a conducive environment and his primary customers are the general public. He describes his biggest business challenge to be poor roads.

Obed will use the KES 60,000 loan to buy another motorcycle.This will enable him to expand his business and earn more income. His business goal is to own more motorcycles within five years. He will use the anticipated profits to improve his living standards.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Angeles

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Angeles works hard to support her family. She buys and sells charcoal in the Philippines. She also earns additional income selling fish (dried and fresh) and having a general store. Angeles is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Angeles successfully repaid her previous loan and is now requesting an additional loan to further build her business. Angeles has been sustaining her business activities through her past 22 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy charcoal.

loans.name: Pochol Group

texts.en:
These four women named their group after their neighborhood in the Guatemalan Highland community of Nahuala.  Their area is a lush agricultural region where coffee and bananas are cultivated.  These women are strongly motivated to continue learning and growing their businesses through a third cycle of education and business advising from Namaste. Their businesses include food sales, clothing sales and coffee sales.
Manuela (second from left) is 62 years old with a husband who works as an agricultural laborer and 5 grown children.  Her business is selling coffee.  Manuela is illiterate and is very proud of the fact that the proceeds from her small business allowed all five of her children to go to school and complete their studies. During the first two loan cycles with Namaste she learned many practical ways to improve her business. She was able to expand her sales and add bananas and chili powder to the products she sells. During this third cycle she wants to add a greater variety of fruits to sell and will also start selling at a Sunday market in a neighboring town. She will invest her loan money in buying product in larger quantities at better prices.
Manuela is an outstanding member of her group. She puts all that she learns immediately into practice because she has seen how beneficial the advice of her Namaste business advisor has been to making her business more successful. Her dream now is to grow her business enough so that with the extra income she can improve their living conditions.  Her current monthly profits are about 3280 Guatemalan Quetzales; and she and her business advisor are projecting a 100% increase in profits over the next nine months.

loans.use: to add a greater variety of fruits

loans.name: Shangwe Group

texts.fr: La cliente Françoise femme ambitieuse bourrée de talents et membre du groupe d’affaires «Shangwe», responsable, âgée de 38 ans,  mère de 4 enfants tous scolarisés. Elle sollicite ce nouveau crédit pour s’approvisionner en matériels de salon de coiffure (tondeuse, mèches, brosses, ficelles, pinces, etc.), qui constitue son activité principale. Elle débuta son entreprise avec de fonds recu de ses parents. Elle souhaite  acheter une parcelle et la construire pour la stabilité de sa famille. Elle remercie Hekima de soutenir les femmes pauvres économiquement actives.
texts.en:
Françoise is an ambitious, talented woman and a responsible member of the business group Shangwe.  She is 38 years old and mother to four children who all attend school.

Françoise has requested this loan in order to buy equipment for her hairdressing salon (clippers, hair extensions, brushes, hair tongs, etc.).  This is her main business venture and she started with funds received from her parents.  She would like to buy a plot of land and build a house to improve the stability of her family.

Françoise is grateful to the field partner, Hekima for the support which they offer to poor, economically active women.

loans.use: to buy equipment for her hairdressing salon (clippers, hair extensions, brushes, hair tongs, etc.)

loans.name: Vida 1 Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario está integrado por  tres socios exitosos, coordinado por el señor Marcos coordinador, 38 años de edad y acompañado es propietario de una abarrotería en el mercado municipal tiene 2 años administrándolo, por lo que el crédito lo solicita para la compra de granos básicos como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, especies, etc. Otros de los socios es le señor Freddy de 36 años quien se dedica a vender perecederos y la señora María 35 años vende comida en el domicilio.
texts.en: This united group is comprised of three successful members. They are coordinated by 38 year old Marcos who has a partner and is the proprietor of a grocery store in the town market. He has been administrating the group for 2 years. They loan that they are requesting will be used to buy staple goods such as rice, beans, sugar, oil, spices, etc. The other members are 36 year old Freddy, who sells perishable goods, and 35 year old María, who sells food from home.

loans.use: to buy staple goods such as rice, beans, oil, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Asma

texts.en:
Asma is a 26-year-old single lady, who is responsible for four members of her family. She started working as an accountant eight months ago to improve her family’s living standards and be capable of covering their increasing living expenses.

Asma is acquiring her second loan from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua, which she requested before to cover most of her increasing family needs. 

Her current loan will be used to pay for her brothers’ increasing school tuition fees. She is working hard to provide them with the necessary education to make sure that they can have a better future and living.

She hopes that one day in the future she can open and run her own restaurant to improve her family’s living standards.

loans.use: to pay her brothers’ increasing school tuition fees.

loans.name: Rios De Agua Viva Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “RIOS DE AGUA VIVA” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santago II, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Eugenia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tienda de barrio, venta de ropa, venta de fruta, venta de mantas, venta de chuño, tejido de mantas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Paola es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una compañera de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de  tejido y venta de mantas de alpaca; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió recientemente, ya que anteriormente tejía para su tía, con un pequeño capital decide emprender un negocio independiente.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana de alpaca) que adquirirá de las fronteras Bolivia - Chile y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es casada  y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la garantía que se realiza en la institución.
texts.en:
The loan group Rios de Agua Viva will start it's first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Centro Focal de Santago II. The group is comprised of 8 members and is directed by a board of which Eugenia is the president. The members run various businesses, including: a neighborhood store, selling clothes, selling fruit, selling shawls, selling freeze-dried potatoes called chuño, weaving shawls. 
The loan that they are requesting will benefit small enterprises including Paola's. She says that this is the first time that she has been a member of Pro Mujer and that she was invited by someone from the institution who went to visit her in her home. Currently, she has a weaving business and sells alpaca shawls. She tells us that she started this business recently and that she previously wove for her aunt. When she had a little capital, she decided to start an independent business.
The loan she is currently requesting will be used to increase her capital to buy alpaca wool that she will get from the border between Bolivia and Chile and that later she will make and sell shawls in her sales location. This form of work enables her to generate resources to support her family as she is married and has 5 children.
When she was asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responded that she likes the security that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy alpaca wool.

loans.name: Tajeu

texts.en:
Tajeu used the money from his past loan well by buying the fertilizers and seedlings that he needed to use on his farm.

He has applied for his second loan from VisionFund Kenya to enable him buy additional fertilizers and seedlings again to use on his farm.

He hopes to be among the top farmers in Sakutiek.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizers.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a 30-year-old married man with 1 child. He describes himself as a determined person. He operates a business selling bread. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. David's business is located in an area with potential and his primary customers are locals. His biggest business challenge is poor roads. 

David will use the 40,000 KES loan to buy a motorcycle for distributing bread to his customers. His business goal is to expand within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will be a  prominent business man. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for distributing bread to his customers

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a 54-year-old married woman. She has two children. She describes herself as kind. She operates a retail business where she sells potato chips. She has been involved in this business for 20 years. Her business is located in a residential area and her primary customers are local residents. 

She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more stock of potatoes. Her business goal is to open a restaurant within 5 years. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of potatoes.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 32 years old. She married and together with her spouse they have been blessed with two children. She has been farming for the past 5 years. She would like a loan to buy livestock feed and clothes for her children and pay school fees.

She currently makes an estimated monthly income of KES 11,000. She would like a loan of KES 5,000. She anticipates that through her profits, she will add farming of livestock and build a better shed to protect and in turn improve her cow's health. 

In future, she hopes to build a better home and to educate her children to higher levels.

loans.use: to buy livestock feed and clothes for her children.

loans.name: Delfina

texts.en:
Delfina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell in her fish-vending business.

Delfina has been in this business for 12 years. She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requested an additional loan to further build her business.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To buy additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Janette

texts.en:
Janette works hard to support her family. Janette is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 11,500 loan through NWTF to purchase a fishing net.

Janette has been in this business for 5 years now.

In the future, Janette would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase a fishing net.

loans.name: Nueva Visión Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “NUEVA VISIÓN” iniciará el cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santago II, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Rossemery es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de ropa de bebe, taller de costura, taller de confección, venta de lácteos, venta de queso, venta de mantas, costura de chamarras.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Rossemery es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una compañera de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de  venta de tucumanas (empanadas tradicionales bolivianas); da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió hace dos años, ya que anteriormente sabía elaborarlas, decide emprender un negocio independiente.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de harina por mayor) que adquirirá de las ferias de la cuidad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es viuda  y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la atención que le ofrece el personal de la institución.
texts.en:
The loan group New Vision will start its fourth loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Centro Focal de Santago II. The group is comprised of 8 members and is directed by a board of which Rossemery is the president. The members run a variety of businesses including: selling baby clothes, dressmaking, making ready to wear clothes, selling dairy products, selling cheese, selling shawls, making jackets.
The loan they are requesting will benefit small enterprises such as Rossemery's. She says that this is her first time as a member of Pro Mujer and she joined after being invited by someone from the institution who went to visit her at home. Currently, she has a business selling tucamanas (traditional Bolivian empanadas). She tells us that she started her business 2 years ago - as she already knew how to make tucamanas she decided to start her own business. 
The loan that she is requesting will be used to increase her capital to buy flour in bulk, and she will buy it from the markets in the city of El Alto and later make and sell her products in the markets. This form of work enables her to generate resources to support her family as she is a widow and has 4 children. 
When we asked her what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responded that she likes the attention that she gets from the institution staff.

loans.use: to buy flour in bulk.

loans.name: Primero De Mayo Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “PRIMERO DE MAYO” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Nadir es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: confección de mantas, venta de chompas, artesano, servicio de transporte, tienda de barrio, venta de ropa.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Nadir es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de carne; nos cuenta que este negocio lo inicio hace varios años, ya que el mismo fue un negocio familiar, posterior a su matrimonio de cide contar con un negocio independiente.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de carne por mayor) que adquirirá en las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia ya que ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el servicio de salud que le ofrecen en la institución.
texts.en:
The loan group First of May will start its second loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Centro Focal de Santago II. The group is comprised of 9 members and is directed by a board of which Nadir is the president. The members run a variety of businesses including: making shawls, selling sweaters, crafts, transportation services, a neighborhood grocery store, and selling clothes. 
The loan they are requesting will benefit small enterprises such as Nadir's. She says that she has been member of Pro Mujer for 2 years and she joined after being invited by someone from the institution who went to visit her at home. Currently, she has a business selling meat. She tells us that she started her business some years ago. It was a family business and, after her marriage, she decided to have her own business.
The loan that she is requesting will be used to increase her capital to buy meat wholesale, and she will buy it from the wholesale vendors in the city of El Alto and later sell it from her sales location. This form of work enables her to generate resources to support her family as she is married and has 2 children.
When we asked her what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responded that she likes the health services that she gets from the institution.

loans.use: to buy meat wholesale.

loans.name: Bartolina Sisa Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “BARTOLINA SISA” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Patacamaya, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Flora es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tienda de barrio, venta de ropa, venta de charque, venta de pollo broster.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Flora es integrante, ella indica que es el primer ciclo que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de un promotor de la institución que fue a visitarla a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de ganado; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió hace varios años, al comenzar a convivir con su actual pareja.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de ganado vacuno) que adquirirá en las provincias del departamento de La Paz y posteriormente a la crianza lo comercializara a los compradores que lo requieran. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones que le ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The loan group Bartolina Sisa will start its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Centro Focal de Patacamaya. The group is comprised of 8 members and is directed by a board of which Flora is the president. The members run a variety of businesses including: a neighborhood grocery store, selling clothes, selling jerky, and selling roast chicken.
The loan they are requesting will benefit small enterprises such as Flora's. She says that this is her first loan cycle with Pro Mujer and she joined after being invited by someone from the institution who went to visit her at home. Currently, she has a business selling livestock. She tells us that she started her business some years ago when she started living with her current partner. 
The loan that she is requesting will be used to increase her capital to buy beef cattle, and she will buy them from the provinces in the department of La Paz and later, after raising them, she will sell them to buyers who need them. This form of work enables her to generate resources to support her family as she has a common-law marriage and 3 children. 
When we asked her what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responded that she likes the training that she gets from the institution.

loans.use: to buy beef cattle.

loans.name: Maritza Del Socorro

texts.es:
Maritza de 49 años de edad, madres solteras con un hijo menor de edad, es originaria de Leon, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente de la región. Se caracteriza por ser trabajadora, responsable con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudieron estudiar sus estudios. Y se vio obligada a trabajar desde temprana edad, para ayudar con los gastos del  hogar. En la actualidad luchan día a día para brindar un futuro mejor a sus hijos.

Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica la mercadería en general. Actividad que la desempeña en su casa de habitación y de forma ambulante. Ella dedica a su negocio unas diez horas diarias ofreciendo su producto como:perfumes, rubor, delineadores, pantalones, camisas, vestidos, faldas, ropa de cama, ropa interior, piyamas, bodys, cremas, labiales. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la co mpra y venta de productos, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos.  Maritza agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Maritza is 49 years old, a single mother with a young child and is originally from Leon, a place that is located in the western region. She is characterized as hardworking, responsible, and wanting self improvement. Unfortunately due to lack of economic resources, she could not complete her studies and was forced to work from an early age to help with household expenses. Today she struggles every day to provide a better future for her children.

Thanks to her efforts and desire to succeed, she has an economic activity of general merchandise. She does this activity from her home and on rounds. She devotes  about ten hours a day to her business offering product such as: perfumes, blush, eyeliner, pants, shirts, dresses, skirts, bedding, underwear, pajamas, bodysuits, creams, lipsticks. The purpose of the credit is to gain working capital to invest in her business and in buying and selling products, so that in the near future she will get better income. Maritza is thankful for the assistance that Kiva investors provide poor people and poor countries like Nicaragua so that they may have a means of decent work.

loans.use: to buy products for resale: perfumes, blush, eyeliner, pants, shirts, dresses, skirts, bedding, underwear, pajamas, bodysuits, creams, lipsticks

loans.name: Ra

texts.en:
Ra is 34 years old. She is a married woman who has three children in Oudong, Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. 

She is a factory laborer and her husband is a construction worker. Both of them can earn approximately $10 per day. 

Now, she would like to apply for loan of $1,000 to buy timber to build a house. This loan helps her improve her family's living condition. In the future, she hopes that her children can get high school diplomas.

loans.use: To buy timber to build a house.

loans.name: Loch

texts.en:
Loch is 22 years old. He lives in Oudong, Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. 

He is a construction worker and earns around $5 per day. 

Now, he would like to apply for loan of $1,000 for digging a well and repairing his house so he can take the water from the well to water vegetables. This loan helps him grow vegetables.

loans.use: To dig a  well and to repair his house.

loans.name: Sotheary

texts.en:
Sotheary is 48 years old. She is a married woman who has three children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. 

She is a grocery retailer and her husband is a teacher. Both of them can earn approximately $10 per day. 

Now, she would like to apply for loan of $1,000 to purchase more goods for her grocery retail shop. This loan helps her make more income for her family. In the future, she hopes that she can expand her grocery retail shop and build a new house.

loans.use: To purchase more goods for her grocery retail shop.

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en:
Sokha is 47 years old. She is a married woman who has two children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. 

She is a farmer and her husband is a fisherman and a motor-taxi driver. Both of them can earn approximately $15 per day. 

Now, she would like to apply for loan of $1,000 to buy fertilizer and petroleum for farming in dry season. This loan helps her get more harvest. In the future, she hopes that she can expand her farming and build a new house.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and petroleum for farming in dry season.

loans.name: Cristo Nos Ama Group

texts.es:
La asociación comunal Cristo nos Ama, está conformado por doce  integrantes once mujeres  y un hombre, madres y padres responsables de quince hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Son originarios de Malpaisillo, lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte de la región. Se caracteriza por ser trabajadores, responsables, con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablente por falta de recursos económicos no pudieron cursar una carrera y se vieron obligadas a trabajar desde temprana edad. Para ayudar con los gastos del hogar. 
Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante,  la coordinadora es Dominga y tiene por actividad económica una pulpería es una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestibles en cantidades pequeñas como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leche, pan, huevos, detergente, jugos, gaseosas. Ella dedica a su negocio unas doce horas diarias ofreciendo su producto. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de productos comestibles, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. La asociación comunal Cristo nos Ama agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan  a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The communal bank Cristo nos ama (Christ Loves Us) is made up of 12 members, 11 women and 1 man.  They are responsible mothers and fathers with 15 children under their care.  They are originally from Malpaisillo, a town located in the northern zone of the region.  They are hard-workers, responsible, and with a great desire for personal success.  Sadly due to a lack of economic means they were not able to pursue higher education and were obligated to work from a young age in order to help with household expenses.  

Thanks to her efforts and her desire to get ahead, Domingo is the coordinator of this communal banking group.  She has as her economic activity running a small grocery store. She sells food products in small quantities like rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, detergent, juices and sodas.  She works in her store 12 hours each day offering her products.  The objective for her loan is to invest in capital and supply her business for buying and selling food products so that in the not so distant future she will be able to obtain better income.  The communal banking group Christ Loves Us thanks the Kiva lenders for the assistance they offer to people with limited resources and to poor countries like Nicaragua so that people can have a path towards dignified labor.

loans.use: To supply her grocery store with food items such as rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, detergent, juices and sodas.

loans.name: Sorn

texts.en:
Sorn is 51 years old. She is a married woman who has three children in Oudong, Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. 

She and her husband are farmers and all her children are employed. All of them can earn $22 per day. Now, she would like to apply for loan of $800 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This loan helps her reduce her family’s transportation expense. 

In the future, she hopes that she can buy more farmland and build a bathroom.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Khloeng

texts.en:
Khloeng is 28 years old. She is a married woman who has two children in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. 

She is a factory laborer and her husband is a construction worker. Both of them can earn approximately $16 per day. 

Now, she would like to apply for loan of $1,500 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This loan helps her reduce her family’s transportation expense. In the future, she hopes that she can build a bathroom and her children can get high school diplomas.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Khom

texts.en:
Khom is 37 years old. She is a married woman who has three children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. 

She is a factory laborer and her husband is a construction worker. Both of them can earn approximately $12 per day. 

Now, she would like to apply for loan of $1,200 to purchase a rice-grinding machine to husk rice and to get rice chaff for pigs. 

In the future, she hopes she can buy more pigs to breed.

loans.use: To purchase a rice-grinding machine to husk rice.

loans.name: Pao

texts.en:
Pao is a married woman who has three children in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. 

To earn a living, she sells tamarind and earns approximately $6.66 per day. Her husband is a driver who earns around $3.33 and her two children are employed as factory labors who earns around $9.32 per day. 

Now, she would like to apply for loan of $1,000 to buy construction materials to renovate her house. This loan helps her family live in good conditions. 

In the future, she hopes that she can expand her business and her last child can get a high school diploma.

loans.use: To buy construction materials to renovate her house.

loans.name: Sopha

texts.en:
Sopha is 31 years old. She is a married woman who has one child in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. 

She has been a grocery retailer since 2005 and earns approximately $10 per day. Her husband is a government officer who earns $6 per day. 

Now, she would like to apply for a loan of $1,000 to purchase goods to sell at her retail shop. This loan helps her make more income so she can start saving money to build a new house.

loans.use: To purchase goods to sell at her grocery shop.

loans.name: Jilma Del Socorro

texts.es:
Jilma de 32 años de edad, casada con dos hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Es originario de  Achuapa, lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte de la región. Se  caracteriza por ser  trabajador, responsable, con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudo cursar una carrera y se vio obligado a trabajar desde temprana edad, para ayudar con los gastos del hogar.
Gracias a su esfuerzo  y sus ganas de salir adelante la  tiene por actividad económica  una pulpería, es una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestibles como: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leche, pan, huevos, detergentes, jugos, gaseosas, fósforos. Ella dedica a su negocio unas diez horas diarias ofreciendo su producto. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de productos comestibles para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Jilma agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
32-year old Jilma is married and has two dependent children. She is a native of Achuapa located in the neath of the region. Known for being a hardworking, responsible person with a great desire to get ahead, sadly Jilma was not able to do any job training as she lacked the money. She was obliged to work from a young age to help with household expenses.

Thanks to hard work and a desire to get ahead Jilma owns a small grocery store where she sells products such as rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, detergent, juice, soft drinks, and matches. She works ten hours a day in her store.

The loan money will be used to buy more stock so that in the not too distant future she will earn more money. Jilma is grateful to Kiva lenders for providing the opportunity for better work conditions to poor people and poor countries like Nicaragua.

loans.use: Buy rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, detergent, juice, soft drinks, and matches for her store

loans.name: Iris Aracelly

texts.es:
Iris de 42 años de edad,  madres solteras con un hijo menor de edad, es originaria del Sauce, lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte de la región. Se caracteriza por ser trabajadora, responsable, con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente no por mucho tiempo no consiguió un trabajo estable, y se vio en la necesidad de emprender su negocio, el cual hasta el día de hoy le ha sido muy rentable. Y lucha día a día para brindarle un futuro mejor a su hijo.
Gracias  a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante, tiene por actividad económica la venta de arboles forestales, actividad que la desempeña den su casa de habitación. Ella dedica a su negocio unas  ocho horas diarias ofreciendo su producto. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en nuevos  arboles forestales, para ofrecer variedad y calidad  a sus clientes. Iris agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva  le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Iris, age 42, is the single mother of a minor child.  She is from Sauce, a place that is located in the northern part of the region.  She is known for being hard-working and responsible with the desire for personal improvement.  

Sadly, she could not get stable work for a long time.  She saw the need to undertake her business, which has been very profitable so far.  She struggles day to day in order to provide her son with a better future.

Thanks to her effort and her desire to get ahead, her business activity is selling trees.  She does this at her house.  She spends eight hours a day selling her product.

The objective of the loan is to invest in new trees in order to offer variety and quality to her customers.  Iris is grateful for the help that the Kiva lenders provide to people with scarce resources in poor countries like Nicaragua so that people can have decent work.

loans.use: to buy stock for her tree selling business.

loans.name: Thouk

texts.en:
Thouk is 54 years old. She is a widow who has four children in Oudong, Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She is a retailer at home and three of her children are employed. All of them earn approximately $17 per day. 

Now, Thouk would like to apply for loan of $1,500 (USD) to purchase goods to sell for profit and to purchase copper to make copper products to sell. This loan helps her to make more income as well as get a better living.

loans.use: To purchase goods to sell for profit and to purchase copper to make copper products to sell

loans.name: Rosas De Cala Cala Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ROSAS DE CALA CALA” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Patacamaya, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Valeria es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: compra de ganado ovino, producción de chuño, venta de queso, venta de ganado vacuno.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Valeria es integrante, ella indica que es el primer ciclo que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de un promotor de la institución que fue a visitarla a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de ganado; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió hace varios años, ya que el mismo fue un negocio familiar, posterior a su matrimonio decide independizar su negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de ganado vacuno) que adquirirá en las provincias del departamento de La Paz y posteriormente a la crianza lo comercializara a los compradores que lo requieran. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia ya que ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones que le ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The Rosas de Cala Cala Community Bank is beginning its first cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Patacamaya Group. There are eight members led by a board of directors with Sra. Valeria as President. The members have a variety of businesses such as buying sheep, making chuño (freeze-dried potatoes, a traditional dish), making cheese, and selling cattle.

The loan the group is seeking will benefit small businesswomen such as Sra. Valeria. She is part of this first cycle with Pro Mujer and joined at the invitation of an advisor from the institution who visited her at her house. Currently Valeria has a business selling cattle, a job she has had for several years as it was a family business. After her marriage she decided to run the business independently.

The money she is seeking will be used to buy more cattle from the provinces in the department of La Paz and sell them after raising them. This will enable Valeria to earn money to support her family--she is married and has three children.

When asked what she most likes about Pro Mujer, she replies that she enjoys the training courses that the institution puts on.

loans.use: Buy cattle

loans.name: Pheap

texts.en:
Pheap is 33 years old. She is a married woman who has two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She is a factory laborer and her husband, who is with her in the photo, is a construction worker. Both of them can earn approximately $12 per day. 

Now, Pheap would like to apply for loan of $1,500 (USD) to buy farmland for growing rice crops. This loan helps her to make more income. Pheap hopes that she can build a new house next year.

loans.use: To buy farmland for growing rice crops

loans.name: Cholponai

texts.ru: Чолпонай, 23 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают дочь. Образование-среднее. Уже 4 года занимается полеводством и животноводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы 15,000 сом (KGS).  Упорство и трудолюбие позволили Чолпонай развить животноводческую деятельность до: 1 дойная корова, 4 бычка и 15 овец. Вместе с супругом занимаются разведением племенных лошадей, на сегодняшний день в хозяйстве есть 7 лошадей. А также имеется земельный надел мерою 2,40 ГА на котором ежегодно выращивает картофель, зерновые культуры и эспарцет для внутрихозяйственного потребления и реализации. Ежемесячная прибыль составляет в среднем 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства и полеводства Чолпонай обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров, часть средств будет потрачена на покупку семян. Доходы от кредита Чолпонай планирует направить на увеличение поголовья скота, и в будущем она хочет улучшить жилищные условия.
texts.en: Cholponai is 23 years old, married and, together with her husband, is raising a daughter. She has a secondary education. For four years already, she has been practicing crop farming and livestock breeding. Her persistence and hard work have allowed Cholponai to develop her animal breeding business to include: 1 milk cow, 4 bull calves and 15 sheep. She and her husband also breed pedigree horses. They currently have 7 horses on their farm.  She also has a 2.40 hectare plot of land on which she annually grows potatoes, grains and sainfoin for personal consumption and sale. Their average monthly income is about 15,000 som (KGS). For the purpose of further developing her farm and crop farming, Cholponai turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan in the amount of 70,000 som (KGS) to buy cows. A portion of the lent amount will be also be spent on the purchase of seeds. Cholponai plans to invest the earnings from the loan to increase the size of her herd. She also wants to improve her living conditions in the future.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Phally

texts.en:
Phally is 55 years old. He is a married man who has five children at Odong, Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. He is a construction worker. His four children are factory labourers and earn approximately $15 per day. 

Now, Phally would like to apply for loan of $500 (USD) to purchase materials for his child’s wedding party. He hopes that his last child can get a high school diploma.

loans.use: to purchase meterials for his child's wedding party

loans.name: Rim

texts.en:
Rim is 40 years old. She is a married woman who has three children at Odong, Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She is a factory labourer and her husband is a soldier. Both of them can earn approximately $9 per day. 

Now, Rim would like to apply for loan of $1,500 (USD) to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This loan will help her to reduce her family’s transportation expenses. In the future, she hopes that she can build a new house and her children can get high school diplomas.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Sokunthos

texts.en:
Sokunthos is 41 years old. She is a married woman who has three children at Odong, Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She is a factory labourer, her husband is a farmer, and her three children are employed. All of them can earn approximately $20 per day. 

Now, Sokunthos would like to apply for loan of $1,500 (USD) to pay for her child‘s wedding party. She hopes that she can build a gate as soon as possible.

loans.use: To pay for her child's wedding party

loans.name: Kimly

texts.en:
Kimly is 48 years old. She is a married woman who has one child at Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She is a vegetable vendor and her husband is a solider. Both of them can earn approximately $7.50 per day. 

Now, Kimly would like to apply for loan of $1,500 (USD) to purchase cement, convex tiles and the ground parts of a latrine to build a bathroom. This loan will help her family live in better conditions.

loans.use: To purchase cement, convex tiles and the ground parts of a latrine to build a bathroom

loans.name: Savin

texts.en:
Savin is 56 years old. She is married woman who has five children at Odong, Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. Her husband is a motor-taxi driver and her two children are labourers. All of them can earn approximately $14.32 per day. 

Now, Savin would like to apply for loan of $800 (USD) to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This loan will help her family to reduce their transportation expenses.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Libertad Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LIBERTAD” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Patacamaya, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Raymunda es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de verduras,  venta de polleras, artesanía en mantas, librería, tienda de barrio, servicio de transporte, venta de comida.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Raymunda es integrante, ella indica que iniciará el segundo  ciclo en Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de un promotor de la institución que fue a visitarla a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de polleras (faldas tradicionales boliviano); da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió hace varios años, independientemente, al observar el buen comercio de este producto.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de tela por mayor) que adquirirá en ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializara a los compradores que lo requieran. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia ya que ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones que le ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The “LIBERTAD” communal association will start its second cycle in Pro Mujer as a part of the Patacamaya center. It is made up of eight members and led by a board of directors of which Raymunda is the president. The businesses that the members of the communal association have a re varied. Among them are: selling vegetables, selling skirts, hand made blankets, book selling, a transportation service, and selling food.  

The loan they will take out will benefit the small businesswomen, including Raymunda. She says that she will start her second cycle in Pro Mujer. She entered at the invitation of a counselor from the institution who went to visit her at her house. Right now, she has a business selling polleras (traditional Bolivian skirts). She says that she started the business several years ago on her own, when she observed the selling of this product. 
 
The loan she will take out now is to increase capital by buying fabric wholesale that she will acquire in the markets of the city of El Alto. After production, she will sell to buyers who need them. This type of work allows her to generate income to support her family, as she is married and has three children.  

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the trainings that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy fabric wholesale.

loans.name: El Esfuerzo Group

texts.es:
La asociación comunal El esfuerzo está conformado por nueve integrantes, ocho mujeres y un hombre, padres y madres responsables con diez hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Son originarios de Malpaisillo lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte de la región. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudieron estudiar, se vieron en la necesidad  de trabajar para ayudar con los gastos del hogar.
Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante la coordinadora es Cipriana y tiene por actividad económica una pulpería es una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestibles en cantidades pequeñas como: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leche, pan, huevos, detergentes, jugos, gaseosas. Ella dedica a su negocio unas doce horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabaja y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de productos comestibles, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. El esfuerzo agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The communal association "El esfuerzo" is composed of nine members: eight women and one man. They are responsible mothers and fathers with ten children under their responsibility. All of the members are from Malpaisillo, located in the northern zone of the region. Unfortunately, due to scarce financial resources, they were not able to finish school. Instead, out of necessity, they had to work in order to help their families. 

Thanks to much hard work and the desire to get ahead, the group coordinator, Ciprana, owns a small grocery store that has items such as rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, detergents, juices, and sodas. She makes a living working in her store 12 hours a day. The objective of this loan is to invest in working capital and to stock her business so that, in the near future, she may obtain better earnings. 

The El esfuerzo group is grateful for the help that Kiva lenders offer to people who have little resources and to poor countries such as Nicaragua so that the people there may find dignified work.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and to stock her business of buying and selling groceries such as rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, detergents, juices, and sodas.

loans.name: Ninet Marisol

texts.es:
Ninet de 31 años de edad, casada con dos hijos menores de edad. Es originaria de  Leon, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país, se caracteriza por ser trabajador, responsable con ganas de superación personal.  Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económico no pudo cursar una carrera y se vio obligada a trabajar desde temprana edad, para ayudar con los gastos de hogar. En la actualidad lucha día a día para brindarles un futuro mejor a sus hijos.
Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica la venta de pan, y reposteria como cachos, picos, semitas, pasteles, rosquillas, donas. ella dedica a su negocio unas dies horas diarias ofreciendo su producto. El objetivo del credito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra de pan para la venta. Ninet agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y paises pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Ninet is 31 years old. She is married and has two minor children. She is from Leon, located in the western part of the country. She is described as hardworking, responsible and eager to get ahead. Unfortunately, due to a lack of resources, she wasn't able to go to college and she had to start working at a very young age to help with the household expenses. Today she fights day to day to offer her children a better future.  

Thanks to her hard work her economic activity is selling bread and pastries such croissants, picos, semitas, cakes, rosquillas, and doughnuts. She works at her business ten hours a day, offering her products. The purpose of the loan is to invest in working capital and stock her business by buying bread to sell. Ninet is grateful for the help that the Kiva investors offer people of low income and poor countries, such as Nicaragua, so that they can have a dignified life.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and stock her business selling bread, such as croissants,  picos, semitas, cakes, rosquillas, doughnuts.

loans.name: Gulanda

texts.ru: Гуланда, 33 года, замужем, 4 детей школьного и дошкольного возраста. У Гуланды среднее образование. Гуланда спокойная, уравновешенная и трудолюбивая. Супруг помогает по бизнесу. В качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи, Гуланда уже много лет занимается животноводством и полеводством. Начав этот бизнес почти с нуля, благодаря упорному труду, в хозяйстве Гуланды имеется: 4 дойные коровы и 1 лошадь, а также есть земельный надел 1,50 ГА, на котором выращивает арбузы. Ее деятельность приносит около 15,000 сом (KGS) в месяц, от продажи молока, молочной продукции, а также в летний сезон арбузов, что служит основой для покрытия расходов на питание и бытовые нужды семьи. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Гуланда обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 130,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего хозяйства, а также, в будущем хочет накопить средства на строительство жилого дома для своей семьи.
texts.en: Gulanda is 33 years old, married and has four children who are toddlers or in elementary school. Gulanda has a secondary education. Gulanda is calm, level-headed and hardworking. Her husband helps her with her business. As an additional source of income for her family, Gulanda has been practicing livestock breeding and  crop farming for many years.  Starting this business basically from nothing, thanks to Gulanda's hard work, she currently has 4 milk cows and 1 horse on her farm. She also has a 1.50 hectare plot of land on which she grows watermelon. This business brings in about 15,000 som (KGS) per month from the sale of milk and dairy products, as well as the summer watermelon season, which primarily serves to cover the food expenses and daily living needs of the family. For the purpose of further developing her business, Gulanda turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan in the amount of 130,000 som (KGS) to buy cows. Gulanda plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further expansion of her farm. She also wants to save money to build a house for her family in the future.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Yan

texts.en: Yan is 63 years old. She is a widow who has one child in Odong, Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She is a farmer and her child is a factory laborer. Both of them can earn approximately $6 per day. Now, she would like to apply for loan of $1,000 to purchase convex tiles and cement to renovate her house. This loan helps her family live in better conditions.

loans.use: To purchase convex tiles and cement to renovate her house

loans.name: Sreynet

texts.en:
Sreynet, 24, is married with one child. She lives in Odong, Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. 

She is a factory labourer, and her husband is a construction worker. Both of them can earn approximately $10 per day. 

Sreynet would like to apply for loan of $1,200 to buy a motorbike for commuting. This loan will help her family reduce their transportation expenses. 

In the future, she hopes that she can build a house and give her child a high school diploma.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Narin

texts.en:
Narin is 42 years old. She is a married woman who has three children at Takeo Province, Cambodia. She is a garment factory labourer and her husband, who is with her in the photo, is a motor-taxi driver. Both of them can earn approximately $12 per day. 

Now, Narin would like to apply for a loan of $1,000 (USD) to buy cows to breed and resell. In the future, she hopes that her children can earn high school diplomas.

loans.use: To buy cows to breed and to resell for profit

loans.name: Sokny

texts.en: Sokny is 30 years old. She is a married woman who has two children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She is a shoe repairer and her husband is a key maker. Both of them can earn approximately $10 per day. Now, she would like to apply for loan of $1,400 to purchase a key making machine and materials for repairing shoes for providing services to their clients. This loan helps her make more income for their family as well as get a better life. She hopes that she can expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase a key making machine and materials for repairing shoes

loans.name: Serey

texts.en: Serey is 47 years old. He is a married man who has four children in Odong, Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. He and his wife are farmers and his three children are employed. All of them can earn approximately $16 per day. Now, he would like to apply for loan of $1,200 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This loan helps his family reduce their transportation expenses. In the future, he hopes that he can build a gate.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Thea

texts.en: Thea is 42 years old. She is a married woman who has six children in Odong, Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She and her husband are palm fruit vendors. Both of them can earn approximately $6 per day. Two of her children are employed and earn approximately $10 per day. Now, she would like to apply for loan of $1,300 to purchase cows for plowing. In the future, she hopes that she can rebuild her house.

loans.use: To purchase cows for plowing

loans.name: Chinda

texts.en:
Chinda is 37 years old. She is a married woman who has two children at Takeo Province, Cambodia. She is a karaoke worker and her husband is a solider. Both of them can earn approximately $14 per day. 

Now, Chinda would like to apply for loan of $1,500 (USD) to buy roofing tiles and cement to build her house. In the future, she hopes she can build a gate as soon as possible.

loans.use: To buy roofing tiles and cement to build her house

loans.name: G.s Genesis Group

texts.es:
El g.s. Génesis está conformado por tres integrantes, madres solteras con ocho hijos bajo su responsabilidad, son originarias de Nagarote lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente de Leon. Se caracterizan por ser trabajadoras, responsables, con ganas de superación personal. En sus ratos libre le gusta disfrutar de la compañía de sus hijos, lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudieron  cursar una carrera y se vieron  obligadas a trabajar desde temprana edad para ayudar con los gastos del  hogar. 
Gracias a su esfuerzo  y sus ganas de salir adelante la coordinadora es Damiana y tiene por actividad económica la venta de tiste y pozo, productos comestibles elaborados con maíz. Ella dedica a su negocio unas  diez horas diarias ofreciendo su producto. El objetivo del crédito es compra materia prima para la elaboración  de tiste y pozol como maíz, canela, cacao, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos.  Damiana agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
G.S. Génesis consists of three members, single mothers with eight children in their care. They are from Nagarote, a place in an area west of Leon. They are hard workers, responsible, and have the desire to improve themselves. In their free time, they enjoy the company of their children. Unfortunately, due to the lack of resources, they couldn't get degrees and they had to work from a young age to help with household expenses. 
 
Because of her efforts and her desire to get ahead, the coordinator is Damiana and she works selling tiste (a chocolate drink) and pozol (a drink made from chocolate and corn), foods made from corn.  She works in her business about ten hours every day, selling her products. The purpose of this loan is to buy raw materials to make tiste and pozol such as corn, cinnamon, and cocoa, so that in the near future she can earn a better income. Damiana is thankful for the help that the Kiva investors offer to people with limited resources, and poor countries such as Nicaragua, so they can have a means of dignified work.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and stock her business with the purchase of raw materials such as: corn, cinnamon, and cocoa to make tiste (a chocolate drink) and pozol (a drink made from chocolate and corn).

loans.name: Karellia Del Socorro

texts.es: Karellia del Socorro 24 años de edad madre soltera de un pequeño bebe, originaria de uno de los municipios de Chinandega ubicado en el occidente del país, zona que se caracteriza por ser productivamente comercial, y donde existe uno de los ingenios mas grande del país, donde también se elabora la azúcar y el ron, Karellia es una microempresaria quien es propietaria y administradora de una pequeña tienda de mercadería en general como: productos de cosméticos, pantalones, chores, blusas de vestir, camisetas, vestidos, trajes de niños y niñas, productos de plata, acero, oro laminado entre otro mas, ubicado en su casa de habitación y de forma ambulante, sus compras las realiza al contado en otro departamento del país y en mercados de mayoreos, sus ventas son al contado y al crédito a clientes fijos y eventuales por encargos, inicia su negocio con fondos propios desde muy joven aprende el oficio gracias a su mama quien tambien se dedica a este tipo de negocio, uno de sus sueños es poder incrementar su capital de trabajo, tener su propia vivienda y darle un mejor futuro a su hijo, el objetivo de este financiamiento es para capital de trabajo y surtir su tienda en la compra de mercadería en general y lograr cubrir varios pedidos que tiene.
texts.en: Karellia del Socorro, 24 years old, is a single mother of a young baby. She is from one of the municipalities of Chinandega located in the western part of the country, an area characterized by being productive commercially, and where there is the most inventiveness in the country, and where they also produce sugar and rum. Karellia is a small businesswoman who is the owner and operator of a small store that sells general merchandise such as: cosmetic products, pants, shorts, blouses, shirts, dresses, children's outfits, and products made from silver, steel, and gold laminate, among other things. It is located in her home and also in a mobile format. She makes her purchases with cash in another department of the country and in wholesale markets. She sells her products for cash or on credit with certain customers and occasionally takes orders. She began her business with her own funds.  She learned the job since she was very young, thanks to her mother who also has this kind of business. One of her dreams is to be able to increase her working capital, have her own home, and provide for a better future for her child. The purpose of this loan is for working capital and to stock her store by purchasing general merchandise and to be able to meet the requests she has.

loans.use: invest in working capital and stock her store with general merchandise such as: a variety of clothing styles, footwear, cosmetics, silver and gold jewelry among other things

loans.name: Edelmira De Los Angeles
