texts.es: Edelmira de los Angeles mayor de edad madre soltera de tres hijos menores de edad bajo su responsabilidad, originaria del municipio de Chinandega ubicado en el occidente del país, se caracteriza por ser una mujer trabajadora, responsable, con muchos deseos de superación personal, en sus ratos libre le gustar pasar tiempo de calidad con su familia y les prepara un plato típico de la región como es indio viejo por falta de recursos económico no pudo cursar una carrera, y se vio obligada a trabajar desde temprana edad para ayudar con los gastos del hogar. Gracias a su espíritu y sus ganas de salir adelante se dedica a la comercialización de mercadería en general como pantalones, camisas, faldas, ropa cosméticos, zapatos, prendas. adicional a esta actividad comercializa con granos básicos y productos de consumo diario en un tramo de los mercados de esta localidad. sus compras las realiza en mercados y distribuidoras de otro departamento sus ventas son al contado y al crédito el cual recupera semanal. El objetivo de este nuevo financiamiento es para invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de mercadería y venta de granos básicos, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Edelmira de los Angeles agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en: Edelmira de los Angeles is a single mother with three young children in her care.  She is originally from Chinandega, which is located in the west of the country.  She is known for being hard-working, responsible, and with a great desire for personal success.  In her free time she likes to spend quality time with her family and make them a typical dish from the region such as "Indio viejo," a stew.  Due to a lack of financial resources she was not able to pursue a career and was obligated to work from a young age in order to help with household expenses.  Thanks to her spirit and her desire to get ahead she works selling general merchandise like pants, shirts, skirts, makeup, shoes, and other items.  In addition she also sells basic grains and food products in one of the markets in her town.  She makes her purchases in the markets and distributes products in another region.  Her sales are in cash and on credit, which she collects weekly.  The aim of this new loan is to invest in capital and supply the business in order to purchase merchandise and basic grains for sale so that in the future she will have better income.  Edelmira de los Angeles thanks the Kiva lenders for the assistance that they offer to people with limited income and to poor countries like Nicaragua so that people can find dignified work.

loans.use: to invest in general merchandise such as the purchase of various styles of clothing, shoes, and basic grains.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es: Maria del Carmen mayor de edad soltera, originaria de uno de los municipios de Chinandega ubicado en el occidente del país, zona que se caracteriza por ser costera y donde existe uno de los puertos del país, Maria es una microempresaria que se dedica a la comercialización de mercadería en general como: Variedades estilos de ropa, zapatos, cosméticos, entre otros, sus compras las realiza al contado en distribuidoras de otro municipio, sus compras las realiza al contado cuenta con clientes fijos y eventuales los cuales les ofrece al crédito recuperando semanal lo invertido, uno de sus sueños es poder incrementar mas su negocio, Maria del Carmen ha demostrado ser responsable buena paga en tiempo y forma, trabajadora, y con muchos deseos de superación personal, el objetivo de este nuevo financiamiento es para invertir en sus negocios y aprovechar las ventas y encargos que tiene y de esa manera brindarle un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Maria del carmen agradece la ayuda que le brindan los inversionistas kiva a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de vida digno.
texts.en: Maria del Carmen is a single adult. She is from one of the towns of Chinandega, located in the western part of the country. It is a coastal area with one of the country's ports. Maria is a micro-business woman who sells general merchandise, such as clothing, shoes, cosmetics, and more. She makes her purchases at distributors in other cities. She pays for them up front and sells to regular and new customers, selling to them on credit and collecting weekly. One of her dreams is to be able to expand her business more. Maria del Carmen has shown herself to be responsible and timely with her payments, as well as hardworking and very eager to get ahead. The purpose of this new loan is to invest in her business and take advantage of the sales and orders she has, thus offering a better service to her customers. Maria del Carmen is thankful for the help from the Kiva investors for people of low income and poor countries like Nicaragua so that they can have a more dignified life.

loans.use: to invest in working capital by buying merchandise such as a variety of clothing styles, shoes, cosmetics and more.

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta is 47 years old and married with three children who are in school. Loreta works very hard to provide for them.

Loreta runs a business buying and selling gasoline in the Philippines and requested a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more gallons of gasoline to sell. Loreta has been in this business for 8 years and sells a variety of items such as retail. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more gallons of gasoline to sell

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina works hard to support her family. Lina is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 4 years now. Lina requested an 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase fishing materials like net, gasoline, wood, etc.

In the future, Lina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase fishing materials like net, gasoline, wood, etc

loans.name: Zhanyl

texts.ru: Жаныл 51 год, замужем, 2 детей. Супруг и дети помогают по хозяйству. Семья очень дружная, отношения в семье очень хорошие. Жаныл имеет среднее образование, у нее большой опыт в сфере сельскохозяйственной деятельности и торговли. Жаныл в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи, с 1996 года занимается животноводством и полеводством, начав этот бизнес с 15,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду в хозяйстве имеется: 2 дойные коровы и 6 коз, а также есть земельный надел размером 2,44 ГА, на котором она выращивает картофель, зерновые и эспарцет для собственного потребления и реализации постоянным оптовым покупателям. Дополнительно Жаныл занимается реализацией скота. Ее сельскохозяйственная деятельность приносит свыше 10,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Жаныл обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров, часть средст будет потрачена на полеводство. Доходы от кредита она хочет вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего хозяйства, а также в будущем накопить средства на завершение строительства жилого дома.
texts.en: Zhanyl is 51 years old, married and has two children. Her husband and her children help her with her farm. Their family is very close-knit and they have good relationships with one another. Zhanyl has a secondary education. She has a lot of experience in the field of agricultural businesses and sales. As an additional source of income for her family, Zhanyl practices crop farming and livestock breeding. She started this business in 1996 with 15,000 som (KGS). Thanks to her hard work, she currently has 2 milk cows and 6 goats on her farm. She also has a 2.44 hectare plot of land on which she grows potatoes, grains and sainfoin for personal consumption and sales to regular wholesale buyers. Additionally, Zhanyl sells cattle.This agricultural business brings in more than 10,000 som (KGS) per month. For the purpose of further developing her business, Zhanyl turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) to buy cows. A portion of the loan will be spent on crop farming. She plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further expansion of her farm. She also wants to save money to finish the construction of her house in the future.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Fulwati

texts.en:
Dairy cows are valuable assets, supporting the rural poor to earn a decent living. Fulwati and her family have been running a small dairy farm for the last 15 years in Chittoldiya, a rural village in Jharkhand. They started the farm with one cow and now the dairy farm consists of five buffaloes and three cows which produce about 40-50 liters of milk per day. They sell it to the neighboring households and to different tea vendors.

Fulwati (38) is very enterprising woman; she always looks for opportunities. She joined a local NGO called “MESP”, which helps villagers based in deep-rural areas who cannot access finances through banks. Fulwati attended various agri-business training sessions to be eligible for a dairy loan. The NGO also taught her about dairy cows, feed supplements, sources and contact persons for good quality semen, animal first-aid and preventive health care. 

Fulwati is fully equipped to be a successful farmer and she is taking a further step of seeking a loan to purchase another dairy cow. Her major challenge is raising funds. Most of her income is spent paying for expensive farm inputs and her two children's school fees.

The additional income will go into converting the temporary shed to a permanent tiled-roof with enough space for each animal. Her dream will be achieved the day her husband and children get to enjoy a comfortable life.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Keo

texts.en:
Keo, 51, is married with two children. She lives in Odong, Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She and her husband are farmers, her two children construction workers. All of them can earn approximately $18 per day. 

Keo would like to apply for a loan of $1,000 to build a house. This loan would help her family live in better conditions. 

In the future, she hopes that she can build a bathroom and buy more farmland to grow rice.

loans.use: To build a house

loans.name: Srey

texts.en:
Srey, 47, is married with two children. She lives in Odong, Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. 

She and her husband are farmers, and one of her children is a construction worker. All of them can earn approximately $9 per day. 

Srey would like to apply for a loan of $1,300 to buy farmland to grow rice. This loan will help her increase her harvest and earn more income. 

In the future, she hopes that she can build a gate and renovate her house.

loans.use: To buy a farmland to grow rice

loans.name: Sokhan

texts.en:
Sokhan, 52, is married with six children. She lives in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. 

She is a clay potter, her husband a soldier, and one of her children is employed. All of them can earn approximately $14 per day. 

Sokhan would like to apply for a loan of $1,500 to buy cement and floor tiles to renovate her house. In the future, she hopes that she can expand her business of making and selling clay products.

loans.use: To buy cement and floor tiles to renovate her house

loans.name: Sagrado Corazon De Jesus Group

texts.es:
La asociación comunal Sagrado Corazón de Jesús  está conformada por once integrantes, madres responsables con quince  hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Son originarios de Telica,  lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente  de la región. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudieron estudiar, se vieron en la necesidad  de trabajar para ayudar con los gastos del hogar.
Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de Salir adelante la coordinadora es  Ogracia y tiene por actividad económica  la una pulpería, es una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestibles como: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leche, pan, huevos, detergentes, jugos, gaseosas. Ella dedica a su negocio unas doce horas diarias ofreciendo su producto. El objetivo  del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de productos comestibles, para que en  un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos.  Sagrado Corazón de Jesús agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The communal association "Sagrado Corazón de Jesús" is composed of 11 group members. They are all responsible mothers with 15 children under their responsibility. Each group member is from Telica, located in the western part of the country. Unfortunately, due to scarce financial resources, they were not able to finish school. Instead they had to work to help their families pay the household expenses.

Thanks to much hard work and the desire to get ahead, the group coordinator, Ogracia, owns a small grocery store. There she sells items such as rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, detergent, juices, and sodas. Ogracia works 12 hours each day in her store. The objective of this loan is to invest in working capital and stock her grocery store so that, in the near future, she may obtain better earnings. 

The Sagrado Corazón de Jesús group is grateful for the help Kiva lenders offer to people with little resources and from poor countries such as Nicaragua so that they may find dignified work.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and stock her grocery store with rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, detergent, juices, and sodas.

loans.name: Jamileth Del Carmen

texts.es: Jamileth del Carmen, mayor de edad madre soltera de un pequeño bebe, originaria del municipio de Chinandega ubicado en el occidente del país, se caracteriza por ser una mujer trabajadora, responsable y con muchos deseos de superación personal para sacar a delante a su hijo, es una microempresaria la cual se dedica a la compra venta de mercadería en general como: ropa nueva, ropa usada fina, ropa interior fina, cosméticos, venta de hielo, refrescos naturales entre otros, sus compras las realiza al contado en mercados de esta localidad, sus ventas son al contado y al crédito a clientes fijos y eventuales todos por encargo y de forma ambulante, los cuales recupera cada quince y treinta de cada mes, inicia su negocio desde muy joven el cual lo aprende gracias a su mama el cual le quedo de herencia junto con sus clientes que ha ido incrementando y fue como un medio de hacerle frente a la vida negocio el cual tiene ya cinco años de dedicarse a este tipo de comercio, uno de sus sueños es poder terminar de construir un cuarto. el objetivo de este financiamiento es para invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir con mercadería en general para lograr cubrir con varios pedidos que tiene.
texts.en:
Jamileth del Carmen is a single mother with a young baby. She is from the Chinandega municipality located in the east of the country. She is a hard-working, responsible woman with a great desire to succeed personally in order to get her child ahead.
She has a small business, selling general merchandise such as new clothing, nice used clothing, nice underwear, cosmetics, ice cream, and natural drinks. 
She makes her purchases in cash in the local markets, and her sales are in cash and credit to fixed clients as well as occasional buyers. She sells on order and door-to-door. She charges on the 15th and 30th of every month. 
She started her business at a young age, learning it from her mother, who gave it to her as an inheritance. Jamileth also inherited her mother's clients. She has been increasing her clientele. She has had this business for five years already. One of her dreams is to be able to finish building a room. Her goal with this loan is to invest in working capital to stock more general merchandise in order to cover various outstanding orders.

loans.use: to purchase general merchandise such as new and used clothing and shoes.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a 48-year-old woman from Kakamega County which is located in the western part of Kenya. She is married and supports 9 people in her family. She is blessed with two children who are 18 and 15 years old, respectively.

Sarah sells new clothes, a business she has been doing for the last 6 years making a monthly income of 10,000 KES. She is taking her 5th loan with VISIONFUND KENYA, which she will use to purchase more clothes for resale and use the anticipated profits to grow her business.

Sarah has a dream of becoming a successful businesswoman and supports her family.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for sale

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn is 46 years old and married with eight  children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

Jenelyn has borrowed and repaid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from fishing and raising pigs.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Hey KIVA!!!! Meet Simon, a very happy farmer living in the Kitale area of North Rift Kenya with his wife and three children, of whom two are of school going age. He grows maize, beans and vegetables, which he sells at the local market. He enjoys the harvesting season the most because he gets to eat his labour and this brings in more profits. His biggest challenges are crop pests and diseases, and drought seasons, which lowers food production.

Simon chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because they help change the lives of farmers. During the training, he learnt that he can borrow money and invest in projects like poultry, dairy and horticultural farming.

Simon will use your loan to purchase poultry which will help in boosting up his income. This income will provide shelter for his family and also be able to afford the basic necessities.

loans.use: to purchase poultry

loans.name: Viviane

texts.en:
Viviane is 49 years old and married with one child. She sells foodstuff and has been in the business for the past five years. 

With this loan, she would like to buy more bananas and beans to sell. The profits from her business will be used to buy a car to help in transporting her foodstuff to the market.

loans.use: To buy more bananas and beans to sell.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is 36 years old. She is married with three children. She sells vegetables and has spent almost ten years in the business. With the loan she would like to buy more tomatoes, carrots and eggplants for sale. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the same business.

loans.use: to buy more tomatoes, carrots and eggplants for sale.

loans.name: Sunita

texts.en:
Sunita (31) is married and has two sons, living in Chittoldiya, Deoghar. Her husband works as a mason. He also does marble flooring for which he uses a rented marble-cutting machine. He earns around INR 300 per day. Her elder son is six years old and has started going to school while the younger one is just three years old and stays at home.
 
Most of the earnings are used to pay the rent of the machine, and so Sunita's husband is struggling to maintain the daily expenses of his family. Sunita wants to help her husband in his business so she is requesting a loan from the local NGO “MESP” of INR 10,000 to buy a marble-cutting machine. The couple hopes to save enough for their children’s education and their bright future. They hope to earn more to improve their standard of living.

This is Sunita’s first loan from Kiva. Both husband and wife are thankful to the lenders.

loans.use: to buy a marble-cutting machine.

loans.name: Samol

texts.en: Samol is 35 years old, married and the mother of one child who lives in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She works in a garment factory and her husband is a farmer. Both of them earn approximately $8 per day. Now, she would like to apply for loan of $1,500 to buy soil for her farmland. In the future, her goal is to build a house on this land.

loans.use: to purchase soil for her farmland.

loans.name: Suzan

texts.en:
Suzan is a 30-year-old married mother of two children who has worked with her husband in running their convenience store for 16 years. Suzan is a Palestinian refugee; she lives and runs her family business inside a Palestinian camp.

Suzan’s children are enrolled in a public school because her income isn’t enough to afford private schools' expenses, but she is proud that she is capable of educating them, and hopes that in the future they will manage a successful career.

Today, Suzan is working as usual on developing her business to keep it a good source of income. Thus, for this reason, she is acquiring a youth loan from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with special summer beverages and refreshments, in addition to special offer products that will attract customers’ attention and increase her income.

Although Suzan’s business is based in a camp, her foodstuffs are highly requested, and she must develop her business continuously to stay capable of replying to customers’ needs.

loans.use: To increase her business merchandise with special summer beverages and refreshments

loans.name: Cristobal

texts.es: Cristobal tiene 67 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su hija y tres nietos. Él es un hombre muy trabajador quien se gana la vida por medio de la venta de granos básicos como: maíz, frijoles, arroz y maicillo. De esta forma se gana la vida y lleva el sustento a su hogar. Cristobal y su familia habitan en condiciones  muy humildes y desea mejorar el techo de un cuarto dado que se encuentra en mal estado. Cristobal ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos dado que no puede hacerlo por sus propios medios pero expresa tener la capacidad de pago mensual que el crédito implica.
texts.en:
Cristobal is 67 years old and lives in his own house with his daughter and three grandchildren. He is a very hard-working man who sells basic grains such as corn, beans, rice, and sorghum. This is how he earns his living and supports his family.

Cristobal and his family live under very humble conditions.  He wants to repair the roof of a room because it is in very bad shape.  He has decided to ask for this loan from FUSAI so that he can buy sheet metal, wood, and nails because he doesn't have the means to buy them himself.  However, he states that he does have the ability to make the required monthly payments.

loans.use: to buy sheet metal, wood, and nails to fix the roof of a room.

loans.name: Dios Proveera Group

texts.es:
La asociación comunal Dios proveerá está conformada por doce integrantes, madres responsables con veinte hijos bajo su responsabilidad, son originarios de Mal paisillo, lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte de la región. Se caracterizan por ser trabajadores, responsables, con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudieron cursar una carrera y se vieron obligadas a trabajar desde temprana edad, para ayudar con los gastos de hogar. En la actualidad lucha día a día para brindarles un futuro mejor a sus hijos.       
Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante la coordinadora es  Mayarí y  tienen por actividad económica una pulpería es una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestibles en cantidades pequeñas como: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leche, pan, huevos, gaseosas, tiste, pan. Ella dedica a su negocio unas doce horas diarias ofreciendo su producto. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y compra productos comestibles, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Dios proveerá agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas  de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The communal association "Dios proveerá" is composed of 12 group members who are all responsible mothers with 20 children under their responsibility. All are from Malpaisillo, located in the northern zone of the region. The group members are hardworking, responsible, and aspire to personal excellence. Unfortunately, due to scarce financial resources, they were not able to go to college because they needed to begin working at an early age to help with their families' household expenses. Currently, they fight each day to provide their children with better futures. 
   
Thanks to her hard work and desire to get ahead, the group coordinator, Mayarí runs her own store selling items such as rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, sodas, and tiste (a Nicaraguan drink). She makes a living working 12 hours a day in her business. The objective of this loan is to invest in working capital and to buy groceries so that in the near future she may obtain better income. 

The group Dios proveerá is grateful for the help Kiva lenders offer to people with little resources and from poor countries like Nicaragua so that they may find dignified work.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and stock her store with items such as rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, sodas, tiste (a regional drink), and bread.

loans.name: Joaquin Alberto

texts.es: Joaquin ALberto mayor de edad casado y dos hijos independientes, originario de uno de los municipios de Chinandega ubicado en el occidente del país, se caracteriza por ser un hombre trabajador, responsable, con muchos deseos de superación personal, es un microempresario propietario y administrador de un pequeño taller de joyería ubicado en su casa de habitación donde ofrece prendas de oro, plata y acero, al igual que realiza reparaciones sus compras las realiza al contado a intermediarios y sus ventas son al contado y al crédito a clientes fijos y eventuales los cuales recupera quincenal lo invertido, uno de sus sueños es poder ampliar su negocio, el objetivo de este nuevo financiamiento es para invertir en materia prima así como tambien la compra de un activo fijo (Pantografo) el cual sirve para marcar o gravar las prendas de oro y/o plata, Joaquin Alberto agradece mucho el apoyo que los inversionistas kivas les ofrece a personas de bajos recursos económicos
texts.en: Joaquin Alberto, a mature adult, is married with two independent children. He is from one of the municipalities of Chinandega located in the west of the country. He is a hard-working man, responsible, and has a great desire to improve himself. He is a small-business owner and operates a small jewelry shop located in his home where he sells gold, silver and steel jewelry, and also makes repairs. He makes his purchases with cash through intermediaries and he makes his sales for cash or on credit with his regular and occasional customers, which he collects every two weeks. One of his dreams is to be able to expand his business. The purpose of this new loan is to invest in raw material and also to purchase tangible assets (a Pantograph), which is used to engrave the gold and/or silver jewelry. Joaquin Alberto is very thankful for the help that the Kiva investors offer to people of limited resources.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to make jewelry such as: chains, earrings, cords, pendants, and bracelets, among other things, and to buy tangible assets

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.es: Rosalina mayor de edad madre soltera con tres hijos independientes, originaria del municipio de Chinandega ubicado en el occidente del país, zona que se caracteriza por ser productivamente comercial, turística, Rosalina es una microempresaria propietaria y administradora de un cafetin donde ofrece: desayunos, almuerzos, café, reposterías, sándwich, tacos, enchiladas, chilaquiles, refrescos naturales, gaseosas, golosinas, pan, golosinas, entre otros sus compras las realiza al contado en distribuidoras y camiones distribuidores tiene clientes fijos y eventuales sus ventas son al contado, ubicado en uno de los colegios de este municipio, uno de sus sueños es poder crecer mas en su negocio y expandir su cafetin ya que tiene mayor demanda de sus clientes, el objetivo de este financiamiento es para invertir en capital de trabajo en la compra de productos de consumo como: juegos, gaseosas, leña, reposterías, golosinas, entre otros mas. Rosalina agradece mucho el apoyo que los inversionistas kivas les ofrece a personas de bajos recursos económicos.
texts.en:
Rosalina is a single mother of three independent children. She is from the Chinandega municipality, located in the east of the country, an area known to be commercial and touristy. Rosalina owns and runs a small business: a small cafe where she offers breakfasts, lunch, coffee, desserts, sandwiches, tacos, enchiladas, chilaquiles, natural drinks, pop, candy, bread, and other items. She makes her purchases in cash from distributors and their trucks. She has a fixed clientele, as well as occasional customers. She makes her sales in cash. Her business is located in one of the local schools. 
One of her dreams is to be able to expand her business and her cafe; she has high demand. The goal of this loan is to invest in the purchase of edible products such as: juice, pop, firewood, pastries, and candy. Rosalina is very grateful for the support Kiva lenders provide to people with low economic resources.

loans.use: to buy more edible products such as bread, rice, oil, candy, firewood, and pop.

loans.name: Amalia Esther

texts.es: Amalia Esther 32 años de edad casada con dos hijos menores de edad, originaria de uno de los municipios de Chinandega ubicado en el occidente del país, zona que se caracteriza sus playas, comercialización de mariscos, Amalia es una microempresaria propietaria y administradora de un molino, pulperia y acopio de maní, el cual lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación, donde ofrece este tipo de servicio a la población del municipio, tiene clientes fijos y eventuales, sus ventas son al contado inicia sus negocios con fondos propios uno producto del otro, Amalia desde muy temprano abre su negocio de molino para brindarles un buen servicio a sus clientes luego el de la pulperia, gracias al buen servicio que ella les brinda es que su clientela ha incrementando teniendo mayor demanda en molino y pulperia, uno de sus sueños es poder realizar ciertas mejoras a su vivienda para agrandar su pulperia y quedando mas espacio para su molino, el objetivo de este financiamiento es para invertir en la compra de abarroteria para surtir su pulperia y darle mantenimiento a su molino.
texts.en:
Amalia Esther, age 32, is married with young children. She is from one of the municipalities of Chinandega, in the east of the country. The area is characterized by its beaches and seafood sales.
Amalia owns and runs a small business: a mill, grocery store, and peanut warehouse. This is located in her home. She offers this service to the residents of the municipality. She has fixed and occasional clients. She buys in cash.
Amalia started her business with her own funds. Amalia opens her mill very early in the mornings to offer good customer service. She later opens the grocery store. Thanks to her good service, her clientele has increased as well as her demand.
One of her dreams is to be able to make some improvements to her home in order to expand her grocery store and have more space for her mill. Her goal with this loan is to invest in the purchase of groceries and to maintain her mill.

loans.use: to buy grocery items such as rice, sugar, beans, and oil, and to provide maintenance for her mill.

loans.name: Sergio Danilo

texts.es: Sergio Danilo mayor de edad acompañado con tres hijos menores de edad, originario del municipio de Chinandega ubicado en el occidente del país, Sergio se caracteriza por ser un hombre trabajador, responsable, y con muchos deseos de superación personal, es propietario y administrador de un triciclo con su respectivo permiso de operación y matricula en regla, con el que ofrece servicios de transporte de carga y personas en este municipio, inicia su negocio con fondos propios como una alternativa de trabajo y de sufragar gastos en el hogar, uno de sus sueños es poder construir su vivienda de concreto y ver a sus hijos formados en unos profesionales ya que el no logro terminar sus estudios, el objetivo de este financiamiento es para la compra de un activo fijo(triciclo) para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Sergio Danilo is in a relationship and has three young children. He is from the Chinandega municipality, located in the east of the country. Sergio is a hard-working, responsible man with a great desire to succeed personally. He owns and runs a tricycle business. Each has its respective operating permissions and payments in order. He offers a transportation service for cargo and people in the municipality.
He started his business with his own money as a work alternative, and to cover his household costs. One of his dreams is to be able to build his home out of concrete and to see his children become professionals; he was unable to complete his studies. The goal of this loan is to purchase a tricycle so that in the near future he can obtain a greater income.

loans.use: to buy a special tricycle with all the documents in order.

loans.name: Blanca Melissa

texts.es:
Blanca de 21 años de edad, casada con un hijo menor de edad, es originaria de Leon, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Se caracteriza por ser trabajador, responsable, con ganas de superación personal.  En sus ratos libre le gusta disfrutar de la compañía de su familia, le gusta preparar platos típicos como “yuca con chingaste” lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudieron estudiar y se vieron en la necesidad de trabajar desde temprana edad para ayudar con los gastos del hogar.
Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica una pulpería es una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestibles en cantidades pequeñas como: arroz, leche, pan, huevos, tiste, fósforos, jugos, gaseosas, galletas, meneítos, frutas. Ella dedica a su negocio unas doce horas diarias ofreciendo su producto. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio con la compra de productos comestibles, para que un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Blanca agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Blanca, age 21, is married with a young child. She is from Leon, an area in the east of the country. She is hard-working, responsible, and has a desire for personal success. In her free time she enjoys spending time with her family. She enjoys cooking traditional dishes such as "yuca con chingaste" [yucca with fried pork]. Unfortunately, because of a lack of economic recourses, she was unable to study and needed to start working at a young age in order to help with the household costs.
Thanks to her hard work and desire to get ahead, she has a small grocery store where she sells food products in small quantities: rice, milk, bread, eggs, tiste drinks, matches, juice, pop, candy, shakes, fruit, and more. She works 12 hours per day. 
The goal of this loan is to invest in stocking her business with the purchase of food products so that in the near future she will be able to make a better income. Blanca is grateful for the help that the Kiva lenders offer to those with low economic resources and in poor countries such as Nicaragua so that they can have dignified jobs.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of edible products such as rice, milk, bread, eggs, "tiste" drinks, matches, juice, pop, candy, shakes, and fruit.

loans.name: Reyna Del Carmen

texts.es:
Reyna de 55 años de edad, casada con dos hijos menores de edad, estudian en secundaria y la universidad. Es originaria de Leon, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Se caracteriza por ser trabajadora, responsable, con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económico no pudo cursar una carrera y se vio obligada a trabajar desde temprana edad, para ayudar con los gastos del hogar. 
Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad la venta de licor sellado en su casa de habitación. Ella dedica a su negocio unas diez horas diarias ofreciendo su producto. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Reyna agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Reyna is a 55-year-old native of the city of Leon, in western Nicaragua. She is married and the mother of two children, who are students in a high school and a university. Reyna is hardworking, trustworthy, and eager to improve her situation. Her parents, unfortunately, lacked the means to pay for an education, so Reyna never went to college. She instead went to work at a young age in order to could contribute to the household expenses of her family. 

Reyna's efforts and ambition have allowed her to operate a liquor store in her home, where she works ten hours a day. Reyna is applying for a loan in order to invest in working capital and increase inventory for her store. These steps will allow her to earn a higher income in the near future. Reyna is grateful to Kiva lenders, whose support of people with few resources in poor countries such as Nicaragua allows borrowers to earn an honest living.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and purchase inventory for her liquor store.

loans.name: Anonymous Group

texts.es:
El G.S lazo de Amistad, está conformado por tres integrantes, madres solteras con ocho hijos bajos su responsabilidad. Son originarias de la paz centro lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Se caracterizan por ser trabajadores, responsables, con ganas de superación personal. En sus ratos libre le gusta disfrutar de la compañía de sus hijos, lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudieron estudiar y se vieron en la necesidad de trabajar desde temprana edad, para ayudar con los gastos del hogar. En la actualidad luchan día a día para brindarles un futuro mejor a sus hijos.
Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante la coordinadora es Karolina y tiene por actividad económica  una pulpería, es una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestibles en cantidades pequeñas como: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leche, pan, huevos, detergente, jabón, jugos, gaseosas.  Ella dedica a su negocio unas doce horas diarias ofreciendo su producto. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de productos comestibles, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. G.S. Lazo de Amistad agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The Lazo de Amistad Community Bank has three members, all single mothers with eight dependent children between them. They are from La Paz which is located in the western part of the country. The women are known for being hardworking and responsible and having a strong desire to get ahead. They enjoy spending time with their children in their free time. Sadly, because of lack of money, they couldn't attend school and had to work from a young age to help with household expenses. Now they work hard every day to provide a better future for their children.

The coordinator of the group is Karolina who, through hard work and a desire to succeed, has a grocery store where she sells items such as rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, detergent, soap, juice and soft drinks in small quantities. She spends some twelve hours a day serving in the store.

Karolina is seeking a loan to buy more stock for her store so that in the not too distant future she can improve her income. The Lazo de Amistad group is grateful for the help provided by Kiva lenders to poor people and poor countries like Nicaragua.

loans.use: Buy rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, detergent, soap, juice and soft drinks for her store

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary, a 28-year-old woman blessed with one child, has been running an agrovet for the past three years. Monthly, she makes an estimated income of KES.153,000.

Having repaid all of her previous loans, Mary is requesting a new one for KES.100,000. She would like to boost her business by adding stock such as vaccines and fungicides. She will use her anticipated profits to buy a fridge to stock vaccines. 

Mary hopes that in future, she will have more branches to create job opportunities for members of her community.

loans.use: to buy stocks such as vaccines, fungicides and pesticides

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 50 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Lolita has borrowed and paid 5 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Lovella

texts.en:
Lovella works hard to support her family. Lovella is married and has a business selling curtains in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fabric and an additional sewing machine.

Lovella has been in this business for 5 years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fabric and an additional sewing machine

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Luzviminda works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending. Luzviminda is borrowing 11,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy additional fishing net and repair her fishing boat for her fishing business.

Luzviminda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing net and repair her fishing boat

loans.name: Marry Lou

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Marry Lou works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling dried coconut meat. Marry Lou is borrowing 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy spare parts, tire, paints and a plane sheet for the repair of her motorcycle.

Marry Lou has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts, tire, paints and a plane sheet for the repair of her motorcycle

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann works hard to support her family. Mary Ann is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a 11,500 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy additional fishing net.

Mary Ann has been in this business for four years now.

In the future, Mary Ann would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing net

loans.name: Vitya

texts.en:
Vitya is 62 years old, and he lives in Vanadzor city in Lori region. Vitya works as a driver. He is a father of two clever and laborious children. Both his children are students. His son studies at the paid division of Yerevan State Institute of Theater Culture with the specialty of Theater Arts. His daughter studies at the Yerevan State Pedagogical University also at the paid division of Psychology and Sociology, with the specialty of Social Work. Vitya always says to his children that knowledge is the only wealth that can never be lost and nobody can steal it from you. He worked very hard to give them the chance for higher education and he really hopes that his children will justify his expectations and become good specialists of their professions. 
He asks for this loan in order to pay for both of his children's tuition fees for second semester.

loans.use: to pay for both of his children's tuition fees for second semester

loans.name: Aneta

texts.en:
Aneta lives in Vanadzor city in Lori region. She is 31 years old. Aneta graduated from Vanadzor State Pedagogical Institute in the faculty of Russian Language and Literature. 

For three years she worked at the local school as a teacher, but now she is engaged in a very different occupation; at her house, she takes orders for making cakes and various cookies. She changed the profile of her work since with her small salary and with her husband’s not constant income, it was impossible to take care of their two school-aged children. Aneta’s husband is a truck driver, and he makes cargo transfers by order. 

Aneta does her best to develop her business and to take more orders. She bakes very tasty items, the small room where she works is always clean, and everything here is cutely sorted. She takes orders from nearly 20 food shops and markets of her city, and people like her cookies very much.

Now she needs this loan in order to buy an oven of good quality for baking, as well as sugar, butter and flour that she can use for a long time.

loans.use: to buy an oven of good quality for baking, as well as sugar, butter and flour that she can use for a long time

loans.name: Amka Group

texts.fr: La Cliente Maria est une brave commerçante depuis 25 ans, âgée de 61 ans, mariée  et mère de 7 enfants, qui tous étudient. La cliente est membre d’une Association d’Affaires «Amka». Elle est vendeuse des  denrées alimentaires. Elle installe ses marchandises dans un petit marché dans les périphéries de la ville. Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre son activité. Elle va acheter 2 sacs de farine de manioc, 2 de mais, etc. Elle démarra ses affaires avec le fonds reçu de ses familiers. Son conjoint est sans emploi. Dans l’avenir, elle souhaite achever sa maison, scolariser, nourrir ses enfants. Elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien aux femmes entrepreneurs non bancables en leur accordant de crédit pendant, ce moment de pénurie post conflits dans la région de l’Est du pays.
texts.en:
Hekima's client, Maria, aged 61, married and a mother of seven children, all enrolled in school, has been a hardworking businesswoman for 25 years. This client is a member of a businesswomen's group called Amka. She sells foodstuffs, displaying her merchandise in a small market on the outskirts of the city.  

She is asking Hekima for a loan to grow her business. She wants to buy two sacks of manioc flour, two of maize, etc. She started up her business with funds she got from her friends. Her husband is jobless. 

In the future, she hopes to finish her house and keep her children in school and feed them. She thanks Hekima for its support given to women entrepreneurs who do not have access to banking services, by making loans to them during this post-conflict period of shortage in the eastern region of the country.

loans.use: to buy two sacks of manioc flour, two of maize, etc.

loans.name: Didiane

texts.en: Didiane is 19 years old. She owns a boutique and has been running the business for one year. With the loan, she would like to buy more sugar, rice, and lotions for resale. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the business.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, rice and lotions for resale

loans.name: Amina

texts.en: Amina is 37 years old. She is married with four children.She owns a butcher shop, where she sells meat from both cows and goats. She has requested a loan to buy more cows for slaughtering in order to sell their meat. She expects to save the profits until she gets enough money to buy her own truck for transporting cows from upcountry.

loans.use: To buy more cows for slaughtering in order to get meat for resale.

loans.name: Em's Group

texts.en: Em is 55 years old and lives with her children and her husband. She and her husband support their family by running a business of selling and delivering purified water. Em also works for a local school as a janitor to earn additional income to support her family. She is the Group Leader of a 6-member loan group that live in Ho Chi Minh City. In the picture she is wearing a violet blouse. Each of the other group members are requesting loans to fund income-generating activities. Em is requesting a loan to purchase a scooter for her work transportation to deliver water products and to travel more quickly to and from her school.  She hopes this will enable her business to expand and that she will be able to better manage her working arrangements.

loans.use: To buy a scooter for work transportation

loans.name: Le's Group

texts.en:
Le is 63 years old and lives with her daughters and her husband. Her husband works as a security guard in a local factory. Le has worked as a manual worker in a factory for eight years. 

She is the group leader of a seven-member loan group that lives in Ho Chi Minh City. In the picture, she is wearing an orange blouse. Each of the other group members are requesting loans to fund income-generating activities. Le is requesting a loan to pay her daughters' school fees. The school fees are a large expenditure item, and a loan will make it easier for Le to afford to send her daughters to school. She hopes her daughters will be able to complete their schooling and will be able to find good jobs in the future.

loans.use: To pay school fees for her daughters.

loans.name: Chi

texts.en: Chi is requesting a new loan to buy hair care equipment and products to sell at her salon. Chi's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers and increase her sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy hair care equipment and products to sell.

loans.name: Khoe

texts.en:
Khoe, 44 years old, is married and has two children. Her husband supports the family through the income he earns from interior decoration work. Khoe runs a food stall to sell beverages and foods. She started this business 10 years ago. They live in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Khoe intends to take a loan to increase her working capital and buy a larger quantity of different soft drinks to meet her customers' demands. The additional capital will enable her to increase her income from this business. She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy and sell beverages.

loans.name: Marisela

texts.es:
Marisela es una mujer con visión y mente emprendedora pues desde el 2004 decidió capacitarse en Interactuar haciendo un curso de belleza.
En el momento en que se graduó comenzó a trabajar en diferentes salones de belleza, pero ahora ha decidido montar su propio negocio de peluquería, barbería y spa de uñas.
Ella posee las sillas y repisas pero el problema es el local, ya que requiere de algunas mejoras locativas y no tiene el dinero para realizarlas, adicional a esto desea hacer la compra de insumos como enjuagues y tratamientos para el cabello para ofrecer un trabajo de calidad.
Al obtener estos elementos podrá iniciar con pie derecho con su proyecto y podrá generar ingresos para su familia, además ofrecerá dos empleos y esto le permitirá tener algunas ganancias extra.
Por otro lado, venderá productos para el cuidado del cabello en su salón de belleza.
En un futuro planea montar un spa de relajación y tener a su cargo a varias personas.
texts.en:
Marisela is a woman with vision and entrepreneurial mind.  In 2004, she decided to train at INTERACTUAR,  taking a beauty course.  By the time she graduated, she was working in various salons.  Now she has decided to start her own hair salon, barber shop and nail spa business.

She has chairs and shelves but the problem is the salon, since it requires some improvements and she does not have the money to do them.  In addition to this, she wishes to purchase supplies such as rinses and hair treatments to offer quality work.

By obtaining these elements, she can start on the right foot with her project and can generate income for her family.  She can also offer two jobs and this will allow her to have some extra earnings.

In addition, she sells products for hair care in the salon. In the future, she plans to establish a relaxation spa and employ several people.

loans.use: to renovate her salon and buy supplies like hair treatments and rinses.

loans.name: Fredy Leonardo

texts.es:
Fredy, es un hombre de 24 años, y desde que salió del colegio inicio con un curso de electricidad en el SENA (Servicio Nacional De Aprendizaje), desde el momento en que se graduó viene desempeñándose como electricista realizando contratos en diferentes partes de la ciudad de Medellín.
Es un hombre con vasto conocimiento en el tema ya que no ha dejado de capacitarse y realizar cursos, por esta razón es muy buscado para realizar trabajos.
En estos momentos se encuentra estancado pues considera que la herramienta que tiene no le permite realizar algunos trabajos.
El pide un apoyo económico para comprar algunas herramientas y de este modo realizar su trabajo de una manera más rápida y de mejor calidad.
Su mayor sueño es poder generar empleo en su sector y capacitar a los jóvenes compartiéndoles su conocimiento
texts.en:
Fredy is 24 years old.  Once he left high school, he began an electrician course at the National Learning Service (SENA) center.  Ever since he graduated from this course, he has been growing in his profession as an electrician through projects in different areas of Medellín. 

He is a man with a vast knowledge of his trade since he is continuously training and taking new courses.  For this reason, clients seek him out for projects.  However, he is currently stuck because the tools that he owns do not allow him to perform certain types of jobs.  Therefore, he is requesting a loan to buy more tools so that he may work in an improved and more efficient manner.

His greatest dream is to be able to create jobs in his field and to train young people to carry out this type of work by sharing his knowledge with them.

loans.use: to buy measurement and repair tools.

loans.name: Rosa Angelica

texts.es: Rosa, tiene 39 años de edad, esta casada y tiene dos hijos, ella vive con su familia en el municipio de Macuelizo, Santa Bárbara. En busca de obtener ingresos hace dos años decidió vender ropa como blusas, faldas, camisas, short, jeans etc. Solicita el tercer ciclo de préstamo que es por 21,000 lempiras con el cual va comprar camisas, blusas, faldas, etc. para tener mayor inventario y poder incrementar las ventas, este negocio lo realiza de manera ambulante y por pedidos. Su meta es crecer como comerciante, ayudar a su hogar y lograr tener un local propio para su negocio.
texts.en:
Rosa is thirty-nine years old, is married, and has two children.  She lives together with her family in the town of Macuelizo, Santa Bárbara.  Hoping to earn an income, she decided to start selling clothing (blouses, skirts, shirts, shorts, jeans, etc.) two years ago.  She is currently in her third loan cycle and is requesting 21,000 lempiras to buy more merchandise.  This will allow her to have a greater inventory so that she can increase her sales.  She conducts her business by selling door to door and by filling orders.  

Her goals are to grow as a merchant, help with her home, and to be able to have her own business premises in the future.

loans.use: to buy shirts, blouses, skirts, etc. so that she has a greater inventory and can increase her sales.

loans.name: Cesar Augusto

texts.es:
Cesar tiene 37 años de edad, es soltero y vive con su madre y una hermana en una aldea de Peña Blanca, Cortes.
Cesar desde hace varios años se dedica a la compra y venta de pescado, el hace las ventas de manera ambulante, dice que este negocio es bastante rentable ya que la demanda del pescado es muy buena.  Ha solicitado varios prestamos para invertir en su negocio actualmente ha obtenido otro por 15,000 lempiras y lo necesita para la compra de pescado fresco para la venta, con este crédito aumentaran las ganancias y podrá seguir invirtiendo en el negocio. Tiene como meta poner su negocio en un local fijo y hacer mas clientela.
texts.en:
Cesar is 37 years old and single. He lives with his mother and sister in a village near Peña Blanca, Cortes.

For many years, Cesar has worked buying and selling fish. He works as a street vendor. He says that his business is quite profitable since the demand for fish is very good. He has requested a number of loans to invest in his business and has now obtained another one for 15,000 lempiras. He will use it to purchase fresh fish to sell. With this loan, Cesar will be able to increase his earnings and to continue investing in his business. His goal is to establish his business at a fixed location and build his clientele.

loans.use: to buy fresh fish to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase agricultural supplies to care for her coffee crops.

loans.name: Luis Armelio

texts.es: Luis tiene 31 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos de 10 años y 7 años de edad. Luis se dedica a la compra y venta de granos básicos desde hace mucho tiempo y es así como lleva el sustento a su hogar. Luis desea reparar su humilde vivienda la cual es a base de lámina y con el tiempo se ha deteriorado por lo que ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra madera, lámina galvanizada, cemento y pago de mano de obra para la reparación.
texts.en:
Luis is 31 years old and lives at home with his wife and two children aged 10 and 7 years old.  Luis earns a living by buying and selling staple grains.  He has been doing this for many years and this is how he supports his family.

Luis want to repair his humble dwelling which is built of sheet metal and has deteriorated.

He has decided to apply for this loan from FUSAI to invest in buying wood, galvanized sheet metal, cement and labor payment for repair.

loans.use: to buy wood, galvanized sheet metal, cement and pay for labor to repair his home.

loans.name: Cristo Salvador Group

texts.es: Este es el grupo “Cristo Salvador” conformada por 06 socios emprendedores y solidarios que con el fruto de sus esfuerzos han ido mejorando. Florencia de 57 años es  separada con 03 hijos independientes. Ella  se dedica a la venta de golosinas. Florencia se siente orgullosa por darles educación a sus hijos. El crédito que solicitó lo destinará para la compra de galletas, caramelos y chocolates. El deseo de Florencia es de contar con un puesto de venta ya que lo realiza ambulatoriamente. El grupo “Cristo Salvador” agradece a las personas que hicieron posible este crédito. Florencia es la tercera del lado frontal izquierdo y viste chaleco celeste.
texts.en: The “Cristo Salvador” communal bank is composed of 6 enterprising and united members who with the fruit of their labors have been improving themselves. Florencia is 57 years old, separated and has 3 independent children. She sells candies. She is proud of having provided her children with their education. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy cookies, caramels and chocolate. Florencia's desire is to have her own sales place as she currently sells in the streets. The “Cristo Salvador” group thanks the people who make this loan possible. Florencia is the third from the left in the front row wearing the blue vest.

loans.use: to buy cookies, caramels and chocolates.

loans.name: Maria Eugenia

texts.es: Maria Eugenia, mayor de edad casada con tres hijos aun bajo su responsabilidad originaria del municipio de Chinandega ubicado en el occidente del País, lugar que se caracteriza por ser una zona productiva en el comercio, turismo, es una microempresaria propietaria y administradora de una pulperia ubicada en su casa de habitación donde ofrece productos al por menor como bolsitas de café, caja de fósforo, cigarros menudeados, granos básicos, detergentes, pasta dental, queso, embutidos, golosinas, refresco naturales, plátanos verdes, huevos, tomates, jabón, papel higiénicos, productos congelados entre otros mas, sus compras las realiza al contado a camiones distribuidores y en mercado central y en distribuidoras de esta localidad sus ventas son al contado y al crédito tiene clientes fijos y eventuales, inicia su negocio con fondos propios como un medio digno de vivir el cual ya son siete años de dedicarse a este tipo de negocio hoy en día sus clientes han incrementado mas gracias a la amabilidad y buena atención que les ofrece a sus clientes, abre las puertas de su negocio desde muy temprano cerrando bastante tarde para atender a sus clientes. uno de sus sueños es poder realizar ciertas mejoras a su hogar y el de crecer mas en su negocio. el objetivo de este financiamiento es para invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su pulperia en la compra de productos de consumo del hogar y de esa manera brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes
texts.en:
Maria Eugenia, who is an older woman, married and with child children still in her care, comes from the town of Chinanedga, which is located in the western part of the country and place known for being a productive area for business and tourism.  She owns and operates a micro-business, namely a small grocery store located in her home where she has retail products like packets of coffee, boxes of matches, cigarettes, basic grains, detergent, toothpaste, cheese, lunchmeat, natural soft-drinks, plantains, eggs, tomatoes, ham, toilet paper, and frozen products, among other items.

She makes her purchases in cash from distribution trucks, in the central marketplace, and from in distributors in this town.  Her sales are in cash and credit, and she has both steady and casual clients.

She started her business with her own funds as a dignified way to live, and she has worked at this for seven years.  These days her clients have increased thanks to the friendliness and good attention she gives to them.  She opens her doors very early and and closes them quite late to tend to her customers.  One of her dreams is to be able to make certain improvements to her home and to grow more in her business.

The objective of this loan is to invest in working capital and stock her store with products for households, thus offering a better service to her clients.

loans.use: invest in working capital and stock her convenience store with household products.

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es:
María de los Ángeles de 45 años de edad, madre soltera con un hijo menor de edad, el cual está estudiando en la universidad. Es originaria del Sauce, lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte de la región se caracteriza por ser trabajadora, responsable, con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudo cursar una carrera y se vio en la necesidad de trabajara desde temprana edad. En la actualidad lucha día a día para brindarles un futuro mejor a sus hijos.

Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad economica una pulperia, es una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestibles en cantidades pequeñas como arroz, frijoles, azucar, leche, pan, detergente, jabon, azucar, fosforos, ella dedica a su negocio  unas doce horas diarias ofreciendo su producto. El objetivo del credito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Maria de los Angeles agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y paises pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
María de los Angeles is 45 years old and the single mother of one child who is under the age of majority and currently attending university. She is from Sauce, which is located in the northern part of the region. She is known for being hardworking and responsible, and she has the desire for personal growth. Unfortunately, due to a lack of economic resources, she was not able to study at university and found it necessary to work from an early age. She currently fights daily to offer a better future to her children.

Thanks to her efforts and desire to get ahead, she runs a grocery store to earn an income. It is a small store where she sells consumable products in small quantities, such as rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, detergent, soap, sugar, and matches. She works at her store some 12 hours a day, selling products. With this loan, she will invest in working capital and stock her business, so that in a not-too-distant future she will be able to make a better income. María de los Angeles is thankful for the help that Kiva investors offer to people with scarce resources and to poor countries like Nicaragua so that they can have decent work.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and stock her business with consumable products.

loans.name: Estrella De Belen Group

texts.es:
La asociación comunal Estrella de Belén está conformado por nueve mujeres madres solteras con quince hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Son originarios de  Malpaisillo, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente de la región. se caracteriza por ser trabajadores, responsables, con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudieron estudiar una carrea y se vieron en la necesidad de trabajar a temprana edad, pará ayudar con los gastos del hogar. 
Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante la coordinadora es Francisca y tiene por actividad económica una pulpería es una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestibles en cantidades pequeñas como: arroz, azúcar, leche, huevos, queso, mantequilla, tiste, tomates, fósforos, jabón cloro, detergente. Ella dedica a su negocio unas doce horas diarias ofreciendo su producto, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Estrella de Belén agradece la ayuda que los inversionista kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en: The Bethlehem Star Communal Bank is made up of nine single mothers who have fifteen children in total to take care of. They live in Malpaisillo, a town in the western part of the region. The women are hard-working and passionate about bettering themselves. Unfortunately, due to lack of financial resources, they could not go to college and had to work from a young age to help out with household expenses. Thanks to her hard work and drive to get ahead, Francisca (who is also the coordinator) owns a convenience store which sells groceries such as rice, sugar, milk, eggs, cheese, butter, tiste (Nicaraguan chocolate drink), tomatoes, matches, soap and detergent. She works twelve hours a day in the store and hopes to increase her income in the near future. Bethlehem Star is grateful for the help that Kiva investors give to them and other people on low-incomes in poor countries like Nicaragua, allowing them to make a living in a dignified way.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk, eggs, cheese. butter, tiste (Traditional Nicaraguan beverage). tomatoes, matches, soap and detergent for a grocery store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy new and used furniture.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en: Teresa is a 53-year-old married woman. She has three children with ages ranging from 15 years to 25 years. She describes herself as determined. She operates a farm where she grows potatoes, bananas and also keeps cows which produce milk for sale. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in an area ideal for farming. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate capital to expand the business. She will use the 100,000 KES loan to buy fertilizer and animal feeds. Her business goal is to have a dependable business within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will benefit from the loan. This is her third loan with SMEP DTM. A previous loan of 50,000 KES was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and animal feeds

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be courageous. She operates a beauty salon where she offers hairdressing services. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a competitive place, and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. 

She will use the 20,000 Kenyan shillings loan to buy beauty products for use in the salon. Her business goal is to have a reliable business within five years. She will plough back the anticipated profits into the business.

loans.use: to buy beauty products for use in the salon

loans.name: Monica

texts.en: Monica is a 30-year-old married woman. She has two children. She describes herself as focused. She operates a retail business where she sells poultry. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are the general public. She states her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. She will use the 10,000 KES loan to buy more stock of chicken. Her business goal is to expand within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a good life.

loans.use: to buy more stock of chicken

loans.name: Albino

texts.es:
Albino tiene 48 años de edad, desde muy joven aprendió a ganarse el pan con el sudor de la frente, es por ello que solo pudo estudiar hasta el nivel secundario. Díaa  día trabaja como maestro constructor y albañil, trabaja alrededor de 10 horas al día, de acuerdo al tamaño de la construcción; Albino cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es responsable y sobre todo atiende a sus clientes con amabilidad.

Albino esta agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar una mototaxi y de esta manera tener un vehículo donde transportar sus herramientas, asimismo podrá realizar trabajo de taxi los fines de semana; de esta manera podrá mejorar sus ingresos y podrá trabajar de manera más adecuada y podrá seguir esforzándose para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Terminar de construir su casa y tener una mejor calidad de vida”.
texts.en:
Albino is 48 years old. He learned very young how to make a living with the sweat of his brow. This is the reason he could only study up to Secondary school. He works day to day as a master builder and bricklayer. He works about 10 hours a day depending on the size of the project. Albino feels that things are going well for him as he is responsible and treats his customers in a friendly manner.

Albino is grateful to the lenders at Kiva as thanks to their support he can buy a motorcycle taxi and use it to transport his tools. Also he can work as a taxi on weekends. In this way he can increase his income and work in an efficient way and continue to strive to realize his big dream. Which is to finish building his house and enjoy a higher quality of living.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 54 years old and married with eight children, with one child in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Alma runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Alma has been in this business for thirty years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, canned goods and other groceries.

In the future Alma would like to build and expand her business to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is 49 years old, married with four children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.  

Analyn has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Analyn requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell.

Analyn has been in this business for twenty-two years. In the future, Analyn would like to save enough to buy a delivery truck for her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Charlene

texts.en:
Charlene is 33 years old and married with four children. Three of her children are in school.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Charlene is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF to buy additional pigs, feed and vitamins.

Charlene has been raising pigs for five years and also earns additional income from farming rice and from tricycle transportation.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money so she continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional pigs, feed and vitamins.

loans.name: Partena

texts.en:
Partena lives with her husband in Dilijan city. She graduated from Dilijan Medical College and for many years she worked as a nurse at one of the rest houses in Dilijan. Now she works as a nurse at the school. Her husband repairs cars at his own garage. 

Over many years, this small family managed to save money and little by little they repaired their house. Now they are repairing their bathroom, but as always happen during repairing activities, the money they had saved turns out to be not enough and now they have little money for bathroom repairs. 

Partena and her husband now greatly hope that, thanks to Kiva and Nor Horizon, they will manage finally to finish the repairing of their bathroom. Partena asks for a loan of 500,000 Armenian drams in order to buy pipes, a sink, a shower and accessories for their bathroom.

loans.use: to buy pipes, a sink, a shower and accessories for their bathroom

loans.name: Ruslan

texts.en:
Ruslan is 32 years old and he is single and lives with his father in Dilijan city. He has a vocational education of cook. He worked in different companies as a cook, but now he works at a private company as a baker. He wakes up very early in order to fulfill the plans for baking bread for the whole day. As he says he likes his work very much despite working without holidays and late into the night. 
Ruslan’s father is retired but he has a plot of land on which he cultivates a few vegetables for their family needs. Ruslan has a truck which he uses every day to go to work and now it is out of order.
Ruslan has asked for this loan in order to repair the truck. From his house to his place of work is very far and to come home late at night by taxi, since buses do not work after midnight, is too expensive when compared with his current salary that he receives.

loans.use: to repair his truck so that he can get to and from work

loans.name: Vrezh

texts.en:
Vrezh is 34 years old and lives in the village of Aghavnavank in Tavush region. He has a nice, large family. He is a father of two daughters and two sons. His wife is unemployed since the care of children and their house is her duty, and she manages to help her husband in farming and agriculture, which Vrezh is engaged in. 

In his farm, Vrezh has two cows, three calves, and 10 chickens. On his plot of land, he cultivates tomatoes, cucumbers, greens, and peppers. He also gathers mushrooms and great variety of barriers from the forest. Together with his farm products, he sells all these at the city wholesale market. Vrezh also does constructional works in his village. 

So, as he says, he has one great wish to provide all his children with better living conditions and, which is the most important, with higher education. For this, he plans to develop his farming and enlarge the assortment of sale of his farm products.

Vrezh asks for 100,000 Armenian Drams (AMD) loan, in order to buy fodder for his all farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy fodder for his all farm cattle.

loans.name: Hermine

texts.en:
Hermine and her beloved husband live in the village of Lusadzor in the Tavush region. She is 50 years old and from a very young age until now she has been engaged in farming and agriculture. On her farm she has five cows, five calves and four piglets, so she manages to sell milk and meat from her farm. She also has a plot of land on which she raises potatoes, greens, tomatoes, cucumbers, etc. The vegetables from her land she sells at the city wholesale market. Together with her husband, Hermine does great work about the farm and with the earned money they also manage to help their children’s families who live separately from them.

Hermine plans to make her farm larger and she needs this loan in order to buy several piglets and also a lot of fodder for all her farm cattle. For this she is relying on Kiva lenders’ support and kindness.

loans.use: to buy several piglets and also a lot of fodder for all her farm cattle

loans.name: Bulangalire Group

texts.fr: Madame Gurhinjirage, femme à grande vision est trésoriere du groupe Bulangalire. Agée de 30ans, elle est mère de 5 enfants dont deux n'ont pas l'age d'étudier et mariée à un homme, qui lui aussi est engagé dans le petit commerce. Elle sollicite ce nouveau crédit pour l'achat de 10 bidons d'huile de palme, 200kg de farine de manioc et 4sacs de braise. Elle compte devenir une grande commercante des divers produits; surtout des denrées alimentaires et améliorer son habitat. Sur ceux, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien qu'elle apporte aux femmes pauvres exclues du système classique.
texts.en: Ms. Gurhinjirage, a woman with big vision, is the treasurer of the Bulangalire group. Thirty years old, she is the mother of five children, two of whom are too young to go to school. She is married to a man who is also involved in her small business. She is requesting this new loan for the purchase of ten containers of palm oil, 200 kilograms of manioc flour, and 4 bags of embers. She expects to become a big seller of various products, particularly of food items, and to improve her housing. For these, she wants to thank Hekima for the support they have brought to poor women excluded from the classical banking system.

loans.use: to purchase ten containers of palm oil, 200 kilograms of manioc flour, and 4 bags of embers.

loans.name: Mchingaji Group

texts.fr: Madame Manegabe est  présidente du groupe de credit Muchungaji. Elle est âgée de 33 ans, mariée à un homme d’affaire et  ensemble ils  ont  5 enfants  qui étudient tous.
