Le nouveau prêt sollicité va acheter  10 casiers de boissons sucrées et alcoolisées.  Elle souhaite agrandir son entreprise et construire une maison. Ainsi, elle remercie et encourage Hekima dans son initiative de booster les activités commerciales des femmes à faible revenu.
texts.en: Ms. Manegabe is the president of the Muchungaji loan group. She is 33 years old and married to a businessman, together with whom she has five children, all in school. The new loan she's requesting will go to buy ten cases of sweetened and alcoholic beverages. She wishes to grow her business and build a house. Thus, she would like to thank and encourage Hekima for their initiative of boosting the commercial activities of woman who have weak revenue.

loans.use: to purchase 10 cases of sweetened and alcoholic beverages.

loans.name: Ukweli Group

texts.fr: La cliente Martine est une vaillante commerçante depuis 10 ans, secrétaire et membre d’un groupe d’affaires «Ukweli», entrepreneur dynamique, âgée de 46 ans, femme vivant seule et mère de 5 enfants qui tous étudient.  Elle est vendeuse de divers habillements. Elle installe ses marchandises sur la rue dans un quartier animé de la ville. Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre ses activités. Elle va acheter 10 pièces de pagnes et 10 paires de souliers. Elle débuta avec de fonds reçu de son petit ami. Dans l’avenir, elle souhaite  accroitre son capital, scolariser et nourrir  ses enfants. Elle remercie Hekima pour avoir bien choisi sa cible, en apportant un soutien aux femmes entrepreneurs exclues du système bancaire classique, tout en leur accordant des crédits sans garantie matérielle, surtout, pendant, la période post conflits dans la région de l’Est Pays.
texts.en: The client Martine has been a stout-hearted saleswoman for ten years. She is a secretary and a member of the Ukweli business group, as well as a dynamic entrepreneur, aged 46 years old, a single woman and the mother of 5 children who are all in school. She is a saleswoman of various clothing items. She sets up her merchandise on the road in a lively quarter of the town. She is requesting a loan from Hekima in order to grow her business. She is going to buy 10 pieces of colorful wax cloths (pagnes) and 10 pairs of shoes. She got her start with funds received from her boyfriend. In the future, she would like to increase her capital, as well as educate and feed her children. She would like to thank Hekima for having chosen its target well, by bringing support to women entrepreneurs excluded from the classic banking system, all by giving loans without material guarantees, especially during post-conflict periods in the East Country region.

loans.use: to purchase 10 colorful wax cloths (pagnes) and 10 pairs of shoes.

loans.name: Ukumbusho Group

texts.fr: La cliente Chibalonza est une femme ambitieuse et dirigeante du groupe Ukumbusho. Agée de 54ans, mariée à un homme sans emploie, elle est mère de 8enfants qui étudient tous. Elle débuta ses activités depuis 1990. Le prêt sollicite lui servira d’acheter 5 casiers de boissons sucrées et alcoolisées.  Elle rêve l’expansion  de ses activités, l’amélioration de son habitat et assurer  la scolarité de ses enfants. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima pour la promotion des  femmes à faible revenu.
texts.en:
Cibalonza, an ambitious woman, is the leader of the Ukumbusho group. She is 54 years old, married to a man who is currently unemployed, and a mother to 8 children who all go to school. 

She launched her activity in 1990. The loan she is seeking will help her to buy 5 cases of soft drinks and alcoholic beverages. 

Her goals are to expand her activity, to improve her home, and to support her children’s education.

She wishes to thank the Hekima MFI for supporting low-income women.

loans.use: to buy 5 cases of soft drinks and alcoholic beverages.

loans.name: Josiane

texts.en: Josiane is 27 years old. She is the mother of one child, aged 3. She sells charcoal and has been in the business for eleven years. With this loan, she would like to buy more charcoal to sell. The profits from the business will be used to renovate her house. She is very thankful for her previous loan, which helped her restock her business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Marie Therese

texts.en: Marie Therese is 37 years old. She is married with four children. She runs a boutique and has been in the business for the past seven years. She wants this loan to buy more boutique items such as sugar, utensils and soaps to sell. The profits from the business will be used to build a house in the future.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, utensils and soaps to sell.

loans.name: Donathile

texts.en: Donathile is 43 years old. She is married with two children. She sells different types of merchandise and has been in the business for the past two years. With the loan, she would like to buy more soaps, salts and flour to sell. The profits from the business will be used to renovate her house.

loans.use: To buy more soaps, salts and flour to sell.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is 52 years old. She is married with four children. She sells food stuff and has been in the business for the past three years. With the loan, she would like to buy more bananas and potatoes for sale. The profits from the business will be used in expanding the business.

loans.use: to buy more bananas and potatoes for sale.

loans.name: Leonitha

texts.en: Leonitha sells foodstuffs. She is 34 years old. She has requested a loan to buy more rice, corn flour and carrots for sale. She plans to use the profits to increase her savings. She has big dreams for her future in the business. She would like to see herself in five years as a foodstuff wholesaler.

loans.use: To buy more maize flour, rice and carrots to sell.

loans.name: Alvard

texts.en:
Alvard is a cooker. She has been making different cookies for 15 years already, and is well known among local people as a very talented and professional cooker.
 
Alvard lives together with her husband, parents-in-law, and two children (ages 24 and 21 years old). Besides Alvard, the only worker in the family is her elder son; he is involved in furniture production.
 
Now, the requested loan is very important for Alvard to purchase tools and materials needed for the production of cookies and covering current orders of the customers.

She has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans, with soft conditions, to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for tools and materials for the production of cookies.

loans.name: Ruzanna

texts.en:
Ruzanna is from Azatamut village. She lives with her husband, who is a constructor, and her daughter. Ruzanna's only son is a migrant worker in neighboring country and time by time, supports the family financially.

To tackle financial hardships and help her husband cover family's daily needs, Ruzanna has started her small retail business four years ago. She trades with clothing from her house. The requested loan is highly important for Ruzanna to purchase new clothing supplies for reselling to customers and covering current orders. 

Ruzanna has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans, with soft conditions, to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

Please help this hard working woman to develop her business and meet her customers' demand.

loans.use: to pay for clothing supplies to resell to customers.

loans.name: Mai

texts.en:
Mai is 37 years old and married with two children. She lives with her family in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband works in a dental office. Mai runs a shop of selling rice for earning a living. 

She started her business three years ago. She intends to take a loan to gradually expand her business by buying a larger quantity of rice for selling to her customers. 

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a larger quantity of rice for selling at her store.

loans.name: Mai's Group

texts.en:
Mai is 51 years old and lives with four children. She is divorced. For the past 30 years Mai has been running a business of collecting, buying and selling used materials to earn an income to support her family. 

Mai is the leader of an eight-member loan group whose members live in Ho Chi Minh City. In the picture, she is in the fifth from left, wearing a grey jacket. Each of the other group members is requesting a loan to fund income-generating activities. 

Mai is requesting a loan to purchase a greater quantity of used materials to clean, recycle and sell to large waste-recycling facilities. She hopes that through her loan she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: to buy used materials to recycle and sell.

loans.name: Tot

texts.en: Tot would like to take a further loan to buy a scooter for transportation to work. Her previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her to travel to and from the market and increase the size of her business. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a scooter for transportation to work

loans.name: Hiep

texts.en: Hiep would like to take an additional loan to buy a hair drying machine and repair her beauty salon. Her previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers and increase sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a hair drying machine and repair her beauty salon.

loans.name: Phuoc

texts.en: Phuoc is requesting a new loan to buy motorcycle parts to be able to better repair his customers' motorcycles. Phuoc's previous loan enabled him to expand his business and earn a higher income to support his family. He hopes that another loan will assist him in increasing the size of his business. He also hopes that through the loan, he can increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy motorbike parts to repair his customers' motorbikes.

loans.name: Hien

texts.en:
Hien is 46 years old and lives with her children and husband. Her husband supports the family by working as a brick layer. 

For the past 18 years, Hien has run a shop to sell beverages to earn an income to support her family. She requests a loan to purchase a larger quantity of beverages to increase her inventory. She hopes this will enable her to have better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to buy beverages to sell in her store.

loans.name: Sergio Armando

texts.es: Sergio es un hombre de 44 años que se dedica junto a dos familiares y otra persona más a la fabricación de helados, actividad que aprendió gracias a su último jefe y fue este quien le vendió el establecimiento en el que trabaja normalmente, con esfuerzo, sacrificio y alegría logro posicionar su empresa y poder ganar un buen volumen de clientes ya que vende al por mayor y al detal su principales clientes son heladerías donde distribuyen sus ricos helados artesanales aquellos que uno comparte con alguien especial, con sus años de experiencia y trabajo ha logrado conseguir varios artículos indispensables para hacer crecer su negocio como una cava que en Colombia sería un refrigerador gigante para almacenar estos productos, razón por la cual solicita un crédito pues este tan importante elemento se le averió y su reparación es muy costosa por ende recurre a esta ayuda pues su negocio esta pardo de momento y no pueden sacar la producción que requieren sus clientes, con este daño se ven afectados tanto el señor Sergio como sus tres empleados y se expone al riesgo de perder clientes lo cual sería muy malo para los planes que Sergio tiene el cual expandir su negocio a otras partes crear sucursales y sabe que con la ayuda de dios y el apoyo incondicional de su familia puede lograrlo
texts.en:
Sergio is a 44-year-old man who works making ice cream, alongside two of his family members and one additional person. He learned this activity from his last boss, and it was this boss who sold him the establishment where he now works. With effort, sacrifice and happiness, Sergio has managed to position his business and gain a good number of customers. He sells both wholesale and retail, and his main customers are ice cream shops that distribute his delicious artisanal ice creams that can be shared with someone special. 

With his years of experience and work, Sergio has acquired certain things that are indispensable to the growth of his business, including a "cava". In Colombia, a "cava" is a very large refrigerator where products can be stored. This is why Sergio is requesting the loan. This important element of his business has broken down, and repairs are very costly. This is why he is looking for help, as his business can't run for the moment and he can't keep up with the production that his customers need. This has greatly affected both Señor Sergio and his three employees. They run the risk of losing customers, which would be very bad for Sergio's plans, as he wants to expand his business and establish branches elsewhere. He knows that with the help of God and the unconditional support of his family, he will achieve his goals.

loans.use: to repair his cellar, which is an indispensable tool for his work.

loans.name: Diana Patricia

texts.es:
Diana es una mujer luchadora, trabajadora, simpática y con muchos aires de progreso, pues desde hace algún tiempo viene trabajando en su propio negocio de venta de calzado en su propio almacén.
Ella trabaja de lunes a viernes y su principal mercado es el público campesino.
Sus productos son de buena calidad y tienen la gran ventaja de ser muy económicos para sus clientes.
Ella desea ampliar su negocio y ofrecer mucha más variedad de calzado, por eso solicita un préstamo para comprar surtido y variedad, además de comprar una vitrina nueva.
Ella es una mujer incansable y día a día se esfuerza por realizar el mejor trabajo, ofreciendo un buen servicio y una sonrisa amable a la hora de una venta.
Una de sus metas es poder ofrecer un empleo y de esta forma ella podrá dedicarle un poco más de tiempo a su hija.
texts.en:
Diana is a hardworking and kind fighter of a woman who wants to get ahead. For quite some time she has been running her own business selling shoes in her own shop. She works from Monday to Friday and rural customers comprise her main target market. Her products are of high quality and also have the advantage of being affordable for her customers. 

Diana would like to expand her business and offer a much greater variety of shoes. She is requesting a loan to purchase a variety of stock as well as a new display cabinet. 

Diana is a tireless woman and she pushes herself day in and day out to do the best work possible and provide good customer service and a friendly smile while she makes her sales. One of her goals is to be able to hire an employee so that she can spend a bit more time with her daughter.

loans.use: to buy shoes to sell and a new display cabinet.

loans.name: Mejocote Group

texts.es: Doña Maria,tiene 47 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene dos hijos, y vive en una aldea del municipio de  Gracias Lempira. Siempre se a dedicado a la agricultura, lleva 10 años de cultivar  maíz y frijoles y los vende en el mercado de la zona. Solicita un segundo ciclo por 5,000 lempiras  en forma grupal para fertilizar y cultivar maíz y frijol. Esto le ayudara a obtener mejor cosecha y dar mejor asistencia. Su plan es mejorar ingresos mediante su actividad. El grupo se llama Mejocote, integrado de tres personas, ellas residen en la misma zona, dedicandose a la agricultura y el monto total del préstamo es por 13,000 para fertilizar el cultivo de maiz y frijol. En la foto esta Maria a la izquierda, sigue Reyna y Esly a la derecha.
texts.en:
Maria is 47 years old, a single mother with two children, and lives in a village in the area of Gracias Lempira. She has always been a farmer and for the last 10 years has been growing corn and beans which she sells in the market.

She has applied for a second cycle loan of 5,000 Lempiras to fertilize and grow corn and beans. This will help her get better crop and provide better care.

Her plan is to improve her income through this activity.  Her group is called Mejocote and is composed of three people.  They live in the same area, are all farmers. and the total loan amount is 13,000 to fertilize the corn and bean crop.  Pictured left is Maria, Reyna and Esly on the right.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for growing corn and beans.

loans.name: Juna Group

texts.en:
This group is called Juna. It consists of four women from Hodeidah, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 160,000 YER (Yemen rials) from AMB.

Fatima is the leader of the group. She is a 31-year-old single woman living with her family in Hodeidah, Yemen. She has a diploma certificate. Due to high rates of unemployment in the country, Fatima couldn't find a job in order to improve her family and help with the expenses of the house. 

Fatima wanted to find a business that was profitable for her. As a result, she decided to start her own business selling accessories, cosmetics and ready-made women's clothes door to door. She started in this business three years ago. She earns good profits from this business, and for further expanding, Fatima asked a loan of 40,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase more ready-made women's clothes, accessories and makeup to resell to the customers for more retail profits.

Fatima looks forward to expanding her business more through purchasing all kinds of women's clothes, accessories, makeup and perfumes.

loans.use: to purchase more ready-made women's clothes, accessories and makeup to resell.

loans.name: Eseri

texts.en:
Eseri lives in Kampala. She is married and has 4 children; 3 attend school.  She doesn’t take care of 2 additional family members. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity but not running water. Her major monthly expense include school fees and medication.

She has sold charcoal on a retail basis from the market for 15 years. She works seven days a week. She earns additional income from renting houses. 

She requests 1,000,000  UGX to buy bags of charcoal. Her business challenges includes transportation and seasonal changes. Her goal and aspiration is to buy a delivery van to serve more customers.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Ledy

texts.es: La Señora  Ledy tiene 31 años, ella tiene un hijo de la edad de 9 años,  ella se dedica a la venta  de comida y almuerzo en su puesto de venta en la zona de Chacarilla, este préstamo es su primera secuencia con la institución,  La Señora  Ledy  va a usar este préstamo para la compra de mesas y sillas para  su negocio, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es que  la  Señora  Ledy necesita esto para brindar mayor comodidad a sus clientes que en ocasiones comen parados, La Señora  Ledy enfrenta retos en su negocio que son que  tiene que levantarse muy temprano cuando hace  frio para preparar su comida,  es propensa a agarrar reumatismo el cual es muy frecuente en personas con esa actividad,  va a utilizar los beneficios en comprar insumos y ofrecer a sus clientes un buen servicio su deseo  para su negocio es el de tener una pensión de comida variada más grande donde pueda vender más y mejor y poder superarse en la vida.
texts.en: Ledy is 31 years old and has a 9 year old son. She sells meals and lunches at her stand in the Chacarilla neighborhood. This is her first loan with this institution. Ledy will use the loan to buy tables and chairs for her business. Her reason for requesting the loan is to provide more comfort for her customers who at times have to eat standing up. Ledy has challenges in her business like having to get up very early when it is cold to prepare her food. She has rheumatism  which is quite frequent with people working in this business. She will use the profits to buy supplies and offer her customers good service. Her wish for her business is to have a larger cafe with more variety and where she could sell more and get ahead in life.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs.

loans.name: Gricelda Noemi

texts.es: Gricelda de 40 años de edad vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos en casa propia, ella tiene un negocio de venta de productos lácteos como: queso, crema, quesillo, requesón, leche, etc. está ubicado en el mercado que se encuentra cerca de su lugar de residencia tiene mucha clientela por la calidad de los productos y los buenos precios, Gricelda está solicitando a INTEGRAL un préstamo para poder comprar mas productos por mayor y poder seguir con sus ventas que le generan buenas ganancias y así ella y su familia puedan tener una vida plena sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
Gricelda is 40 years old. She lives with her husband and their three children in their own home. She has a business selling dairy products like cheese, cream, fresh cheese, cottage cheese, milk, etc. It is located in the market near her home. She has many customers due to the quality of her products and the good prices.

Gricelda is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL so that she can purchase more products in bulk and continue selling her products. They generate good income so that her and her family can have a full life without limitations.

loans.use: to purchase more products in bulk like cheese, cream, fresh cheese, cottage cheese, milk, etc.

loans.name: Maria Jesus

texts.es:
María de Jesús de 57 años de edad, madre soltera con dos hijos menores de edad, es originaria de  Leon, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente de la región. Se caracteriza por ser trabajadora, responsable, con ganas de superación personal. En sus ratos libre le gusta disfrutar de la compañía de sus hijos. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudo cursar sus estudios, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar enfermería. En la actualidad lucha día a día para brindarles un futuro mejor a sus hijos.

gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad economica la venta de batidos en su casa de habitacion, frescos naturales de frutas como zanahorias, naranjas, sandias, bananos con leche. Ella dedica a su negocio unas ocho horas dirias ofreciendo su producto. El objetivo del credito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de materia prima para la elaboracion de los batidos, para que en un futuo no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos.Maria de jesus agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindna  a personas de escasos recursos y paises pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Maria Jesus is 57 years old, and she is a single mother with two young children. She is originally from Leon, which is located in the western part of the region. She is described as hard working, responsible, and eager to get ahead. In her free time, she likes to enjoy spending time with her children. Unfortunately, because of a lack of economic resources, she wasn't able to finish her studies, but she would have liked to have studied nursing. Now, she fights every day to offer her children a better future.

Thanks to her hard work and eagerness to get ahead, she works selling fruit smoothies in her home. The smoothies are fresh and natural, made of fruits such as carrots, oranges, watermelons, and bananas with milk. She spends eight hours a day working at her business, selling her product. The purpose of the loan is to invest in working capital and to stock her business to purchase the ingredients needed to make the smoothies, so that in the not-so-distant future, she can earn a higher income. 

Maria Jesus is thankful for the help that the Kiva investors give to people with few resources and to poor countries such as Nicaragua so that they can have a dignified life.

loans.use: to invest in working capital to purchase ingredients to make fruit smoothies such as carrots, oranges, watermelons, and bananas with milk.

loans.name: G.s. Fe Y Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El g.s. fe y esperanza está conformado por cuatro integrantes dos hombres y dos mujeres, padres responsables con diez hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Son originarios del Sauce lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte de la región. Se caracterizan por ser trabajadores, responsables con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económico no pudo cursar una carrera y se vieron en la obligación de trabajar desde temprana edad, para ayudar con los gastos del hogar.
Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante la coordinadora es Luz Marina y tiene por actividad económica una pulperia es una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestibles como:arroz, azucar, leche, huevos, aceite, fosforos, jugos, galletas, gaseosas, quesos. ella dedica a su negocio unas doce horas diarias ofreciendo su producto. El objetivo del credito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio, para que eun un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. el G.s. fe y esperanza agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y paises pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The "Fe y Esperanza" ("Faith and Hope") Group is made up of four members, two men and two women. They are responsible parents with ten children in total under their care. They are from Sauce, which is located in the northern part of their region. They are hardworking and responsible with a desire for personal improvement. Unfortunately, due to a lack of financial resources, they were unable to study towards a degree and they had to work from a young age to help with the household expenses.

Thanks to her effort and her desire to succeed, Luz Marina is the coordinator of this group. She owns a grocery store where she sells goods such as rice, sugar, milk, eggs, oil, matches, juice, cookies, soda, and cheese. She dedicates twelve hours per day to selling products in her business. She will use this loan to invest in working capital and stock her business so that she can earn a better income in the near future.

The "Fe y Esperanza" Group is grateful for the help which Kiva lenders provide for people with limited resources in poor countries such as Nicaragua, so that they can have a decent livelihood.

loans.use: to invest in working capital by buying goods such as rice, sugar, milk, eggs, oil, matches, juice, cookies, soda, and cheese.

loans.name: Felista

texts.en:
Felista is a 54-year-old separated woman with two children. She has run her general store for the past year. She makes an estimated monthly income of 25,000 KES. 

She would like 67,000 KES to restock her general store with sugar, flour and rice to sell to clients in her area.

She has successfully repaid her previous loans and will use her anticipated profits to restock her general store.

loans.use: to buy sugar, flour and rice.

loans.name: Flavia

texts.en:
Flavia lives in Kampala and is married with 5 children; 3 attend school.  She takes care of 1 additional family member (sister). 

She sells second-hand clothing on a retail basis from the market. She has been in  this business for 7 years and works six days a week. 

Flavia earns additional income from farming. She has requested 700,000 UGX to buy large quantities of second-hand clothing. Her business challenges include transportation and seasonal changes. Her goal and aspiration is to buy a plot of land. 

She lives in her own house and the family does not have access to electricity or running water. Her major monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: to buy bulk quantities of second-hand clothes.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with a daughter who is in school. She also takes care of her mother. 

Charity sells soft drinks on a retail basis at the market. She has been in this business for the last 10 years, working seven days a week. She also weaves mats to gets additional income. 

She has requested for a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan shillings to buy more pineapples, watermelons, passionfruits, oranges and crates of soda. Her business challenges includes electricity and seasonality. Her goal and aspiration is to get a bigger fridge and a cooler so as to serve more customers. She lives in rented house and the family has access to piped water and electricity. Her major monthly expenses include food and medication.

loans.use: to buy more pineapples, watermelons, passionfruits, oranges and crates of soda.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to help his family by improving his house by painting it and making the plumbing work

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah is 55 years old, married and from Nyandarua South. She supports her husband in taking care of the family, with four children aged between 24 years and 10 years old.

Hannah is a farmer and has been in it for the past twelve years. She has applied for her second loan from VisionFund Kenya to enable her to buy seedlings and fertilizers.

She hopes to repay the loan and borrow more money in the near future.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizers.

loans.name: Milly

texts.en:
Milly lives in Kampala. She is a single mother with 8 children; 3 attend school.  She takes care of 2 additional family members. 

She has been a tailor at the market for 20 years and works seven days a week. 

She has requested 300,000 UGX to buy bolts of fabric. Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonal changes. Her goal and aspiration is to buy a plot of land and buy an electric sewing machine. 

She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and running water. Her major monthly expense include school fees and medication.

loans.use: to buy bolts of fabric.

loans.name: Stellah

texts.en:
Stellah is a married woman with  1 child. She describes herself as dedicated. 

She operates a retail business to sell cooking fat, drinks, sweets and other items. Her business is located in a good business area and her primary customers are individuals. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be financial. She will use the 20,000 KES to buy cooking fat, sweets, flour and other items. Her business goal is to own a big shop within 5 years. 

This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy cooking fat, sweets, flour and other items.

loans.name: Herine

texts.en: Herine is a married woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself as experienced. She operates a retail business where she sells fish. She has been involved in this business for 7 years. Her business is located in a viable location, and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy a freezer for storing fish. Her business goal is to have a sustainable business within 5 years. She hopes that in the future she will be successful. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a freezer for storing fish

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is a  Kiva borrower with 4 children. She describes herself as God fearing. 

She operates a retail business to sell fruit and vegetables. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a good area and she serves the general public. She will use 20,000 KES to buy cereal and vegetables. 

This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy cereal and vegetables.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a 22-year-old married man. He has one child. He describes himself to be optimistic. 

He operates a retail business where he sells wheat flour, maize flour and other items. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a vibrant place, and his primary customers are of all types. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the lack of capital. 

He will use the KES 10,000 loan to buy more stock of wheat flour, maize flour and other items. 

His business goal is to own a wholesale shop within five years. This is his third loan with SMEP DTM. His previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of wheat flour, maize flour and other items.

loans.name: Hana

texts.en:
Hana is a  Kiva borrower with 2 children. She describes herself as determined. 

She operates a restaurant to cook food to sell. She has been involved in this business for 20 years. Her business is located in a marketable place and her primary customers are both men and women. She describes her biggest business challenge as inadequate capital. 

She will use 20,000 KES to restock ingredients for preparing food. This will enable her expand her business.

She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to restock ingredients for preparing food.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of maize

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a married woman. She has five children. She describes herself to be patient. 

She operates a retail business where she sells shoes. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a good area, and her primary customers are both male and female. She describes her biggest business challenge to be changes in fashion. 

She will use the KES 10,000 loan to buy more stock of shoes. 

Her business goal is to own a big retail shop within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will expand her business. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more stock of shoes.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en: Christine is a 35-year-old woman. She has 5 children. She describes herself as determined. She operates a beauty salon where she offers hair treatment services. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a good area, and her primary customers are the general public. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. She will use the Kes 10,000 loan to buy more stocks of beauty products for use in the salon. Her business goal is to expand within 5 years. She hopes that in the future she will have a good life.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of beauty products

loans.name: Erlita

texts.en:
Erlita is a 53-year-old married woman with seven children, two attend school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Erlita has a business to sell fruit and vegetables in the Philippines. Erlita requested 8,000 loan PHP through NWTF to buy fruit and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

Erlita has been in this business for 19 years. In the future, Erlita would like to save enough money to build a store at the public market.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Gohar

texts.en:
Gohar is 35 years old and lives in the village of Aygehovit in the Tavush region. She has two children. 

Her husband regularly goes to the Russian Federation to work abroad, so Gohar and her mother-in-law farm.  She has 11 buffalos and 5 piglets. She also grows crops, hay, and cultivates vegetables. The most beautiful part of her farm is a large vineyard where she gathers a lot of grapes to sell for making wine. 

Goher helps her husband to meet the family living expenses and does the hardest part of it. 

Gohar decided to buy more piglets and requests this loan to buy 2 piglets and fodder for her cattle.

loans.use: to buy 2 piglets and fodder for her cattle.

loans.name: Ma. Teresa

texts.en:
Ma. Teresa is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income by raising livestock.  Ma. Teresa is borrowing 7000 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Ma. Teresa has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is a 39-year-old married mother with four children, all of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Marites has a fruit vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for ten years. She requested a PHP 25,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fruits to sell in her food stall.

In the future, Marites would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fruits to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen is a married woman with four children who works hard to support her family.

She has a clothing business in the Philippines and earns additional income from food vending and growing rice. Carmen is borrowing 9,000 PHP through NWTF to buy blouses, pants, slippers and other clothes.

Carmen has sustained her business activities with three previous loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream which is to build and expand her business and secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy blouses, pants, slippers and other clothing.

loans.name: Nelma

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Nelma works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Nelma is borrowing 8000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

Nelma has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.


*This picture was taken during market day.

loans.use: to buy fish for her food stall.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is 54 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Rosalie is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Rosalie has been raising pigs for 10 years and earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Elyn Joe

texts.en:
Elyn Joe is 26 years old and married with one child, who is in school. Elyn Joe works very hard to provide for her family.

Elyn Joe runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more variety goods to sell.

Elyn Joe has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items, such as snack foods, shampoo, rice and other groceries. 

In the future, Elyn Joe would like to save enough money in order to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more variety goods to sell.

loans.name: Zarine

texts.en:
Zarine is 27 years old and lives in the city of Kapan  in the Syunik region. She is single and lives with her parents. 

Zarine graduated from Kapan State College as an economist.  She is an accountant at a private accounting agency. 

Zarine’s father works at the poultry factory and has great skills in this occupation. Zarine and her parents raise poultry. Her father helps her to perfectly care for a lot of chickens and she manages to sell a lot of fresh eggs to her loyal customers.

Zarine needs this loan to buy 200 chickens and fodder. She greatly hopes that this loan will make her farm richer and increase her family's income.

loans.use: to buy 200 chickens and fodder.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna lives with her husband in the city of Vanadzor in the Lori region. She has a higher education and a specialty of pedagogue. 

She works at the school as a history teacher.  Her husband is  35 years old and he decided to earn a higher education. He studird at the Vanadzor State Pedagogical Institute in the Department of Jurisprudence. He is paid to work in the division of distance learning, which gives him a chance to earn  a living. 

Anna decided to ask for this loan to financially support her husband.  She needs this loan to pay her husband’s tuition fee for the second semester. If she gets this loan, it will be a great surprise for her husband. 

She sincerely thanks Kiva  for her previous loan which helped her to buy a computer and printer.

loans.use: to pay for her husband’s tuition fee for the second semester.

loans.name: Marie Grace

texts.en: Marie Grace is 28 years old. She is married with three children. She sells meat in a butcher shop, which she has been running for the past six years. With the loan she would like to buy more meats to sell. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the business.

loans.use: To buy more meat to sell

loans.name: Albert

texts.en:
Meet 60-year-old Albert who lives and farms in the Kitale area of North Rift Kenya. He is married and has 7 children, all of whom are of school going age and dependent on their parents. His primary source of income is milk, eggs, maize, and some vegetable crops; he also has a retail business which is an extra source of income. He always looks forward to harvest time because he gets to enjoy the fruits of his labor. His biggest challenge is the fluctuating prices of farm produce in the local markets.

Albert took out a loan to help him to boost his farming by buying more poultry for more egg production. His income will increase, and this will give him a better opportunity of providing his children with a better education.

loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Shangilieni Group

texts.fr: La cliente Katherine est une commerçante depuis 10 ans, présidente et membre d’un groupe d’affaires «Shangilieni», entrepreneur dynamique, âgée de 49 ans, veuve et mère de 7 enfants qui tous, étudient. Elle est vendeuse divers articles et sociétaire d’une mini quincaillerie. Elle étale ses business à domicile dans une avenue mouvementée. Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre ses activités. Elle va acheter des tuyaux, vannes, fils electriques, interrupteurs, prises, chevilles, coudes,pvc etc. Elle avait débuté avec de fonds reçu de son mari, lors de son vivant. Dans l’avenir, elle souhaite progresser dans son business construire une maison, scolariser, nourrir  ses enfants . Elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien aux femmes entrepreneurs exclues du système bancaire classique, tout en leur accordant des crédits sans garantie matérielle, surtout, pendant, la période post conflit dans la région de l’Est Pays.
texts.en:
Katherine, age 49, is a dynamic entrepreneur and a member of the business group Shangilieni, of which she is also president. She has been a merchant for the past 10 years. She sells various merchandise and is part-owner of a small hardware store, running her activity from her home in a busy street. 

Katherine is seeking a loan from Hekima to bolster her activity. She plans to buy pipes, valves, electric wire, switches, receptacles, pegs, PVC parts, etc. 

She originally started her business with funds given by her husband when he was alive. 

Her goals are to expand her business, build a house, and provide for her children with respect to food and schooling. 

She wishes to thank Hekima for offering micro-financing without collateral to businesswomen who cannot use the traditional banking system, especially in these post-war times in the Eastern region.

loans.use: to buy pipes, valves, electric wire, switches, receptacles, pegs, PVC parts, etc.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a 46-year-old woman with four children. 

She would like to use the loan to buy sugar and cooking oil to sell. The profits will be used to reinvest in her business and save money for the future.

loans.use: to buy sugar and cooking oil.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy charcoal.

loans.name: Qristine

texts.en: Qristine is from Ijevan town where she lives with her husband, parents-in-law, sister-in-law and two children (ages seven and four years old). Qristine provides cosmetic services in a small room located in the center of Ijevan town. She has been involved in this service for two years and during these years of hard and tireless work, she gained a good number of clients. The requested loan will be a huge support for Qristine to make renovations to her workroom and provide better conditions for her clients. Qristine has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for renovating the room where she provides cosmetics service

loans.name: Le

texts.en:
Le is 45 years old and married with two children. She lives with her family in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. She and her husband sell rice at their store. 

She started her business eight years ago. She intends to take a loan to gradually expand her business by buying a larger quantity of rice to increase her sales. 

She hopes that her business will run smoothly and will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy rice.

loans.name: Hang

texts.en:
Hang requests a new loan to buy bulk quantities of thread to increase her sales. 

Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her to increase the size of her business, attract new customers, and increase sales. She also hopes that, through the loan, she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy thread.

loans.name: Armine

texts.en:
Armine lives with her husband, her retired mother-in-law, and two school-age children. Together with her husband, she has been trading in fruits and vegetables for 2 years. They sell the harvest in the nearby town of Kapan, using their own truck. 

The requested loan is very important for their small business. Armine asks for financial support to be able to purchase new stores of fruits and vegetables. She has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

Please help this hard working family further develop their small business and gather more income for their family.

loans.use: purchase fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora lives in Yerevan, Armenia with her mother and 3-years-old son. Her husband left the country last year, with the hope of finding a well paid job to support his family. To earn income for covering daily needs, Flora started a retail business trading a large variety of clothing from her house. The requested loan is highly important for her business. She asks this financial support to be able to purchase clothing supplies to cover current customer orders. 

Flora has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

Please help this young entrepreneur to further develop her business and sustain her family's living.

loans.use: to pay for clothing to meet her customer's orders.

loans.name: Tram

texts.en: Tram requests a new loan to buy used clothes to sell at her store. Tram's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her to increase the size of her business, attract new customers and increase her sales. She also hopes to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy used clothes to sell.

loans.name: Lan's Group

texts.en:
Lan is a 32-year-old married woman. She lives with two children and her husband in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns money as a worker for a local company. For 2 years, she has run a business of selling soft drinks and fruit juice to people in her community.

Lan is the Group Leader of a 5-member loan group that lives in Ho Chi Minh City. In the picture she is the second one from the left. Each of the other group members are requesting loans to fund income-generating activities.

Lan would like a loan to purchase a variety and quantity of soft drinks and fruit to better satisfy her customers. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional customers. 

She also hopes that through her loan she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: to purchase a variety and quantity of soft drinks and fruit to better satisfy her customers.

loans.name: Hung's Group

texts.en:
Hung is 37 years old and lives with his children and wife. His wife works in a local factory. 

Hung has supported his family through a weaving business making textiles since 2009. He is the group leader of a 7-member loan group that live in Ho Chi Minh City. In the picture he is in the middle of the photo wearing a white T-shirt. 

Each of the other group members request a loan to fund income-generating activities. Hung requests a loan to purchase a larger quantity of raw materials and fiber to increase his production of textiles. He hopes this will enable him to better meet the needs of his customers and attract additional ones. 

He also hopes that through his loan, he will increase his income and save money for any future difficulties facing his family.

loans.use: to buy raw materials and fiber to weave into textiles.

loans.name: Lieu's Group

texts.en:
Lieu, 43, is divorced and has two daughters. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Lieu supports her family by running a general store in front of her house. She started this business 10 years ago. She sells many food products and household items to people in her community. She is a group leader of a five-member loan group. The members live in Ho Chi Minh. In the picture, she is the second one from the left. Each of the other group members is requesting a loan to fund income-generating activities.

Lieu is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of products, in particular, rice, sugar and beans to stock her store and better satisfy her customers. She hopes her business runs smoothly and generates a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions and sending her children to school.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar and beans to stock her store

loans.name: Hoa's Group

texts.en:
Hoa is a 44-year-old married woman with two children. She lives with her family in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns a living working as a farmer. Hoa supports her family by running a food stall selling bread with pork sausage to people in her community. She started this business eight years ago. 

Hoa is the Group Leader of a four-member loan group. The members live in Ho Chi Minh City. In the picture, she is the second one from the right. Each of the other group members is requesting a loan to fund income-generating activities.

Hoa would like to receive a loan to expand her business by purchasing better quality food and ingredients to sell from her food stall. She hopes that this will enable her to increase the turnover of her business, earn a higher income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy better quality food and ingredients to sell from her stall

loans.name: Thu

texts.en: Thu would like to take a loan to buy a larger quantity of products such as instant noodles and beverages to sell from her stall. Thu's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and increasing sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy noodles and beverages to sell from her stall.

loans.name: Dung

texts.en:
Dung, 50, is married and has a daughter. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam. She and her husband earn an income running a general store in front of their house. 

She started this business 13 years ago. She sells sugar, toys for kids, soft drinks, yogurt and other household items to people in her community. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of products, in particular foods and beverages, to stock her store and better satisfy her customers.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to expand her store's inventory with more food and beverages.

loans.name: Quy

texts.en:
Quy is 47 years old and is married. She has three children and lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam. She is running a business of processing traditional dresses. She started this business three years ago. Her husband works as a worker in a local factory. 

She intends to use her loan to buy fabric and other materials to increase her production of dresses. 

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help improve her family's living conditions and save money for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy fabric and materials for processing and making dresses.

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en:
Thuy, 51, is married and has three children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam. She and her husband earn an income running a general store in front of their house. 

She started this business 20 years ago. She sells sugar, toys for kids, soft drinks, yogurt and other household items to people in her community. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of products, in particular food and beverages, to stock her store and better satisfy her customers.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy food and beverages to stock her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase an outboard motor for his canoe.

loans.name: Luz En El Camino Group

texts.es: Leny, tiene 23 años de edad, es soltero vive junto a su madre en una aldea del municipio de Gracias, Lempira. siempre se ha dedicado a realizar actividades agrícolas, siembra y vende café en pergamino desde hace 5 años, esta actividad es propia y es la que le genera ingresos. El solicita 3,500 lempiras en forma grupal para fertilizar el cultivo de café y mejorar la cosecha. Su plan es poder crecer como persona, ayudar a su madre y cultivar mas café. El grupo a que pertenece se llama Luz en el Camino, integrado por 4 miembros que se dedican a la agricultura y viven en la misma zona. Solicitan un monto de préstamo por 17,000 Lempiras para poder abonar el cultivo de café y sacar mejor cosecha. En la foto se identifica Leny esta a la izquierda, Ulises, Carmen y Mirza a la derecha.
texts.en:
Leny, 23, is single and lives with his mother in a village in Gracias, Lempira. He has always worked in agriculture. He has been growing and selling parchment coffee for five years. This activity is his own source of income. Within his group, he has applied for a loan of 3,500 Honduran lempiras to fertilize his coffee crops and improve his harvest. His plan is to be able to grow as a person, help his mother, and grow more coffee.

The group to which he belongs is called Luz en el Camino ("Light on the Path"). The group is made up of four members who work in agriculture and live in the same area. They have applied for a group loan of 17,000 Honduran lempiras to fertilize coffee crops and improve their harvests. In the photo, Leny is on the left side. To his right are Ulises, Carmen and Mirza.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his coffee crops.

loans.name: Neli

texts.en:
Neli is a 55-year-old single woman from the village of Marani which is in the  Samtredia district. She lives alone and cultivates a plot of agricultural land to grow nuts to sell locally. 

Neli works really hard to be financially stabile, that is why she takes care of an older woman who lives in her village. She earns 250 GEL monthly which is hardly enough to meet her daily expenses. 

Neli has a great desire to expand her agribusiness through dairy farming. She will purchase a dairy cow with the requested money, produce milk-based products, and sell them locally. 
 
The Start Up credit will be a great support for her and she has sincere regards for the Kiva lenders. Neli awaits and highly appreciates your support.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow to produce milk-based products.

loans.name: Melvin Omar

texts.es: Melvin, tiene 38 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposa, con quien tiene tres hijos y reside en la comunidad de Nueva Frontera, Santa Bárbara. Melvin lleva 18 años de dedicarse al cultivo de café, el cual vende en grano en el mercado local. Además cultiva maíz y frijoles. Solicita un préstamo por 6,000 lempiras para poder abonar y limpiar la finca de café para ayudar a que la finca produzca más y mejor café. El tiene como meta adquirir más terreno para ampliar el cultivo.
texts.en:
Melvin is thirty-eight years old and is in a common-law marriage with his wife.  Together, they have three children and live in the community of Nueva Frontera, Santa Bárbara.  Melvin has been growing coffee for eighteen years, and he sells his coffee beans at the local market.  He also grows corn and beans.

He is requesting a loan for 6,000 lempiras so that he can buy fertilizer and clean the coffee farm.  In doing this, the farm lands will be able to produce more and better quality coffee.

His goal is to acquire more land so that he can expand his crops.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and clean his coffee crops.

loans.name: Nato

texts.en:
Nato is a 45-year-old married woman, from the village Mitsabogira. She lives with her son and mother, who gets monthly assistance from the local government. Nato is involved in agricultural activities. Particularly, she takes care of 3 dairy cows, produces cheese and milk and uses the products for local trading. Nato generates approximately 350 Gel monthly, and this income is hardly enough for covering all of their daily costs. She applied for a loan several times but couldn’t obtain one from the local financial institutions, because of their requirements to have business experience or stable revenue, until the Start Up program began which is a joint product of Kiva and Credo. The program allows rural poor people, such as Nato, to have a chance to start or re-start a business. With the requested money, Nato will build a greenhouse, plant vegetables and greens and then sell them in the local market. 

The family's living conditions will significantly improve, and the family will have enough income to access regular credit products available on the country’s capital market, in case of need. Nato awaits your support.

loans.use: To build a greenhouse

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase construction materials such as cement and bricks

loans.name: Al- Ra'aghd* Group

texts.en:
Al- Ra'aghd* is a group which is comprised of five women from Sana'a, Yemen. They are requesting a loan of 250,000 YER from AMB.

Aysha is the leader of the group. She is a 38-year-old married woman with four children. Her oldest child is 8 years old and the youngest one is 3 years old. She studied until Secondary school, but she couldn't complete her studies. Aysha and her husband are employed as cleaners. The money that they receive from their jobs is not enough to cover all of the expenses of the family. Aysha says that her house lacks many home appliances, and she can't afford them. Unfortunately, they didn't have enough money to purchase some of the appliances and to furnish the house. For this reason, Aysha is requesting a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase home appliances for the house. 

Aysha looks forward to improving the condition of her family. Her dreams in the future are to furnish her house with new furniture and home appliances. She hopes to send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase home appliances for the house

loans.name: Al-Amal Al- Sham Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Amal Al-Sham. It consists of four ladies who live in Hodeidah, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 140,000 YER from AMB.

Fatima is a hardworking woman. She is a 54-year-old married woman with 13 children who live with them in a rented house in a poor area of Hodeidah. She is the leader of the group. Fatima started her business of selling women's clothes door to door three years ago. She started her business with a small amount of capital. Year by year her business improves step by step but most of what she earns goes to the expenses of the family. She has good experience in the business. Thanks to these experiences, she deals with her own business with ease. Unfortunately, the income of this business is not enough to cover all of the expenses of the family, and she wants to enlarge it. For this reason, she applied for a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase more women's clothes and resell them to her customers.

She looks forward to expanding her business more through selling ready-made women's clothes and accessories.

loans.use: To purchase more women's clothing and resell them to her customers.

loans.name: Maa Santoshi Shg (D) Group

texts.en:
The "Maa Santoshi Shg" group consists of twelve members from a small village of Nayagarh district, Odisha, India, with Tribeni selected as the Kiva representative. Tribeni has volunteered to be the Kiva group representative; in the photo, she is standing with her hand raised. 

Tribeni is 41 years old and has been a farmer for ten years. Tribeni works as a farmer to provide a standard life for her two children. The community and other farmers know Tribeni as friendly, hardworking, reliable, trustworthy and an experienced farmer. Tribeni described her harvest last year as good, but hopes she can have an even better one with the support of the People's Forum and the other farmers in her group.

Tribeni will use her Kiva loan portion to cover the initial cost of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer for her cropland. She, along with her group members, wants to say, "Thank you," to Kiva and its lenders for this support.

loans.use: to cover the initial cost of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer for her cropland.

loans.name: Laxmi Saraswati Shg Group

texts.en:
This group, called "Laxmi Saraswati SHG", consists of 11 ladies who live in a small village in the Nayagarh district of Odisha, India. The group has applied for a loan of 275,000 INR from People's Forum (Kiva's partner). All the members of this group are involved in different livelihood activities like animal raising, vegetable selling, etc. 

Chabita, the lady standing with her hand raised, is a 34-year-old married mother. She has been working as a vendor, selling fish and other food. She started her business with a small amount of capital and would now like to increase her sales volume in order to increase her profit and raise her child well. 

She has requested a loan to purchase more fish and other food. Chabita hopes to expand her business to live comfortably with her family. 

She, along with her group members, is very excited and grateful to Kiva and its lenders across the world for this kind help and support.

loans.use: to purchase more fish and other food to increase her sales.

loans.name: Maa Mangala Shg (A) Group

texts.en:
Basanti is a resident of Nayagarh district in Odisha, India. She is the mother of one daughter. Currently, her daughter still depends on her, as her daughter is in school. Her entire family relies solely on rice farming and a grocery selling business. 

Basanti has been involved in her current business for more than thirteen years, and now she is able to earn up to 3,800 INR per month. She has never been with People's Forum India, Kiva’s partner, before.

Basanti currently leads a group of nine women to obtain a new loan. All of her co-borrowers are first-time borrowers with People's Forum. The total loan amount for her entire group is 180,000 INR. Basanti's loan portion will be 20,000 INR. As a leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy seeds and fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes her farmland will produce a better yield so she will be able to increase her income.

All the members are happy with this loan and grateful to Kiva lenders for this help and support.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 41 years old, married with three children and two dependents--her parents who are very old. She owns a boutique and does tailoring as the major source of income. She is also an agriculturalist who majors in banana growing on a large scale as another source of income. She has earned a lot from this business as she has been able to pay school fees for her three school going children, one at university and two in secondary school. Also she has bought a plot of land where she wants to construct a permanent house for her family within Ibanda.

Jane is applying for a loan to buy more clothing materials for her tailoring workshop.

Jane’s major challenge is the high rent charged by landlords within the town which sometimes strains her earnings. She also lacks a permanent house for her family.

Her dream is to be a landlady in the future. She hopes to achieve this with continuous financial boosts from Ugafode and the support of Kiva lenders. She is hardworking.

loans.use: to buy materials to make dresses

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 29 years old and married with three children and one dependent (his mother who he is looking after because she is very old). James deals in the sale of second-hand motorcycles that he buys and resells.  He also does boda-boda (motorcycle taxi service) as another source of income. He owns two motorcycles, both used for transportation. James has managed to look after his family through income from this business. For instance, he has managed to secure land for agriculture, constructed a permanent house for his family and supported his relatives financially.

James is applying for a loan of UGX 5,000,000 to buy more motorcycles to sell, as it will enable him to realize much profit and meet his family's needs adequately.

James’ major challenge is limited capital for his business. His dream is to be the leader in the provision of new motorcycles in his region. James is honest and hard working.

loans.use: To buy more motorcycles to sell

loans.name: Prabhu Saibaba Shg Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Bhagyabati lives in a small village of Nayagarh district in Odisha state, India with her husband and her son. The lady standing first from right is Bhagyabati. She has been participating in the Institution since the end of 2013. The couple has a son who is 26 and involved in part-time petty business and goes to the university.

Bhagyabati's family’s income source is primarily from vegetable cultivation and breeding animals at home. Every time she goes far away for work. The life of the family is still difficult but very warm.

Coming into the new season, moreover, Bhagyabati's son is still studying so her family incurs more costs, including the big cost of fertilizer for plants. She wants the support to improve her cultivation. She and her family hope this loan will help her family and their vegetables will have a big harvest with high yield. All the members of this group are involved in different activities like animal rearing, milk selling, etc., and all are thankful to Kiva for this help and support.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seeds for vegetable cultivation

loans.name: Maa Mangala Shg Group

texts.en:
Pratima, the lady standing with her hand raised, works in agriculture farming, poultry and cattle. Pratima has been involved in this business for more than eight years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby livestock cattle to raise and sell in the future.

Pratima is 27 years old, and she lives with her husband, parents-in-law and two children in a small village of Nayagarh district of Odisha state, India. Pratima is the group leader of the Maa Mangala self-help group, which consists of twelve members. This is Pratima's first loan with People's Forum.

With her business profit, Pratima hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, to remodel her house, and for her business to do well. 

All the members are very happy with this loan and thankful to Kiva and its lenders across the world for this kind help and support.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock cattle to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Maa Santoshi Shg (C) Group

texts.en:
Mamata is the leader of a group that hails from a small village in the Nayagarh district of Odisha, India. She is a married woman of 30 years. She has a small family comprised of four members, including two children who are in school. The member standing with her hand raised is Mamata. 

With the help of her husband, she has been in a vegetable and flower-selling business for the last seven years. At present, her monthly family income is Rs 5,000, but it is not sufficient to lead a better life. So she formed a self-help group with ten other members in her locality and applied for loan. It is her first loan from People's Forum for the development of her business. With this loan, she will purchase vegetables in bulk and flower plants in large quantity for the growth of her business. Her future plan is to construct a house and to provide a higher education to her children. She is very happy and thankful to Kiva's lenders for this support.

The other members of this group are involved in different business activities like milk selling, fish selling, vegetable selling etc. and all are very happy with this loan.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables and flower plants for her business.

loans.name: Maa Santoshi Shg (B) Group

texts.en:
The Maa Santoshi self help group is made up of nine very responsible women. They work in different activities that have allowed them to improve their households’ finances. They live in a small village of Nayagarh district of Odisha state, India. All the members of this group are involved in different livelihood activities like animal rearing, milk selling, vegetable selling, etc.

One of the members of this group is Manju who is the leader of the group, standing with raised hand. She is 23 years old and she is married. In her marriage, she has two children. Her husband works as a private employee. They live in their family-owned home.

Manju works as a private employee and on holidays she sells fruit and vegetables. The money she will get from this loan will be destined to buying fruit to grow her business. Her goal is to own a shop in a market in the city.

loans.use: to buy fruit to grow her business

loans.name: Kapileswra Shg Group

texts.en:
Kapileswra Self Help Group was formed in January 2014 and consists of ten rural poor women belonging to the below-poverty-line category. This group is located in a remote rural village in the Nayagarh district of Odisha, India. Vegetable cultivation and vending is the primary source of livelihood for most of the members of this group. 

Santi is one of the members among them. The lady standing with raised hand is Santi. She is a very active lady of 28 years of age. She lives with her husband and one son. Santi has a vegetable cultivation farm of one hectare. She and her husband manage the farm. Her husband is an active and cheerful farmer. They produce vegetables like brinjal (eggplant), cauliflower, carrots, cabbage, chilies, cucumbers, papaya, lady’s finger (okra), onions, etc. on the farm. She sells her products to the traders from the nearest town who come to take vegetables from her farm. Santi says that she earns a minimum  of 5,000 INR per month from this business. This is insufficient to meet the day-to-day expenses of her family as well as the farm expenses. 

Santi wants to expand her business by taking a loan from People's Forum. She will utilize the present loan to buy fertilizer and farm inputs, such as seeds and pesticides, for her farm. She expects a good return from her business by expanding her cultivation. Santi dreams of constructing a house and purchasing a water pump for a better irrigation facility for her farm. She also hopes to give her whole family a bright future through her hard work. The other nine members of this group are also involved in businesses like vegetable cultivation, general grocery shops, vegetable vending, and tailoring businesses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and farm inputs, such as seeds and pesticides, for expanding her farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy goods to sell, and a refrigerator

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is 58 years old. He lives in Gaza with his wife and one child. Mahmoud opened a small blacksmith workshop in 2007 and specializes in manufacturing doors and windows. His business is the only source of income for his small family. Mahmoud is satisfied with his business income but he wants to expand.

Mahmoud is requesting a loan to buy new equipment and a blacksmith machine for his workshop. His loan will allow him to expand his business and hire another laborer to help him. Mahmoud’s business is constantly increasing. He is very grateful to everyone who helps him to achieve success in his business with his loan.

loans.use: to buy new equipment and a blacksmith machine

loans.name: Boronkul

texts.ru: Боронкул 60 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 4 детей. У Боронкул - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи она занимается животноводством, стартовав в 1971 году. Целеустремленность и трудолюбие Боронкул, а также ее нацеленность на результат позволили развить хозяйство до 1 дойной коровы, 28 овец, 1 лошади и 2 телят, а также приобрести земельный надел размером 3,00 ГА. Ежемесячный доход Боронкул составляет 12,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Боронкул обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы. Доходы от кредита Боронкул планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и намерена собрать средства на увеличение площади сарая и покупку легкового автомобиля.
texts.en: Boronkul is 60 years old, married, and together with her husband, is raising 4 children. Boronkul has a secondary education. As the main source of income for her family, she practices livestock breeding. She started this business in 1971. Boronkul's determination and hard work as well as her commitment to results allowed her to develop her farm to include 1 milk cow, 28 sheep, 1 horse and 2 calves. She also was able to buy a 3.0 hectare plot of land. Boronkul's monthly income is 12,000 som (KGS). For the purpose of the further development of her business, Boronkul turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy a cow. Boronkul plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further acquisition of livestock. She is also determined to save money to increase the size of her barn and to buy a car.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El cliente de 26 años de edad se dedica al cultivo de maíz y adicional a esto trabaja como albañil, tiene varios años de trabajar en la agricultura y ha ganado experiencia valiosa que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas, el terreno donde siembra está ubicado en una zona de alta incidencia agrícola y muy cercano a su vivienda, cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la almacena en los graneros que muestra la fotografía para luego comercializarlos en todos los alrededores de la comunidad. El cliente es un hombre activo, entregado a su labor y con muchas ganas de salir adelante, ha tomado la decisión de realizar una nueva inversión que le permita aumentar la producción por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito para poder comprar semillas, abono, insecticida, herramientas, etc. el cliente tiene buenas referencias de pago asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez tiene esperanza que llevara a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
The client is 26 years old and makes a living by growing corn and working as a bricklayer. He has many years of experience in agriculture and has obtained valuable experience that has allowed him to obtain the best harvests. The land where he grows his crops is located in a very agricultural area and is close to his home. When his harvest is ready, he stores it in the silos shown in the photograph so that he can later sell it around the community.

The client is an active man, dedicated to his work, and has a great desire to move forward. He has decided to request a new loan that will allow him to increase production. He has requested a loan from INTEGRAL so that he will be able to purchase seeds, fertilizer, insecticide, tools, etc.

The client has good references, assures that he will be able to pay his debt, and, at the same time, has hope that he will bring economic security to his household.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer, insecticide, tools, etc.

loans.name: Wafa'

texts.en:
Wafa' is 32 years old, married, and lives with her husband and her four children. She started her beauty salon business in 2012, and she has good experience in this field. 
Wafa' asked Ryada for this loan to buy a hair dryer and makeup tools, and to re-decorate her salon. This will help her to improve her job, which will enable her to improve her financial situation.
She dreams of expanding her business, and wants to use part of the profits on her children’s education in the future. She is very grateful to everyone who helps her to achieve success in her business with this loan.

loans.use: to buy a hair dryer and makeup tools, and to re-decorate her salon.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy skincare and haircare products.

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en: Aisha lives in Kampala. She is married with 3 children, 2 of whom go to school.  She is a poultry farmer. She operates her business from home on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last 3 years. She works seven days a week.  She has requested for a loan of 700,000 Ugandan shillings to buy poultry feeds, vaccines, and feeding trays. Her business challenge includes changing prices of poultry feeds. Her goal and aspiration is to buy build rental houses.
