She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and does not have access to piped water. Her major monthly expense includes rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more poultry feed, vaccines and feeding trays.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: purchase rice, sugar, noodles. beans, oils, fertilizers, aspirin, Alka-Seltzer, etc.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en: Rita is married with three children, two of whom attend school. She has been keeping poultry for sale for five years and generates extra income from selling second hand clothes in a rented shop. She works seven days a week. She has applied for a loan of 500,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy poultry feed. Her major business challenges include thieves and seasonality. She is aspiring of build more rental houses with accumulated profits. She resides with her husband in their own house with access to both electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more poultry feed

loans.name: Hiba

texts.en:
Hiba is 31-years-old, married, and lives in Gaza with her husband and two children. She started her beauty salon business in 2011, and she has had a good experience in this field. 

Hiba asked Ryada for this loan to buy a hair dryer, makeup tools, and an electronic generator for her salon. This will help her to improve her job, which will enable her to improve her financial situation.

She dreams of expanding her business and desires to use part of the profits on her children’s education in the future.  She is very grateful to everyone who helps her to achieve success in her business with this loan.

loans.use: to buy a hair dryer, makeup tools, and an electronic generator for her salon.

loans.name: Osphat

texts.en: Osphat is a 24 year old single man. He describes himself to be tolerant. He operates a retail business where he sells sugar, bread, flour, cooking oil and other items. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. His business is located in a competitive place. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of cooking oil, flour,bread and other items. His business goal is to own a wholesale shop within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will open a super market. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy more stock of cooking oil, flour, bread and other items for sale

loans.name: Lila

texts.en: Lila is 40 years old, married and raising six children. She started a small business sewing women's clothing in 2010. The business is very good, but more importantly Lila enjoys her sewing work that yields her a monthly income of $700. In order to further develop her business, Lila requested a loan from Ryada to buy fabrics for sewing and a sewing machine. Lila wants to use the earnings from this loan to expand her business and also to save money to buy two additional sewing machines. She is very grateful to everyone who helps her to achieve success.

loans.use: to buy fabrics for sewing and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Robai

texts.en: Robai is a 39-year-old married woman. She has five children. She describes herself to be dedicated. She operates a farm where she grows maize, beans, and other crops. She has been involved in this business for eight years. Her business is located in a productive place and her primary customers are urban dwellers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough rainfall. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy farm inputs. Her business goal is to expand within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a better life. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy farm inputs

loans.name: Siony

texts.en:
Siony is 42-years-old and married with three children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Siony is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Siony has been raising pigs for twenty years and also earns additional income from abaca weaving and fishing.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 59 years old and married with six children.

Elena works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Elena has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from clothing sales.

Elena aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Faraja Group

texts.fr: Madame Furaha est présidente de l’association de crédit Faraja. Mariée à un homme d’affaire, elle est  mère  de 11 enfants qui vont tous à l’école. Elle effectue les activités de commerce depuis 2003. Agée de 42 ans, elle sollicite un crédit pour acheter 1 sac de 50kgs des souliers usagés  et des cartables pour enfant. Elle projette construire une maison, agrandir son entreprise et assurer la scolarité de ses enfants. Au final, elle rend grâce à Dieu et bénie Hekima de soutenir les femmes  à bas revenu.
texts.en:
Mrs. Furaha, age 42, is the president of the Faraja credit association. Her husband is a businessman, and she is the mother of 11 children who all go to school. She started her commercial activity in 2003. She is seeking a loan to buy one 50-kg sack of used shoes and some binders for schoolchildren. 

Her goals are to build a house, expand her business, and support her children’s education. 

She wishes to give thanks to God and bless Hekima for supporting low-income women.

loans.use: to buy one 50-kg sack of used shoes and some binders for schoolchildren.

loans.name: Lera

texts.en:
Lera is 34-years-old and married with three children.

Lera works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Lera has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from fish vending.

Lera aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 28years old and a single mother. She has 1 child. She deals in agriculture as the main source of income and runs an agro input shop as another source of income. She started this business to help her minimize the expenses when buying the chemicals for the coffee plantation. Since she began this business, she has started harvesting 8 to 10 bags of coffee. She has requested for a loan of 3,000,000 UGX to help her add organic manure to her coffee plantation. This will improve the quality of her yields and increase sales.
 
he hopes to construct a permanent shelter for herself and child and to educate him. A challenge she sometimes faces is that thieves steal her coffee after she has invested in the crop.

loans.use: To buy organic manure

loans.name: Ayida

texts.ru: Айида, 45 лет, не замужем, есть ребенок. У Айиды - высшее образование. По характеру Айида очень ответственная, общительная, жизнерадостная. С 1996 года занимается животноводством, начав с покупки скота на 500 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Айиды, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы и 20 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS) от реализации молока, мяса и скота. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Айида обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум"  за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на покупку племенных овец, часть средств будет затрачена на приобретение коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Айида планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины и хочет накопить средства на покупку, необходимого для учебы, компьютера для сына.
texts.en: Ayida is 45 years old, unmarried, and has a child. Ayida has a higher education. Ayida is very responsible, gregarious, and joyful by nature. She has been practicing livestock breeding since 1996. She started this business with an initial purchase of cattle in the amount of 500 som (KGS). Thanks to Ayida's hard work, she currently has 2 milk cows and 20 sheep on her farm. Her monthly income is 10,000 som (KGS) from the sale of milk, meat, and cattle. For the purpose of further developing her business, Ayida requested a loan from Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum" in the amount of 60,000 som (KGS) to buy pedigree sheep. A portion of the loan will also be spent on buying cows to increase the size of her herd. Ayida plans on investing the earnings from the loan in the further acquisition of livestock. She also wants to save money to buy a computer for her son, which is necessary for his studies.

loans.use: to buy sheep.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase agricultural supplies to care for her coffee crops in the new season.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice, a 49-year old mother of six who describes herself as focused, has a farm where she keeps dairy cows to produce milk for sale. In business for three years, her farm is located in a good market area, and her primary customers are both men and women. Her biggest challenges are crop pests and inadequate rain. 

Beatrice is now requesting her first loan with SMEP DTM  for Kes 20,000 to buy more dairy cows. Her business goal is to be a supplier of farm products within five years, and she hopes that in the future, she will have an improved life.

loans.use: to buy more dairy cows

loans.name: Francis F.'s Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT) is very pleased to present to you this group of teachers from Grafton, on the outskirts of Freetown, Sierra Leone's capital city. With the help of this loan, this group of teachers will be able to buy or invest in things that their mere salaries alone cannot let them do. And at the end of each month, they will repay the loan using their monthly salaries. Their school’s bursar is directly responsible for making the deductions and the repayments on their behalf. 

Francis is the featured leader of this group. The 58-year-old was born in the town of Kailahun. He is married to a housewife and the couple has four children. Francis, who has been a professional school teacher for 38 years, has requested this loan in order to buy house-building materials like cement and iron corrugated zinc in order to complete the house building project he has begun.

loans.use: to buy house-building materials like cement and iron corrugated zinc

loans.name: Leoncia

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Leoncia works hard to support her family.

She has a tricycle transportation business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Leoncia is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy spare parts for her tricycle transportation business.

Leoncia has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her tricycle.

loans.name: Elzbieta

texts.en:
As a married mother of eight children, Elzbieta works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Elzbieta is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to customers.

Elzbieta has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Ryskul

texts.ru: Рыскул 53 года, вдова, мать 5 детей, дети взрослые и живут отдельно, младший сын- студент, он активно помогает матери по хозяйству. У Рыскул среднее образование, она имеет очень хорошие отзывы, как о доброй и трудолюбивой женщине. Рыскул в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, с 1990 года занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с 500 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Рыскул, она смогла развить свое хозяйство до: 1 дойной коровы, 2 телят, 8 овец, 10 коз и 1 лошади. Ее деятельность приносит около 14,000 сом (KGS) в месяц, что служит основой для покрытия расходов на питание и бытовые нужды семьи. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Рыскул обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров.  Доходы от кредита Рыскул планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего бизнеса, а также в будущем хочет купить дом своему сыну.
texts.en: Ryskul is 53 years old, a widow and a mother to five children. All of her children are grown-up and live separately. Her youngest son is a student. He actively helps his mother with her farming. Ryskul has a secondary education. She has a good reputation as a kind and hardworking woman. As the main source of income for her family, Ryskul practices livestock breeding. She started this business in 1990 with 500 som (KGS). Thanks to Ryskul's hardwork, she has been able to develop her farm to include 1 milk cow, 2 calves, 8 sheep, 10 goats and 1 horse. Her business brings in about 14,000 som (KGS) per month, which primarily serves to cover her family's food expenses and daily living needs. For the purpose of the further development of her business, Ryskul turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 70,000 som (KGS) to buy cows. Ryskul plants to invest the earnings from the loan in the further expansion of her business. She also wants to buy a house for her son in the future.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Zoya

texts.en:
Zoya lives in Karnut village with her husband, three children, parents-in-law and brother-in-law. 
This big family runs a farm. They keep livestock (cows, calves and chickens) as well as cultivate different types of fruit trees and vegetables.
Zoya has requested this loan of USD 2000 to purchase seeds, fertilizer and fuel for land cultivation. The loan is very important for Zoya and her family to continue developing their farm further.

loans.use: to pay for seed, fertilizer and fuel for land cultivation

loans.name: Jesusima

texts.en:
Jesusima is a 49-year-old married mother of seven children. Three of her children are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Jesusima has a repair shop business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for seven years. Jesusima requested an 11,000 Philippine peso loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) to buy new equipment for her repair shop. In the future, Jesusima would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy new equipment for her repair shop.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a married man. He has four children. He describes himself as trustworthy. He operates a construction business building houses. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a business-friendly area, and his primary customers are local residents.

James describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of sufficient working capital. He will use this 20,000 Kenyan shilling loan to buy more construction tools. His business goal is to be prosperous within 5 years. This is his first loan with SMEP - Deposit Taking Microfinance Limited.

loans.use: to buy more construction tools for his business building houses

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a married woman who has five children. She describes herself to be trustworthy. She operates a grocery store where she sells vegetable and fruits. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a business friendly area, and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of sufficient working capital. She will use the KES 10,000 loan to buy more stocks of vegetables and fruits. Her business goal is to be prosperous within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of vegetables and fruits.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles is a married man. He describes himself as optimistic. For the past 5 years, Charles has operated a retail business selling shoes. His business is located in a populated place and his primary clientele are regular customers. Charles describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of shoes. He will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for his child.

loans.use: to buy more stock of shoes

loans.name: Benard

texts.en: Benard is a  Kiva borrower who describes himself as determined. For the past 3 years, Benard has operated a retail business selling shoes. His business is located in a populated place and his primary customers are frequent. Benard describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of shoes. Benard's business goal is to open a boutique within 5 years. He hopes that, in the future, he will have frequent cash flow. Benard will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for his child.

loans.use: to buy more stock of shoes

loans.name: Vaneza

texts.en: Vaneza is 34 years old, married, and has five children. Four of them are in school. Vaneza is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Vaneza has been raising pigs for two years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Vaneza would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is 26 years old, married, and has three children, two of whom are in school. She works very hard to provide for them. 

For five years now, Marissa has run a general store in the Philippines selling a variety of items such as eggs, noodles, canned goods and other groceries. She has requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell. 

In the future, Marissa would like to save enough money to expand her enterprise and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is 27 years old. She is married with two children. She sells various items in her boutique and has been running the business for the past three years.  With the loan, she would like to buy more retail items to sell such as soaps, utensils and salts. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the business.

loans.use: to buy more retail items such as soaps, utensils, and salts to sell.

loans.name: Elnora

texts.en: Elnora, 37 years old, is a married mother of three children who are all in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. For the past 10 years, Elnora has operated a beauty salon business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy new supplies for her beauty salon. Elnora would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy new supplies for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Nancy is a 27-year-old, married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be focused. She operates a beauty salon where she offers hair treatment services. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a vibrant location and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy a hair dryer.  She hopes that in the future, she will own a beauty spa. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a hair dryer.

loans.name: Nidia De Fatima

texts.es:
Nidia de 52 años de edad, madres soltera con un hijo menor es cual está estudiando, es originaria del Sauce, lugar que se caracteriza por ser una zona productora de Leche y cuajada. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudo cursar una carrera y se vio obligada a trabajar desde temprana edad para ayudar con los gastos del hogar. En la actualidad lucha día a día para brindarle un futuro mejor a su hijo.
Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante, tiene por actividad economica la venta de piñatas elaboradas por ella misma, el negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitacion. ella dedica a su negocio unas diez horas diarias ofreciendo su producto. El objetivo del credito es comprar material para elaborar las piñatas como: papelillos, pega, cintas, papel crepe, papel periodico, catulina, goma, cintas,para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Nidia agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y paises pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Nidia, age 52, is a single mother with a young child who is in school. She is from el Sauce, an area which produces milk and curds. Unfortunately, due to a lack of economic resources, she was not able to go to university and was obliged to work from a young age in order to help with the household costs. She currently works day in, day out to offer her child a better future.
Thanks to her hard work and desire to get ahead, she has a business. She makes and sells piñatas. Her business is located in her home, and she works ten hours per day. 
She will use this loan to purchase material for making piñatas, such as: tissue paper, glue, tape, crepe paper, newspaper, cardboard, and rubber bands. This is so that, in the near future, she will be able to make a better income.
Nidia is grateful for the help that the Kiva lenders provide to people with scarce resources and in poor countries such as Nicaragua so that they can have dignified jobs.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of material to make piñatas, such as tissue paper, glue, tape, crepe paper, newspaper, cardboard, and rubber bands.

loans.name: Nelson Noe

texts.es: Nelson de 52 años de edad, el se dedica a la agricultura y a la crianza de ganado bovino, sus principales siembras son el maíz y frijol, comercializa sus productos en los alrededores de la zona, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra cubrir algunos gastos de su hogar, vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, Nelson está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra la fotografía y así poder continuar con sus siembras ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y así darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Nelson, age 52, works in agriculture and raises cattle. His main crops are corn and beans.  He sells his products in the areas around his neighbourhood. With his profits, he is able to cover some household costs. He lives in his own home with his family. Nelson is requesting a loan for the purchase of seeds, fertilizer, manure, pesticides, etc., and to improve the land shown in the photo. This way, he will be able to continue to plant, since this is his only source of work. This is how he will give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, manure, pesticides, etc, and to improve his land.

loans.name: Amina Group

texts.fr: La cliente Elise est une brave commerçante, présidente et membre d’une plateforme d’affaires «Amina», senior entrepreneur, dynamique, âgée de 42 ans, mariée et mère de 9 enfants, dont 5 étudient et 4 autres n’ont pas encore débité les études. La cliente est vendeuse de la boisson locale. Elle installe sa marchandise à domicile sur l’avenue de route  secondaire de la ville. Elle commença ses affaires avec le premier capital reçu de son mari. Plus tard, elle bénéficia le prêt de l’IMF Hekima. Il y a 24 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Son conjoint est nutritionniste. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 2 sacs de sorghos, 1 sac de maïs, les déchets de manioc, et le blé. Ainsi, elle souhaite, scolariser, vêtir et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des petits entrepreneurs exclus du système bancaire classique, surtout; pendant ce moment difficile post conflits dans la région de l’Est du pays.
texts.en:
Elise, age 42, is a brave merchant, and a member of the business group Amina, of which she is also president. A dynamic woman and senior entrepreneur, she is married to a nutritionist and they have 9 children, 5 of whom go to school. The other 4 have not yet started their formal education. Elise sells a local beverage. She works from her home on a secondary street of the city. She started her business with funds given to her by her husband, and later availed herself of Hekima’s financial support. She has been conducting this activity for 24 years.  

This new loan will help her to buy 2 sacks of sorghum, 1 sack of maize, cassava scraps, and some wheat. 

Her goal is to ensure that her children are fed, clothed and educated. 

She wishes to thank Hekima for offering micro-financing to small entrepreneurs who cannot use the traditional banking system, especially in these post-war times in the Eastern region.

loans.use: to buy 2 sacks of sorghum, 1 sack of maize, cassava scraps, and some wheat.

loans.name: La Préférence Group

texts.fr: La cliente Kahemwa est une commerçante et présidente de la banque communautaire «La Préférence», entrepreneur expérimentée, dynamique, âgée de 35 ans et mère de 5 enfants qui tous étudient. La cliente est une vendeuse des denrées alimentaires. Elle installe ses marchandises à son domicile tout au long de la rue dans un quartier  animé. Elle commença ses affaires avec de fonds reçu de son beau père. Son conjoint est un militaire de l’armée loyaliste. Plus tard, elle bénéficia le prêt de l’IMF Hekima. Il y a plus 11 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 2 sacs de patates douces, des bananes et de farine de manioc, poissons haricots et braise. Ainsi, elle souhaite construire une maison, scolariser, vêtir et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs non bancables, surtout; pendant ce moment critique de guerre à l’Est du pays.
texts.en:
The client, Kahemwa, is a saleswoman and the president of the community bank, "La Préférence." A dynamic and experienced entrepreneur, she is 35 years old and has five children who all go to school. 

The client sells food staples. She displays her goods at her home along the street of an animated neighborhood. She started her business with funds from her father-in-law. Her spouse is a soldier in the loyalist army. 

Later on, she received a loan from IMF Hekima. She has been running her business for 11 years. This new loan will help her buy two sacks of sweet potatoes, bananas, cassava root flour, fish, beans, and charcoal. 

She would like to build a house and educate, clothe, and feed her children. In the end, she thanks Hekima strongly for the empowerment of female entrepreneurs not served by the banking system - especially in this critical time of war in the east of the country.

loans.use: buy two sacks of sweet potatoes, bananas, cassava root flower, fish, beans, and charcoal.

loans.name: Edith

texts.es: La señora Edith tiene 36 años tiene tres hijos de las edades de 2, 12 y 17 años, ella se dedica a fabricación y venta de muebles ella fabrica mesas y sillas, tiene una tienda donde ofrece sus muebles que se  encuentra en la zona de el Porvenir, este préstamo es el primero que tiene con la institución, la señora Edith va a usar este préstamo para compra de madera para fabricación de sillas y mesas, ya que existe demanda de los mismos su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la cliente requiere el monto de dinero ya que existe demanda de los mismos,  la señora Edith enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la cliente tiene competencia por inmediaciones a su negocio en cuanto a los muebles y  va a utilizar los beneficios capitalizando sus utilidades la señora Edith tiene un gran deseo de llegar a tener una mueblería grande donde pueda exponer variedad de muebles.
texts.en:
Edith is 36 and has three children ages 2, 12, and 17. She makes and sells furniture; she makes tables and chairs. She has a store where she offers her furniture, located in the El Porvenir zone. This loan is her first with the institution. Edith will use it to purchase wood for making tables and chairs, since there is demand for these. She is requesting this loan because she needs money to supply the demand.
Edith confronts challenges in her business: she has competition from neighbours.
She will benefit from her income. Edith has a great desire to have a large furniture store where she can exhibit a variety of furniture.

loans.use: to buy wood for making furniture (tables and chairs).

loans.name: Mukulumanya Group

texts.fr: La cliente Mulonda est  une femme entrepreneur, présidente de l’association de crédit Mukulumanya. Elle est âgée de 52 ans, mère de 10 enfants et mariée à un homme plongé aussi dans le petit commerce. Elle sollicite ce nouveau crédit pour acheter  20 souliers usagés et  10 pagnes. Elle souhaite améliorer son habitat et  scolariser ses enfants jusqu’au niveau universitaire. Elle remercie Hekima de faciliter l’accès au crédit aux femmes à faible revenu.
texts.en: Mulonda, the borrower, is a woman entrepreneur and the president of the Mukulumanya loan association.  She is 52 years old and the mother of ten children.  She is married to a man who is also actively involved in retail business.  She is requesting this new loan to buy 20 pairs of used shoes and 10 "pagnes" (colorful African fabrics).  She would like to improve her living conditions and educate her children up to the university level.  She thanks Hekima for making it easier for poor women to have access to loans.

loans.use: to buy 20 pairs of used shoes and 10 "pagnes".

loans.name: Ainagul

texts.ru: Айнагул 44 года, замужем, есть ребенок. У Айнагул среднее образование. Она целеустремленная, спокойная, уравновешенная и трудолюбивая. В качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи, Айнагул уже много лет занимается животноводством. Начав этот бизнес в 1993 году с покупки скота, благодаря упорному труду, в хозяйстве Айнагул имеется: 2 дойные коровы и 10 овец. Ее деятельность приносит около 10,000 сом (KGS) в месяц, от продажи молока, молочной продукции, мяса и скота. Для содержания скота есть все условия, на летний период скот выводится на джайлоо. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Айнагул обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего хозяйства, а именно приобретение племенных овец. Также, в будущем хочет накопить средства на строительство жилого дома для своей семьи.
texts.en: Ainagul is 44 years old, married and has a child. Ainagul has a secondary education. She is goal-driven, calm, level-headed and hardworking. As an additional source of income for her family, Ainagul has been practicing animal breeding for many years. She started this business in 1993 with a purchase of cattle. Thanks to Ainagul's hard work, she currently has 2 milk cows and 10 sheep on her farm. Her business brings in about 10,000 som (KGS) per month from the sale of milk, dairy products, meat and cattle. She has all of the necessary conditions to house cattle. In the summertime, her cattle are brought out to pasture. For the purpose of the further development of her business, Ainagul turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 40,000 som (KGS) to buy cows. She plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further expansion of her farm, specifically to buy thoroughbred sheep. She also plans to save money to build a house for her family in the future.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials such as: sand, bricks, cement, and iron, and to pay the labourers.

loans.name: Mujeres Al Poder Group

texts.es: Esta es la Alcancía “Mujeres Al Poder” y está conformada por 07 mujeres emprendedoras dispuestas a comenzar a trabajar. María de 33 años  es soltera. Ella se dedica a la venta de calzados. Gracias a su constante dedicación su negocio le va bien cada día. Su último crédito lo destinará para la compra de zapatillas, botines y zapatos de vestir. El deseo de María es seguir creciendo en su negocio. El grupo “Mujeres Al Poder” agradece a las personas que hicieron posible éste crédito. María se encuentra de pie en la parte posterior, es la segunda del lado izquierdo y viste polo amarillo.
texts.en:
This is the “Mujeres Al Poder” ["Women to Power"] communal bank. It is made up of 7 enterprising women who are ready to get to work. María, age 33, is single. She sells shoes. Thanks to her constant dedication to her business, it is going well for her every day. 
She used her last loan for the purchase of high-heel shoes, ankle boots, and dress shoes. María wants to continue to expand her business. The “Mujeres Al Poder” group is grateful to those who will make this loan possible. María is photographed standing in the back. She is second on the left, wearing the yellow shirt.

loans.use:
to purchase high-heel shoes, ankle boots,
and dress shoes.

loans.name: Ryskul

texts.ru: Рыскул 48 лет, вдова, 3 детей. У Рыскул средне-специальное образование. Она ответственна, целеустремленна, и доброжелательна. Дети активно помогают по хозяйству. Семья очень дружная, отношения в семье очень хорошие. Рыскул в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, с 1997 года занимается розничной торговлей потребительских товаров, начав этот бизнес с 2,500 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Рыскул, она смогла добиться высоких результатов в своей деятельности, ее прибыль в месяц составляет в среднем 12,000 сом (KGS). Доходы от бизнеса позволили Рыскул вырастить и обучить детей. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом на покупку мыло моющих средств для увеличения товарооборота, это позволит ей развить ее деятельность, увеличить прибыль и накопить средства на свадьбу дочери.
texts.en: Ryskul is a 48-year-old widow with 3 children.  She has the equivalent of a high school education with vocational training, and is a responsible, goal-oriented and good-natured woman.  Her family is closely-knit; her children get along well with each other and their mother, and are enthusiastic when helping with chores.  Ryskul sells goods from a shop for a living, first starting her business in 1997 with 2,500 som.  Thanks to her persistence, she's had her share of success with her shop; her monthly income is now nearly 12,000 som, and she's been able to provide for her children and fund their education.  To further develop her business, Ryskul is seeking a loan from Bai-Tushum & Partners to stock up on various kinds of soap and detergent to sell at her shop.  This will allow her to increase her income and set aside money for her daughter's wedding.

loans.use: buy detergent

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fish wholesale.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a tricycle transportation business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 29,000 Philippines Pesos (PHP) through NWTF in order to buy spare parts for her tricycle transportation business.

Lucia has been in this business for twenty-five years. Lucia earns more income from fishing.

Lucia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her tricycle.

loans.name: Ufundi Group

texts.fr: Madame Munyerenkana présidente de la micro entreprise Ufundi est une femme forte,courageuse et ambitieuse. Commerçante depuis 1999 ; âgée de 48 ans ; elle est mariée à un homme d’affaire et ensemble ils ont  10 enfants qui vont tous à l’école. Elle sollicite un nouveau  prêt pour lui permettre d’acheter 10casiers de fanta et 10casiers de primus.  Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima de tout cœur de lui permettre d’accroitre son activité et prie Dieu de le bénir.
texts.en: Munyerenkana, president of the Ufundi micro-enterprise, is a strong, courageous and ambitious woman.  She is 48 years old and has been working in retail since 1999.  She is married to a businessman with whom she has 10 children who all go to school.  She is requesting a new loan which will allow her to buy 10 crates of Fanta (a soft drink) and 10 crates of Primus (a beer).  She wholeheartedly thanks Hekima for helping her to expand her activity, and she asks God to bless the organization.

loans.use: to buy ten crates of Fanta  and 10 crates of Primus.

loans.name: Raul Antonio

texts.es: Raul tiene 50 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su grupo familiar. Raul es albañil y es así como se gana la vida y apoya con la economía de su hogar. Raul y su familia habitan en condiciones muy humildes y ha dado inicio a la reparación de las paredes de su vivienda las cuales con el tiempo se han deteriorado y desea repararlas lo antes posible. Raul solicita este crédito a FUSAI dado que no logra cubrir el total de los gastos con sus ingresos. Con el monto solicitado comprará ladrillo, cemento, arena y hierro.
texts.en: Raul is 50 years old and lives in his own house with his family. Raul is a builder and, through this work, earns a living and supports his household. Raul and his family live in very humble conditions. Raul has started to repair the walls in his home which, over time, have deteriorated. He wants to repair them as quickly as possible and, as he is unable to cover the costs of this work with his income, has applied for this loan from "FUSAI". This loan will be used to buy bricks, cement, sand and iron.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, sand and iron to repair the walls in his house.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy bowls and dishes in large quantities to add to her business

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: Jose de 34 años vive con su grupo familiar, el se dedica desde hace 10 años a la agricultura siembra maíz y frijol, adicional a eso tambe trabaja como albañil, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar los gastos que se le presentan en su casa, Jose está solicitando un crédito para la compra de insumos agrícolas como: abonos, controles de plagas, fertilizantes,  semillas, herbicidas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que es el que muestra la fotografía y poder continuar con sus siembras y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Jose is 34 years old and lives with his family. For ten years Jose has worked in farming sowing corn and beans. In addition he works as a builder. With the money that he earns from his work, Jose is able to cover household costs. Jose is applying for a loan in order to buy farming supplies such as manure, anti-disease chemicals, fertilisers, seeds, weed-killers and more, and to improve his land (shown in the photo). Jose will continue with his crops and give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy manure, anti-disease chemicals, fertilisers, seeds, weed-killers and more, and to improve his land.

loans.name: Isaias

texts.es: El señor Isaías,  tiene 27 años de edad, es casado y tiene 1 hijo que aun depende de sus ingresos, vive en una comunidad alejada, es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable; por las lluvias presentadas en esta gestión y  el caudal de las aguas del rio que colapsaron a sus sembradios perdió parte de sus cosechas. Por los fenómenos  climatológicos mencionados sufrió una disminución de sus ingresos económicos afectando directamente su poder de adquisición de materiales e insumos requeridos para la producción y también para la canasta familiar. El señor es una persona que quiere salir adelante con su propio esfuerzo, vive con su conyugue en su propia casa que recién está construida. Actualmente solicita un crédito para la compra de insumos agrícolas: semillas de papa, de arveja y otros insumos para la producción, con el objetivo de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y retomar el camino hacia la prosperidad.
texts.en: Isaías is 27 years old, married and has one son who depends on his income. Isaías lives in a remote community and is a very hard-working and responsible person. Because of the rains this season, the river flooded and caused Isaías to lose part of his harvest. Due to these weather problems, Isaías suffered a decrease in his income, affecting his buying power for materials and supplies that he needs for his work, and for supporting his family. Isaías wants to get ahead through his own effort. He lives with his wife in a house that he owns and that was recently built. Isaías is applying for a loan in order to buy farming supplies, such as potato and chick pea seeds. He is applying for this loan with the aim of improving his family's quality of life and to begin again on a path towards prosperity.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies, such as potato and chick pea seeds.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El cliente de 27 años de edad  vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hijo, el posee un taller de estructuras metálicas, elabora puertas, balcones, rejas entre otros, tiene varios años de dedicarse a este negocio y tiene mucha experiencia que le ayuda a mejorar cada día su labor, hasta ahora el negocio le ha dado muy buenos resultados ya se hizo de mucha clientela pues lo buscan por la calidad de su trabajo, por los precios accesibles pero sobre todo porque siempre realiza el trabajo al gusto del cliente; el cliente es un hombre muy trabajador, honesto y sobre todo humilde, quiere hacer crecer el negocio pero necesita de capital para compra de material por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar hierro, metal, herramienta etc. está seguro que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez llevar a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
This borrower is 27 years old and lives in his own house with his wife and son. The borrower has a workshop where he builds metal structures, such as doors, balconies, bars and more. He has had this business for a number of years and has a lot of experience, helping him to improve on his work every day. So far the business has been very successful and the borrower has many customers who come to him because of the good quality of his work, the affordable prices and, above all, because he does the work according to customers' needs. This borrower is very hard-working, honest and, particularly, humble. He wants to expand his business but needs capital to buy materials. For this reason he has come to "Apoyo Integral" for a loan that will allow him 
to buy iron, other metals, tools and more. The borrower is sure that he will be able to pay off his loan and, at the same time, offer his household more financial security.

loans.use: to buy iron, other metals, tools and more.

loans.name: Leonidas

texts.es: Leónidas de 63 años de edad se dedica desde hace 40 años a la agricultura principalmente a la siembra de maíz, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia, don Leónidas vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hija, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra la fotografía y así continuar con sus siembras y darle a su familia una mejora calidad de vida.
texts.en: Leónidas is 63 years old and, for 40 years, has been farming, mainly growing corn. He sells his products at the local markets. Leónidas lives in his own house with his wife and daughter. He is applying for this loan in order  to buy seeds, fertilisers, manure, anti-disease treatments, weed-killers and more; and to improve his land (shown in the photo). With this loan he will continue to grow his crops and can give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilisers, manure, anti-disease treatments, weed-killers and more; and to improve his land.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en: Jennifer is 34 years old and single. For the past 5 years, she has been in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Jennifer has requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She has previously borrowed five times from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, Jennifer would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Abigaël Group

texts.fr: La Cliente Mbombo est une brave commerçante, dynamique, entrepreneur depuis 16 ans, présidente et membre d’une Association d’Affaires «Abigaël», âgée de 58 ans, mariée et mère de 4 enfants, qui tous scolarisés. Elle est vendeuse de stand d’alimentation. Elle étale ses activités à domicile dans une avenue mouvementée de la place. Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre son activité. Elle va acheter 7 paniers de manioc crus. Son conjoint est un chauffeur de véhicules poids lourd. Elle bénéficia son premier capital de son ami. Dans l’avenir, elle souhaite accroitre son capital, scolariser, vêtir et nourrir ses enfants. Elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien aux femmes entrepreneurs non bancables, en leur accordant de crédit sans garantie matérielle, pendant, ce moment de conflits dans la région de l’Est du pays.
texts.en:
The client, Mbombo, is a brave and dynamic saleswoman who has been an entrepreneur for 16 years. She is the president and a member of the "Abigaël" business association. She is 58 years old and has four children who all went to school. 

She works at a food stand and displays her goods at her home on a lively street on the main square. She is asking for a loan from Hekima to grow her business. She will buy seven baskets of raw cassava root. Her spouse is a truck driver. She received her first funds from her friend. In the future, she would like to grow her business and educate, clothe, and feed her children. 

She thanks Hekima for their support of female entrepreneurs not served by the banking system and for the loans they offer without any material guarantee during this period of conflict in the eastern region of the country.

loans.use: buy seven baskets of raw cassava root.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bracelets, earrings, rings and shoes

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es: Francisca de 63 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella posee una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia, tiene mucha clientela por la variedad de productos y los buenos precios, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas y con la ayuda de su esposo logran salir adelante con los gastos que se les presentan en su hogar, francisca esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas mercadería por mayor como: sopas, granos básicos, aceites, golosinas, refrescos, etc. y asi obtener mejores ingresos y tener junto con su esposo una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Francisca is 63 years old and lives in her own house with her husband. Francisca has a small shop in her home. She has many customers because of the variety of products that she sells, and the affordable prices. Francisca's earnings and the help of her husband allows her to cover household costs. Francisca is applying for this loan in order to buy more merchandise in bulk. She will buy soaps, basic grains, oil, sweets, soft drinks and more. This will result in a higher income and, with her husband, she can have a higher quality of life.

loans.use: to buy soaps, basic grains, oil, sweets, soft drinks and more in bulk.

loans.name: Dina Margarita

texts.es: Dina de 44 años de edad se dedica desde hace 18 años a la venta y producción de lácteos como es  queso y crema, comercializa en los alrededores de la zona donde ella reside, posee mucha clientela por la calidad y los buenos precios, Dina vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida y sus cuatro hijos, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de leche por mayor para seguir produciendo mas lácteos y así generar mejores ingresos para tener junto con su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Dina is 44 years old and, for 18 years, has made a living producing and selling dairy products, such as cheese and cream. Dina sells her goods in the area surrounding her home. She has many customers because of the quality of her goods, and the good prices. Dina lives in her own home with her partner and their four children. She is applying for a loan in order to buy milk in bulk to continue producing more dairy products and earn a higher income. With this she can enjoy a higher quality of life with her family.

loans.use: to buy milk in bulk.

loans.name: Debbie

texts.en:
Debbie, 37 years old, is married and has eight children. She works hard to provide for her family. Debbie has been running a general store in the Philippines for five years and also earns an income from raising pigs. She has requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell. 

Debbie has previously borrowed and repaid eight loans from NWTF. She aspires to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell..

loans.name: Carlos Alfredo

texts.es: Carlos de 42 años de edad se dedica desde hace varios años al cultivo de maíz y frijol, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia, vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía y asi darle a su familia lo que necesita sin limitación alguna.
texts.en: Carlos is 42 years old and, for a number of years, has made a living growing corn and beans. He sells his products in the different local markets. Carlos lives in a house that he owns with his family. He is applying for a loan in order to buy seeds, fertilisers, manure, anti-disease treatments, weed-killers and other supplies; and to improve his land (shown in the photograph). With this loan he can give his family everything that they need.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilisers, manure, anti-disease treatments, weed-killers and other supplies; and to improve his land.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita, 63 years old, is married and has four children. She works hard to provide for her family. Anita has been running a general store in the Philippines for 15 years and also earns an income from food vending. She has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more goods to sell in her store.

Anita has previously borrowed and repaid twenty-one loans from NWTF. She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell in her store.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy baskets of dried fish to add to her current stock for sale

loans.name: Roberto Noe

texts.es: Roberto de 46 años de edad y su compañera de vida, viven en casa propia y han procreado dos hijos los cuales tienen 19 y 17 años de edad y actualmente está estudiando. Roberto se dedica a vender por la mañana pan frances y por la tarde pan dulce. Su compañera de vida es empleada en una reconocida fábrica laborando en el área de empaque. Roberto quiere mejorar su vivienda y ha solicitado un crédito a FUSAI para invertirlo en la compra de lámina galvanizada, clavos para reparar el techo de su vivienda. También comprará ladrillo de barro, cemento, arena para continuar levantando una pared divisoria. Roberto manifiesta que cumplirá con todas las cuotas que incurre este compromiso.
texts.en: Roberto is 46 years old and lives in a house that he owns with his wife. The couple has two children, aged 19 and 17 years old respectively; they are both studying. Roberto makes a living selling savoury bread in the morning, and sweet bread in the afternoon. His wife has a job in a well-known factory; she works in the packing department. Roberto wants to make improvements to his home and has applied for a loan from "FUSAI". He will invest this loan in galvanised laminate sheeting and nails to fix his roof; he will also buy mud bricks, cement and sand to continue building a dividing wall. Roberto tells us that he will make all of his repayments.

loans.use: to buy galvanised laminate sheeting and nails to fix his roof; and to buy mud bricks, cement and sand to continue building a dividing wall.

loans.name: Jose Raul

texts.es: Jose de 58 años de edad viven casa propia con su compañera de vida, desde hace 40 años se dedica a la agricultura su principal siembra es el maíz, esos años le han dado la experiencia necesaria para poder tener el mejor cultivo, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar los gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, Jose está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, y mejorar el terreno donde desea hacer la siembra que es el que muestra la fotografía y asi darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Jose is 58 years old and lives in the house that he owns with his life partner. For 40 years Jose has worked in farming, mainly growing corn. Over the years Jose has gained the necessary experience to grow the best crops. With the profit from his sales, Jose is able to cover household costs. Jose is applying for a loan in order to buy seeds, fertilisers, manure, anti-disease treatments, weed-killers and other supplies; and to improve his land (shown in the photograph). With this loan Jose can give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilisers, manure, anti-disease treatments, weed-killers and other supplies; and to improve his land.

loans.name: Monicah

texts.en:
Monicah is a married woman, and she has three children. She operates a farm where she keeps dairy cows which produce milk to sell. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a rural area and her primary customers are farmers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be animal diseases and a shortage of animal feed. 

Monicah will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy animal feed and animal medicine. Her business goal is to be a milk supplier within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be a milk supplier.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and animal medicine

loans.name: Sonia Marlene

texts.es: Sonia de 31 años de edad se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de productos de uso personal, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas y con la ayuda de su esposo logran solventar los gastos de su hogar vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hijo, la clienta desea acrecentar su negocio por eso solicita un crédito que le permita poder comprar todo lo necesario como: perfumes, esmaltes para uñas, desodorantes, cremas, lociones, etc. todo por mayor ya que tiene mucha clientela por dar sus productos a precios accesibles con la ayuda solicitada ella podrá obtener mejores ganancias y asi seguirá dándole a su familia lo que necesita sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
Sonia, age 31, sells all types of personal use products.  Her business is located at her house.  With what she earns from her sales, and with her husband’s help, they manage to pay for the household expenses.  She lives in her own house with her husband and her son.

She wishes to increase her business.  Therefore, she is requesting a loan that will allow her to be able to buy everything she needs like perfumes, nail polish, deodorants, creams, and lotions, etc.  She will buy everything wholesale.  She has a lot of clientele to give her products to at affordable prices.

With the requested help she will be able to get better earnings.  This way she will continue to give her family what it needs without any limitations.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, nail polish, deodorants, creams, and lotions, etc. wholesale.

loans.name: Rosenda

texts.en:
Rosenda earns an income from her gardening action. She is from Puntod, Plaridel, and has been gardening for more than six years, earning enough money to sustain her living expenses. She has successfully repaid her previous loan, which was used for garden fertilizer. She always finds ways to augment her earnings. 

Recently, Rosenda took a new loan to finance her flower production business. Rosenda plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to finance her flower production business

loans.name: Rocel

texts.en:
Rocel is 43 years old and married with three children, one of whom is in school. Rocel works very hard to provide for them.

Rocel runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Rocel has been in this business for twenty years and sells a variety of items such as bread, canned goods, rice and other groceries. 

In the future, Rocel would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a married woman, and she has three children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a farm where she keeps dairy cows, which produce milk to sell. She has been involved in this business for ten years. Her business is located in a fertile place and her primary customers are both large scale and small scale. She describes her biggest business challenge to be poor climactic conditions. 

Jane will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy seeds and manure. Her business goal is to do large scale farming within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy seeds and manure

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy charcoal in large quantity to add to her current stock

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy plastic bowls, spoons, cups, dishes, etc. wholesale to add to her business

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es: Alejandrina de 38 años de edad vive en casa propia junto a su esposo y sus tres  hijos, ella se dedica a la compra y venta de especies, posee mucha clientela que demanda sus productos, gracias a la calidad con que los comercializa, gracias a sus venta a logrado solventar muchos de sus gastos. Ella solicita un crédito para la compra de más mercadería relajo, pimienta, olor, achote, etc. por mayor y satisfacer la gran demanda que posee para poder darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Alejandrina, age 38, lives in her own house with her husband and their three children.  She buys and sells spices.  She has a lot of clientele who demand her products thanks to the quality that she sells.  Thanks to her sales, she has managed to pay for many of their expenses.

She is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise.  She will buy ‘relajo’ [Salvadorian spice mix], pepper, cloves, and annatto, etc.  She will buy these wholesale and satisfy the great demand that she has.  She will do this in order to be able to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy ‘relajo’ [Salvadorian spice mix], pepper, cloves, and annatto, etc.

loans.name: Rhulangane Group

texts.fr: Madame Namwezi  est une femme créative, d’une grande expérience et présidente du groupe de credit Rhulangane.  Agée de 47 ans, elle est  mariée à un homme d'affaire et mère de 7 enfants. Elle demande ce nouveau credit pour lui faciliter l'achat de 100kgs de farine. Son rêve est celui d'améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille et scolariser ses enfants jusqu'au niveau des études superieur.Ainsi,elle remercie Hekima de promouvoir les femmes pauvres économiquement actives.
texts.en: Madame Namwezi is a creative woman. She has a wealth of experience and is the president of the Rhulangane loan group.  She is 47 years old, the mother of seven children, and is married to a businessman. She is asking for a new loan to help her buy 100 kgs of flour. Her dream is to improve the life conditions of her family and to educate her children through high school. She would like to thank Hekima for promoting poor women who are economically active.

loans.use: buy 100 kilograms of flour.

loans.name: Akiba Group

texts.fr: La cliente Ntakobanjira est une commerçante et membre de l’association d’affaire «Akiba », entrepreneur expérimentée, dynamique, âgée de 43 ans, mariée et mère de 12 enfants, qui 6 étudient, 4 qui n'étudient plus et 2 qui sont encore gosses. La cliente est une vendeuse de la viande. Elle installe ses marchandises sur la rue des artères animées de la ville. Elle commença ses affaires avec l’assistance de son mari. Son conjoint est un plombier. Plus tard, elle bénéficia le prêt de l’IMF Hekima. Il y a 10 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 25 kg de viande. Ainsi, elle souhaite devenir grossiste, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs non bancables, surtout; pendant ce moment difficile post conflit dans la région de l’Est du pays.
texts.en:
The client, Ntakobanjira, is a saleswoman and a member of the "Akiba" business association. A dynamic and experienced entrepreneur, she is 43 and has 12 children - six of whom go to school, four of whom don't, and two of whom are too young. 

The client sells meat. She sells her goods on a lively main street in the city. She started her business with the help of her husband who is a plumber. Later on, she received a loan from IMF Hekima. She has been running her business for 10 years. 

This new loan will help her buy 25 kg of meat. She would like to become a wholesaler and to educate, clothe, and feed her children. In the end, she thanks Hekima for empowering female entrepreneurs not served by the banking system - especially in this difficult period of conflict in the eastern region of the country.

loans.use: buy 25 kg of meat.

loans.name: Lucrrecio

texts.en:
Lucrrecio is an organic certified Maya Mountain Cacao farmer who lives in the beautiful village of San Jose, in the Toledo District of Southern Belize. He has been a member of the MMC's Farmers Network for approximately 4 years. As an energetic and industrious young farmer, Lucrrecio desires to perform proper maintenance of his 3 acres of cacao trees. 

Lucrrecio was inspired to start this business because the revenue generated from his produce can better his lifestyle and enable him to send his children to school. He, therefore, wants to secure a loan to hire extra workers to help him with the cleaning of his farm.

loans.use: to clean three acres of producing cacao trees

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane, aged 37, is a hardworking and honest Ugandan woman living in Kagadi. She is married and has 4 children aged between 11 and 4 years, all attending school. Jane has been operating a pharmacy since 2002 and earning a government salary to add to her income. She hopes to grow her pharmacy into a well-stocked medical clinic. Jane's business challenges are competition and high license fees. Jane is requesting a loan to buy drugs to sell.

loans.use: to buy drugs to sell

loans.name: Peace

texts.en: Peace, 35 years old, is a single mother of three children, two of whom go to school. She has been in the transport business for four years. She is located in town and earns a salary as additional income. Peace started her business to get income for her family. She wants money to buy a motor vehicle. Peace hopes to have two more motor vehicles. Her main business challenges are accidents and poor roads.

loans.use: To pay for a motor vehicle

loans.name: Emprendedoras Con Cristo 1, 2, 3 & 4 Group

texts.en:
Rosiel is the coordinator of her group, Emprendedoras con Cristo (Entrepreneurs with Christ) 1, 2, 3 & 4. Her group is located in Puerto Plata. She makes her home in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their two children. This group is made up of twenty business-people developing businesses in their rural town. 

Rosiel is excited to be taking her first loan with Esperanza International Dominican Republic. She has her own business, which she started with a loan her father gave to her. She plans to use this loan to increase her inventory by buying miscellaneous products like cosmetics, shoes, clothes, etc. She will use the profits to save and reinvest in her business for her future plans.

Rosiel says her most difficult challenge is to have a successful business. In the meantime, she continues to enjoy selling. Her dreams are to work hard and move her business forward, and with the help of God, she will. She thanks all of you for your support!

loans.use: To buy miscellaneous products such as cosmetics, shoes, clothes, etc

loans.name: Anarhan

texts.ru: Анархан 54 года, вдова, 5 детей. Дети активно помогают по хозяйству. У Анархан - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи она занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав в 1994 году с 20,000 сом (KGS), благодаря целеустремленности и трудолюбию, на сегодняшний день у Анархан есть: 1 дойная корова, 32 овцы и 5 лошадей. Также имеется 1,90 ГА земельной доли, на которой она ежегодно выращивает фасоль и 2,00 ГА поливной земли, засеянной клевером и эспарцетом. Дополнительно Анархан реализует молоко. Ежемесячный совокупный доход составляет около 20,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Анархан обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) для закупки минеральных удобрений и ГСМ для орошения земли и улучшения ее качества. Анархан намерена увеличить поголовье скота и получить хороший урожай со своего участка, что непременно приведет к увеличению капитала семьи. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в свадьбу детей.
texts.en: Anarhan is a 54-year-old widow with 5 children who help her tend to the family farm.  She has the equivalent of a high school education and is a crop and cattle farmer by trade, first starting in 1994 with 20,000 som worth of capital.  She's intent on adding more livestock to her herds and increasing her harvests, which will serve to bolster her family's finances.  Thanks to her goal-oriented and hardworking nature, Anahan currently has a dairy cow, 32 sheep and 5 horses on her farm, as well as a 1.90-hectare plot of land for growing beans and a 2.00-hectare irrigated plot sown with clover and sainfoin.  In addition, she sells milk from her farm, and her monthly income is nearly 20,000 som.  To further develop her farm, Anarhan is seeking a loan of 50,000 som from Bai-Tushum & Partners to buy mineral fertilizers and petroleum products to help increase the quality of her soil as well as its irrigation.   She plans on using any profits due to the loan to pay for her children's weddings.

loans.use: buy fertilizer

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es: Teresa de 60 años de edad posee una tienda desde hace varios años ubicada en su lugar de residencia, tiene mucha clientela por la variedad de productos que comercializa y los buenos precios, vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hijo, Teresa está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas mercadería como: granos básicos, aceite, golosinas, refrescos, sopas, detergentes, jabones, etc. y asi continuar con su tienda que le genera buenas ganancias y poder tener junto con su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: 60-year-old Teresa has owned a shop for several years. It is located in her home and she has a large clientele due to the variety of products she sells and her good prices. She lives in her own house with her husband and child. Teresa is requesting a loan in order to buy more merchandise, such as staple grains, oil, candy, soft drinks, soup, detergent, and soap. In this way, she will continue with her business, which generates good profits, and be able to have a better quality of life with her family.

loans.use: to buy staple grains, oil, candy, soft drinks, soup, detergent, soap, etc

loans.name: Santos

texts.en: Santos is a new farmer who lives in the beautiful village of San Antonio in the Toledo District of Southern Belize. He is inspired by his father-in-law to start cacao farming and overall sees it as a good investment. He presently has 500 seedlings that need to be planted. Therefore, he wants to secure a loan from MMC to do this. He is further motivated to do farming because of the available market to sell his cacao, and besides that, the revenue that will be generated can further enable him to send his children to school.

loans.use: to plant 500 seedlings.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is a 58-year-old married mother with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Lolita has a gasoline retail business in the Philippines. Lolita requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more gallons of gasoline to offer for sale.

Lolita has been in this business for thirty years. In the future, Lolita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more gallons of gasoline to offer for sale

loans.name: Fuerza Divina 2 Group

texts.en:
Dania is one of the members of her group called Fuerza Divina (Divine Force) 2. This group is located in Hato Mayor, a rural town where the economy is based around agriculture. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her two children.

Dania sells underwear and clothes. She went into business using her savings, selling from her house. Now she is selling by walking and to wholesalers. Almost one year ago, she went to Esperanza and took out a loan that made it possible for her to invest a greater amount in her shop so she could earn more in profits. This is her second loan.

Dania is planning to use her portion of this 126,000 DOP loan to buy underwear, pants, t-shirts, etc. She will reinvest her profits to buy more products. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy underwear and clothes.

loans.name: Gennis Ivan

texts.es: Gennis de 33 años de edad vive en casa propia con su familia, desde hace varios años se dedica a la pesca artesanal y es así como ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia, cuenta con una lacha y algunas redes para pescar, Gennis es un hombre muy trabajador y responsable con su familia y es por esa razón que ha decido solicitar un crédito a INTEGRAL para poder comprar trasmayos y mas redes para continuar con su pesca ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo e ingresos y así poderle dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: 33-year-old Gennis lives in his own house with his family. He has been making a living from artisanal fishing for several years and it is how he has managed to look after his family. He has a boat and some nets for fishing. Gennis is a very hard-working man who acts responsibly towards his family, and it is for this reason that he has decided to request a loan from Apoyo Integral in order to buy trammels (three-layered dragnets) and more nets so he can continue fishing as it is his only source of work and income. In this way, he will be able to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy trammels and more nets

loans.name: Recelia

texts.en:
Recelia is 45 years old, married and has four children, two of whom attend school. 

Recelia is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Recelia requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Recelia has been raising pigs for twenty years now and has borrowed 17 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, Recelia would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna works hard to support her family. Myrna is a widow and has a tailoring business in the Philippines.

Myrna requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy new supplies for her sewing machine. Myrna has been in this business for thirty years.

In the future, Myrna would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy new supplies for her sewing machine.

loans.name: Liberato

texts.en: Liberato is an organic certified Maya Mountain Cacao farmer. He lives in Pueblo Viejo, in southern Belize, with his wife and nine children. Liberato has been working with Maya Mountain Cacao for a year, but has previous experience with cacao farming on his 2 acre farm, where he also plants coffee, rice, and corn. He is eager to receive a Kiva loan so that he might expand his farm, and work on cleaning and underbrushing to increase his harvest. Liberato hopes to use the fruits of his labor to support his children's education.

loans.use: to clean his cacao trees.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is 45 years old, married and has eight children, one of whom is in school. 

Lilibeth is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Lilibeth requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Lilibeth has been raising pigs for twenty years now, and has borrowed twenty-one times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Lilibeth would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is 47 years old and married with three children who are all in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  

Rosalie has a general store business in the Philippines. Rosalie requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more items such as soft-drinks, canned goods, noodles and other groceries.

Rosalie has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Rosalie would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items such as soft-drinks, canned goods, noodles and other groceries.

loans.name: Ameliza

texts.en:
Ameliza is 36 years old and married with one child. Ameliza works hard to provide for her family. 

Ameliza runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more grocery products to offer for sale.

Ameliza has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her general store for five years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Ameliza aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery products to offer for sale.

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en:
Cecelia has a rental shop where many people come to copy their paper work every day. She has been involving herself in business activities since 2002.

A $600 (USD) loan is offered to Cecilia to improve her business. She will buy some additional supplies such as paper, ink, rulers, and printers. She feels so comfortable to run her business because she can earn money every day.

Running a business has made Cecilia independent because she can be responsible for herself and also help her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy supplies such as paper, ink, rulers, and printers

loans.name: Thôn 7- Hoằng Hải Group

texts.en:
Hơn is 53 years old and she is married with three children. Hơn is the group leader of the Thôn 7- Hoằng Hải solidarity group, which consists of four members. Hơn lives in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

Mrs. Hơn has a manufacturing business making bricks. She is requesting a loan to invest in her business.

This is Hơn first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. Hơn has been involved in this business for more than ten years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Hơn hopes to remodel her house, to maintain a successful business, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more material to make bricks to sell

loans.name: 03 Đông Hải- Hoằng Thanh Group

texts.en:
For 6 years, Quế has operated a general store selling items like soap, cake, sweets, and milk.  She is requesting a loan to invest in her business.

Quế is 28 years old and she is married with 4 children.  She is the group leader of the 03 Đông Hải- Hoằng Thanh solidarity group, which consists of 5 members living in the Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in the Thanh Hoa province.

In 2010, Quế joined the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business.  Quế has successfully repaid 3 loans from the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  The main harship that Quế faces in her business is a lack of capital.

With her business profit, Quế hopes that her business will do well, that her children will do well in school, and that she makes enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase more goods like soap, cake, sweets, and milk to resell.

loans.name: 09 Đông Sơn Group

texts.en:
For 5 years, Nhàn has operated a food stall/restaurant selling fruit.  She is requesting a loan to invest in her business.

Nhàn is 37 years old and she is married with 2 children.  She is the leader of a 6-member group, the 09 Đông Sơn solidarity group. 
She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in the Thanh Hoa province.

In 2013, Nhàn joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business and has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  The main harship that Nhàn faces in her business is a lack of capital.

With her business profit, Nhàn hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits for resale.

loans.name: Mufariji Group

texts.fr: Madame Machozi  est  responsable de l’association de crédit Mufariji.  Femme d’une grande expérience, il ya  plus de 30 ans qu’elle commença  le petit commerce à partir de fonds  reçu de son mari.  Elle est âgée de 44 ans, mère de 10 enfants (3mariés, 7scolarisés) et mariée à un plombier.  Le credit demandé va lui permettre d’acheter 75 regimes de bananes  et  150 mesures d’haricot.  Elle ambitionne devenir une grande fournisseuse  de ces produits dans les milieux urbains et améliorer la scolarité des siens. Elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien aux femmes rurales.
texts.en: Ms. Machozi is the leader of the Mufariji loan association. A woman with great experience, it has been 30 years since she started her small business from the funds she received from her husband. She is 44 years old, the mother of 10 children (3 married, 7 in school) and married to a plumber. The loan she requested will allow her to buy 75 bunches of bananas and 150 measures of beans. She is striving to become a major supplier of these products in urban settings and to improve the education of her children. She would like to thank Hekima for their support to rural women.

loans.use: to purchase 75 bunches of bananas and 150 measures of beans.

loans.name: 010905 Đông Sơn Group

texts.en:
For 2 years, Lý has operated a food stall/restaurant selling fruit.  She is requesting a loan to invest in her business.
