Lý is 62 years old and she is married with 2 children.  She is the group leader of the 010905 Đông Sơn solidarity group, which consists of 4 members.  She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in the Thanh Hoa province, with no dependents.

This is Lý's first loan with the Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women.  The main harship that Lý faces in her business is a lack of capital.  With her business profit, Lý hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find good jobs.

loans.use: to purchase more fruit for resale.

loans.name: Mufariji 1 Group

texts.fr: Madame Bisimwa  secrétaire de l’association d’affaire Mufariji 1, est mariée à un chauffeur de taxi. Elle est âgée de 38 ans et mère de 5 enfants dont 1 n’a pas encore atteint l’âge de scolarité. Femme a grande vision, elle pratique le petit commerce il ya plus de 15 ans à partir de  fonds  reçu  de son mari. Elle sollicite un nouveau credit pour acheter 8 sacs de braise, 5 bidons d’huile de palme, 50 tiges de canne à sucre et  50 mesures d’haricot. Son vouloir est de renforcer  ses activités dans des produits divers. Elle remercie Hekima de soutenir  les femmes.
texts.en: Ms. Bisimwa, secretary of the Mufariji 1 business association, is married to a taxi driver. She is 38 years old and the mother of five children, of whom one has not yet reached school age. A woman with vision, she has run her small business for more than 15 years, which she started from funds she received from her husband. She is requesting a new loan to buy 8 bags of charcoal, 5 containers of palm oil, 50 stalks of sugar cane and 50 measures of beans. Her desire is to strengthen her business selling various products. She thanks Hekima for supporting women.

loans.use: to buy 8 bags of charcoal, 5 containers of palm oil, 50 stalks of sugar cane and 50 measures of beans.

loans.name: Hilda  Marina

texts.es: Hilda de 62 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hijo, ella posee una comedor ubicado en una zona muy transitada por esa razón posee mucha clientela, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar los gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, Hilda esta solicitando un crédito a INTEGRAL para poder comprar pollo, carnes, verduras, fruta, maíz, arroz, frijol, etc. todo por mayor para continuar con su negocio y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Hilda, who is 62 years old, lives in her own house with her husband and her son. She has a food stall located in a busy zone. For this reason, she has a lot of customers. With what she obtains from her sales, she manages to pay the expenses of her household. Hilda is applying to INTEGRAL for a loan to be able to buy chicken, meats, vegetables, fruit, corn, rice, beans, etc., all at wholesale, in order to continue with her business and give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy chicken, meats, vegetables, fruits, corn, rice, beans, etc., all at wholesale.

loans.name: 03 Đông Sơn Group

texts.en:
Thanh is applying for a loan to improve her business. She operates a food stall/restaurant selling vegetables.

Thanh is 62 years old and she is married with 2 children. Thanh is the group leader of the 03 Đông Sơn solidarity group, which consists of three members. She lives with no dependents in Thanh Hoa City, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Thanh's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. She has been involved in her business for five years, and one of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital. 

With her business profit, Thanh hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Sheria Group

texts.fr: La cliente Nabuke est une brave commerçante, secrétaire et membre d’une plateforme  d’affaires «Sheria», entrepreneur, dynamique, âgée de 51 ans, veuve et mère de 5 enfants, dont 2 étudient et 3 sont déjà mariés.   La cliente est vendeuse de maïs en graine. Elle installe sa marchandise à domicile sur l’avenue de la route  secondaire de la ville. Elle commença ses affaires avec le premier capital reçu deson mari, lors de son vivant. Plus tard, elle bénéficia le prêt de l’IMF Hekima. Il y a 5 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 12 sacs de maïs. Ainsi, elle souhaite accroitre son crédit, scolariser, vêtir et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmees entrepreneurs exclues du système bancaire classique, surtout; pendant ce moment difficile post conflits dans la région de l’Est du pays.
texts.en: The client Nabuke is a brave saleswoman, secretary and member of the Sheria business platform, entrepreneur, dynamic, 51 years old, widowed and the mother of 5 children, of whom 2 are in school and 3 are already married. The client is a saleswoman of corn from seed. She sets up her merchandise at home along the avenue of the secondary route from the city. She started her business with the first capital received from her husband, when he was still living. Later, she benefited from the Hekima international monetary fund. It's been 5 years that she has been running this business. This new loan will serve to buy twelve bags of corn. Thus, she wishes to increase her loan, and educate, clothe and feed her children. To finish, she would like to strongly thank Hekima for the empowerment of women entrepreneurs excluded from the traditional banking system, especially during this particularly difficult post-conflict time in the region to the east of the country.

loans.use: to purchase 12 bags of corn.

loans.name: Domingas

texts.en: Domingas is taking a loan of $600 to improve her business. She is married and has four children. She runs a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy rice, sleepers, cigarettes, soft drinks (Coca-Cola, Sprite, Sagiko and Fanta) and biscuits. Domingas opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of $200. She is a hardworking woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy rice, sleepers, cigarettes, soft drinks and biscuits.

loans.name: Epilina

texts.en: Epilina is taking a loan of $600 to improve her business. She is married and has two children. Epilina is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store such as rice, noodles, cigarettes, sugar, salt, milk, oils, coffee, eggs, Fanta, Sprite, Sagiko and slippers. She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of $300. Epilina is a hardworking woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy rice, noodles, cigarettes, sugar, salt, milk, oils, coffee, eggs, Fanta, Sprite, Sagiko and slippers.

loans.name: Ines

texts.en: Ines is taking a loan of $600 to improve her business. She runs a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. Ines will use the loan to buy a stock of items to keep in her store such as coconut oil. She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of $300. She is a hardworking woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy coconut oil.

loans.name: Gantsetseg

texts.en: Ms. Gantsetseg is 39 years old and lives with her husband and two daughters in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been selling children's clothes at a trade center since 2008. Before this business, she worked as an accountant at a private firm. Her husband has a job with a building company that temporarily stopped its operations and their daughters go to high school. Gantsetseg is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 MNT to buy a large quantity of children's clothes, so that she can generate a substantial income during the children's day festival.

loans.use: to buy children's clothes.

loans.name: Dorcas Group

texts.fr: Madame Nambula est présidente de l’association de credit Dorcas. Vendeuse dans un marché public du quartier, elle commença les activités de commerce depuis 2001 à partir de fonds reçu de son frère. Elle sollicite un nouveau credit pour lui permettre d’acheter 500kg de riz et 150 kg de manioc. Le plus grand obstacle qu’elle rencontre dans ses activités c’est la multiplicité des taxes. Qu’à cela ne tienne, son rêve est d’évoluer et devenir une grande commerçante de la place. Au finish,  Elle remercie Hekima et lui souhaite la prospérité dans ses activités.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nambula is the president of the Dorcas credit association. A retail merchant in a local market, she began business activities in 2001, using funds received from her brother.

She is requesting a new loan so she can buy 500 kilos of rice and 150 kilos of cassava. The biggest obstacle she faces in her activities is the multiplicity of taxes. 

Nevertheless, her dream is to evolve and become a major local merchant. In the end, she thanks Hekima and hopes to see its activities prosper.

loans.use: buy 500 kilos of rice and 150 kilos of cassava

loans.name: Edgar Osmin

texts.es: Edgar de 44 años de edad vive junto a su familia en casa propia, el se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol, tiene varios años de trabajar en la agricultura y eso le  ha regalado mucha experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas, ya tiene mucha clientela que lo prefieren por la calidad, los buenos precios y sobre todo por el buen servicio; Edgar necesita invertir en sus cultivos por eso solicita un crédito que le permita comprar semillas, insecticida, fertilizantes, abonos, herbicida, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía, Edgar tiene buenas referencias por parte de sus conocidos, y es muy responsable, asegura que podrá cancelar la deuda en el periodo establecido y a la vez confía que llevara a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en: Edgar, who is 44 years old, lives with his family in his own house. He grows corn and beans. He has worked in agriculture for a number of years, and this has given him a lot of experience, which allows him to obtain the best harvests. He already has many customers who prefer him for the quality [of his products], the good prices, and above all, for the good service. Edgar needs to invest in his crops, and for this reason he is applying for a loan that will allow him to buy seeds, insecticides, fertilizers, compost, herbicides, etc., and to improve his plot of land, which is shown in the photograph. Edgar has good references from the people who know him, and he is very responsible. He confirms that he will be able to pay off the debt in the established period and at the same time, he has confidence that he will bring economic security to his household.

loans.use: to buy seeds, insecticides, fertilizers, compost, herbicides, etc., and to improve his plot of land

loans.name: Tusonge Mbele Group

texts.fr: Madame Asina, femme courageuse et ambitieuse est trésorière de la micro entreprise Tusonge Mbele.  Elle est  âgée  de 53 ans, mère de 7 enfants tous empruntant le chemin de l’école et mariée à un agent de l’Etat Congolais. Vendeuse depuis 1997 au marché public de la place, elle sollicite ce nouveau prêt pour acheter  1sac  de farine de manioc de 100kg afin de pouvoir répondre aux besoins de sa clientèle. Son objectif est de prospérer dans  les affaires. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima et la bénie.
texts.en:
Ms. Asina, a courageous and ambitious woman, is the treasurer of the Tusonge Mbele micro-business. She is 53 years old, the mother of seven children all attending school, and is married to an Congolese government agent.

Since 1997 she has been a retail merchant at the local market, and is requesting this new loan to buy one 100-kilo bag of cassava flour so she can meet her customers' needs.

Her objective is to prosper in business. So she thanks and blesses Hekima.

loans.use: buy one 100-kilo bag of cassava flour

loans.name: 06 Thôn 5 Quảng Lưu Group

texts.en:
Ms. Nguyệt works in agriculture, farming poultry. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby chickens to raise and sell in the future.

Nguyệt is 42 years old and she is married with 3 children. She is the leader of a four member group, the 06 Thôn 5 Quảng Lưu solidarity group. 

This is Nguyệt's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years, and one of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Nguyệt hopes for her business to do well, for her children to find a good job, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase baby chickens to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: He Muong 1 Group

texts.en:
Thuong is a Thai woman, who was elected by six other Thai members to be the team leader of He Muong 1 Group. She lives with her husband, along with her parents-in-law and her two school-aged children in a small Thai traditional house. Her parents-in-law are old and weak, so Thuong and her husband are the breadwinners and they are attempting to earn more to cover all living expenses, and also the tuition fees for their children. 

Agriculture production is their main source of income, and they continuously diversify their activities, such as cultivating rice, maize, vegetables, raising pigs, chickens, ducks and buffaloes. They also have to work for a local construction employer to earn a higher income for a more abundant life. This is Thuong's third loan in the Anh Chi Em program. She said that she has benefited a lot from the loans and the interesting training lessons of Anh Chi Em. This time, Thuong will use the loan to buy one more buffalo to expand her farming. She hopes to learn more in the next training sessions, especially about farming and breeding techniques, and knowledge about personal financial management. 

Thuong dreams that her two children will study in a famous university and have a good job with a better life than her in the future. In the picture, Thuong is standing first from the right.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo.

loans.name: 01Kim Tân - Hoằng Tiến Group

texts.en:
Tâm is applying for a loan to improve her business. She has a retail business selling incense and ghost money.

Tâm is 45 years old and she is married with two children. She is the group leader of the 01Kim Tân - Hoằng Tiến solidarity group, which consists of four members. Tâm lives and works in the Hoang Hoa district, which is a rural area in the Thanh Hoa province.

This is Tâm's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years, and one of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

Tâm hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, to maintain a successful business, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more incense and ghost money.

loans.name: 05 Trường Thi Group

texts.en:
Loan is 58 years old, married and has two children. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province. Loan operates a food stall / restaurant selling liquor, beer and snacks. She is applying for a loan to improve her business.

She is the group leader of the 05 Trường Thi solidarity group, which consists of three members. This will be her first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.

Loan has been involved in her business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Loan hopes to build a new house, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase more liquor, beer and snacks to resell.

loans.name: 16 Thắng Hùng Hải Lộc Group

texts.en:
Kiên is 49 years old and is married with three children. 

She has a business manufacturing mats, and has been involved in this business for nine years. She is requesting a loan to purchase sedge to weave the mats so she can sell them.		

Kiên is the group leader of the 16 Thắng Hùng Hải Lộc solidarity group, which consists of three members. She joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women in 2014 to improve her business. Kiên has already successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

The main harship that Kiên faces in her business is not having a valid address to obtain seeds, material, or goods. In the future, Kiên hopes to build a new house, for her business to do well, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase sedge to weave the mats so she can sell them.

loans.name: Gerber Anibal

texts.es: Gerber de 47 años de edad es muy amable y trabajador, vive con su esposa y sus hijos, El trabaja muy duro en su propia parcela donde siembra maíz y frijol; sus productos son de muy buena calidad, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que están cerca de su lugar de residencia. Gerber solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL para contar con el dinero necesario e invertir en la compra de insumos agrícolas como controles de plagas, fertilizantes, abonos, semillas entre otras cosas que necesita para su siembra y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografia, él ansía aumentar sus ventas para poder percibir mayores ganancias y darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Gerber, who is 47 years old, is very friendly and hard-working. He lives with his wife and their children. He works very hard on his own parcel of land, where he plants corn and beans. His products are of very good quality. He sells his products at the various markets that are near his place of residence. Gerber is applying to INTEGRAL for a loan in order to have the money necessary to invest in the purchase of agricultural supplies such as pest controls, fertilizers, compost, and seeds, among other items that he needs for his planting and to improve his land, which is shown in the photograph. He is eager to increase his sales in order to be able to receive greater earnings and give his family better economic stability.

loans.use: to buy pest controls, fertilizers, compost, and seeds, among other items that he needs for his planting and to improve his land.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en: Maribel is 34 years old, married and has three children. She manages a variety store selling beauty products, cellular phone accessories, school supplies and clothes. Her spouse is an Overseas Filipino Worker (OFW), and they need to work and earn for their children’s futures. Maribel wanted to expand her business which is why she is now asking for additional capital of 35,000 PHP to buy school supplies for the next school year such as bags, notebooks, umbrellas, and pens. She will also add clothes and slippers to sell. This will help increase her sales and gain additional profits. She hopes to keep selling affordable items and someday improve her stall by making it bigger in order to display more items in it.

loans.use: to buy school supplies such as bags, notebooks, umbrellas, and pens to sell.

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en: Mercedita is 49 years old and has four children. She doesn't use her hardships in life as a reason to fail to provide for the needs of her children. She always finds a way to let her children experience a better way of living. Sending her children to school was one of her greatest achievements. Mercedita's source of income is from her retailing business. She is engaged in selling grocery items in her village. Mercedita has been managing the business for 10 years. She always assures that there are groceries in stock to sell in order to maintain her regular customers. Mercedita is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy drinks and groceries to sell. She hopes to develop the business and earn a bigger income for the future of her children.

loans.use: to buy drinks and groceries to sell.

loans.name: Lailanie

texts.en:
Lailanie is a faithful wife. She lives with her husband in their simple house at Baggao. She had three children. 

In her direct-selling business, she was able to provide for her family’s daily meals. Her children also help her in other expenses because they are already employed. Lailanie’s spouse is a farmer and a furniture-maker too. A year ago, she was able to close her small store and engaged herself into a direct-selling business where the sales-capacity is higher than in a retail store in their village due to competitors. 

She is now asking for a loan of PHP 25,000 to invest in her direct-selling business. She will buy more underwear, perfume, wallets and bags to sell. It will help increase her sales and profits as well. Someday, she hopes to increase her business and also improve her hog raising business for additional income.

loans.use: to buy more underwear, perfume, wallets and bags to sell.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en: Angelina is a responsible housewife who supports her husband to gain income. She is 53 years old and blessed with two children. They live in a rural community and make their living through farming. To have an additional source of income, Angelina is engaged in cooking and selling snack foods within her community. She aims to improve and strengthen this business in order to generate a higher income. Due to insufficient capital, she wants to avail a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy flour, cassava, sugar, milk and other ingredients she needs to cook and sell in the local community. She is hoping that her loan will be a great help for her to improve the business.

loans.use: to buy flour, cassava, sugar, milk and other ingredients

loans.name: 01An Hảo Hoằng Trạch Group

texts.en:
Tùng is a 64-year-old single woman with 3 children.  Tùng lives in Hoang Hoa district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

She raises chickens and pigs. Tùng has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.  She requests a loan to invest in her business.  
The main hardship that Tùng faces in her business is the lack of capital.

Tùng is the group leader of the 01An Hảo Hoằng Trạch solidarity group, which consists of 4 members.   This is her first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.  With her business profit, Tùng hopes to buy her own land, a motorbike, and business supplies and equipment.

loans.use: to purchase feed for chickens and pigs.

loans.name: Nhóm 07 Thôn 6 Quảng Giao Group

texts.en:
Mây raises pigs.  Mây has been involved in this business for 8 years.  One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.  She requests a loan to purchase piglets to raise and sell in the future. 

Mây is 29 years old and is married with 1 child.  She is the group leader of the Nhóm 07 Thôn 6 Quảng Giao  solidarity group, which consists of 3 members. 

In 2009, Mây joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Mây has successfully repaid 5 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

With her business profit, Mây hopes for her business to do well, to build a new house, and to make enough money to provide for her children.

loans.use: to purchase piglets to raise and sell.

loans.name: 0703 Đông Vệ Group

texts.en:
Hạnh has a service business to transport and sell gasoline.  Hạnh has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.  The main hardship that Hạnh faces  is the lack of capital.  She requests a loan to invest in her business. 

Hạnh is 48 years old and is married with 2 children.  She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, a urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with 1 dependent.

In 2013, Hạnh joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Hạnh has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  She is the group leader of the 0703 Đông Vệ solidarity group, which consists of 3 members. 

With her business profit, Hạnh hopes for her family to be healthy and happy,her business to do well, and her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase gasoline to resell.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena has been helping her husband, working on their own farm to make a living. For more than two years, the couple has earned well for the family.

She gained access to micro finance services after joining GDMPC; it gave her the ability to increase her business through some training provided to members. 

To improve the farm, Lorena had to take a new loan to buy organic fertilizer. Lorena wants to improve the general living situation of the entire family in the future.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Anniette

texts.en:
Anniette is a 38-year-old married woman who is trying hard to provide for her family needs, including food, health, clothing, and education. 

She is in the retail business, selling grocery goods in their village, while her husband does fishing. Through her business, she earns well to support the household expenditure. In order to improve sales in the near future, she has requested a loan to purchase more grocery goods to resell. 

In the future, she wants to improve the general living situation of the family.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery goods to resell.

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas is a 38-year-old married woman. She has six children. 

Dorcas describes herself to be industrious. She operates a retail business where she sells sugar, maize, rice and other items. She has been involved in this business for 20 years. Her business is located in a good market and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate capital. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, bread, rice and other items. Her business goal is to have multiple shops within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have improved her livelihood. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy more stock of sugar, bread, rice and other items.
